loans.name: Mamuka

texts.en:
37 year old Mamuka lives in Rustavi district, with his wife Mzia and 20 year old son Vladimer. Mamuka requested loans from local financial institutions several times for a family start-up business, but without any success. His loan request was rejected every time, because of low income and family’s poor living conditions.

Mamuka is an instructor. He has a car and he gives private driving lessons to people who want a drivers license. Mamuka earns a small monthly income, which is the only source of living for the family.

Mamuka requested a loan from Credo to start a family business. He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program involves providing business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions, to the rural poor, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With his credit, Mamuka will install the gas system in his car to drive it as taxi. As gas is much cheaper then petrol, Mamuka will significantly decrease the expenses and increase his profit. He will drive long hours to earn good income for his family. Mamuka wants to save money to provide a proper education for his son Vladimer.

loans.use: To install the gas system in his car to drive it as taxi

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en: Mahmoud is a 36 year-old married father of two. He and his family are Palestinian and live in a marginalized Palestinian camp in the South of Lebanon.  He has a sandwich shop, and occasionally works as a painter on construction sites. His wife is currently unemployed, which makes him the only financial provider of the family.  Both his children are enrolled in private schools, which mean that he has to settle the schooling tuition fees, in addition to his regular family expenses. He decided to acquire a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase a car for his family, which would truly facilitate their lives.  His previous loan from Al Majmoua helped him continue to build his house.

loans.use: to purchase a car for his family, which would truly facilitate their lives

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 53 years old.  She is married and has three children.

Erlinda works hard to provide for her family.  She runs a general store in the Philippines and has been in business for seven years.  She also earns an income from a prepaid mobile load business.  She has requested a loan of 23,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy items like soap, canned goods, milk and sugar to stock and sell.  Prior to requesting this loan, Erlinda has borrowed and repaid seven loans from NWTF. 

Erlinda aspires to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy items like soap, canned goods, milk and sugar to stock and sell.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 29 years old. He lives in Ozurgeti district, Natanebi village with his 26 year old wife and parents. George requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for family start-up business, but without any success. His loan request was rejected every time, because of low income and family’s poor living conditions.

George's family runs an agricultural business. They own a plot of land where nut, mandarin and lemon trees are grown. Harvested products are sold at the local markets and they earn a small monthly income, which is barely enough to feed 4 members family.

George requested a loan from Credo to start a family business. George has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program involves providing business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions, to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income.

With his credit, George will open a car service center. George will fix the cars himself. He used to work as a car artisan before. As local people know this, it will help him to have a good client base, leading to a good profit. He will reinvest part of the profit in his business, in order to expand it. He wants to improve his family's living conditions and is willing to work hard and for long hours to achieve his goal.

loans.use: To open a car service center.

loans.name: Guram

texts.en:
Guram is 60 years old. He lives in Borjomi district with his 31 year old son George and 36 year old daughter Lia. Guram requested loans from local financial institutions several times for family business, but without any success. His loan request was rejected every time, because of low income and family’s poor living conditions.

Guram’s son George works as a border police officer, his daughter Lia is a social worker. They both work on small monthly salaries, which is the only source of income for the family. Guram requested a loan from Credo to start a family business. He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program involves providing business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions, to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income.

With his credit Guram will renovate the house and fix his damaged car. His house was burned and was destroyed. Now he wants to renovate it to rent it out to tourists. After fixing his car Guram will drive it as a taxi. Borjomi district is developing as a summer tourist area and there are a lot of people visiting during the season. Guram will be able to earn good profit from renting the house and also driving the taxi. With the increased income He will be able to make a better life for the family

loans.use: To renovate his house to rent to tourists and to fix his damaged car to drive as a taxi.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina is 38 and a vulnerable ethnic Egyptian Albanian who is married and has two children.  They are 16 and 17 and attend public secondary school in their rural village in Southeastern Albania. 

Agriculture is the only activity that Valentina has been practicing for the past 10 years, and through this she has generated an income for all her family.  She has been selling her fresh produce to the local market of a main city in her vicinity.

“I bring home some money, and this is very important in our situation because at least we have the basic food on our table. Maybe we need more money, and that is true, but this is what we have been blessed with, and I am very grateful for it," Valentina said.

Valentina is requesting this loan to install doors and windows in her family home, which you can see in the background of the photo.

loans.use: to install windows and doors in her family home.

loans.name: Scholastica

texts.en:
Scholastica is a 40-year-old woman.  She is married to Edward and the mother of three children.  She runs a beauty salon in Kiambu and she has been in this business for 13 year.  She earns a monthly income of forty thousand shillings.

This will be Scolastica's first loan from KADET LTD.  She plans to use the entire loan to buy a new blow drier and hairpieces.  

In the future she wants to be a successful business lady.

loans.use: to buy a new blow drier and hairpieces  for use in the salon.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 48 years old.  She is married and has one child.

Marites works hard to provide for her family.  She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 19,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy additional items like canned goods, sugar, milk, eggs and chips to stock and sell.  Prior to requesting this loan, Marites has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF.  She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from selling rice.

Marites aspires to build and expand her business in order to secure her family’s future.

loans.use: to buy items like canned goods, sugar, milk, eggs and chips to stock and sell.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en:
Edwin is a 41 year old man from Kanyamkago location in Migori county, which is found within western part of Kenya.  He is married and supports six people in his family.  He has three children whose ages are fifteen, five and three respectively.

He has been an electrician for the last 11 years and makes a monthly income of KES. 15,000.  He has applied for his second loan with KADET LTD, which he will use to purchase working tools for his workstation. He will use the anticipated profit to venture into crop farming, and use part of it to sustain his electrical business.

His dream is to expand the business, and be able to employ more people as he ventures into farming.

loans.use: To purchase tools

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan lives in the Eldoret area of Kenya, which is training grounds for many of Kenya's Olympic runners.  Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, crops.  She has 6 children and has been doing this work for 5 years. 

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: 'horticulture!' Her biggest challenge is 'drought.' Animals on the farm have been given the names of 'null.'

Susan was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: 'because it deals with smallholder farmers.'  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'record keeping.'

Her highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked 'How will this loan benefit your family?', Susan replied 'will assist in the payment of school fees.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Susan owns the following: 'cow, poultry' but does not own 'pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'mosquito net' but does not have 'electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine, TV, DVD'.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down."

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Guram

texts.en:
Guram is 28 years old. He lives in a small village Mereti, Gori district with his wife, retired parents and two children (1 and 6 years old). Guram requested loans from local financial institutions several times for family start up business, but without any success. His loan request was rejected every time, because of low income and family’s poor living conditions.

The main source of the income for the family is from agricultural activities. In particular, they have a plot of land, where plum and apple trees are grown. Harvested products are sold at the local markets. Family has an additional income from Guram’s parent’s monthly pension. The family's total monthly income is 425 Gel. This amount is barely enough to feed 6 members family.

Guram requested a loan from Credo to start a family business. He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program involves providing business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions, to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income.

With his credit Guram will purchase a milk cow. The cow will be milked every day to produce dairy products. Guram will sell the products at the local market and earn a profit. He is a very hard working man and in the future plans to reinvest the profit in development of the dairy farm by purchasing more milk cows and selling more dairy products. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan, will give the family an opportunity to cover the food expenses, purchase household items and help improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase a milk cow.

loans.name: Leonorica

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Leonorica works hard to support her family.

She has a general store in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from prepaid mobile load.  Leonorica is borrowing PHP 22000 through NWTF to buy additional items like soap, can goods, chips, egg, noodles, etc. to sell at her general store.

Leonorica has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to expand her business and to be able to afford her children's education.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like soap, canned goods, chips, eggs, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Bilal

texts.en:
Bilal is a 33-year-old married father of two children. He works as a delivery employee for a restaurant during the daytime and is a night security employee at a public school during the night. His wife is a housekeeper, and they all live in the basement of the public school in which Bilal is employed. 

Their combined salary is below the acceptable line to live a healthy life. Bilal decided to contact Al Majmoua because he needs a loan to settle some family expenses.

loans.use: to settle some family expenses.

loans.name: Natela

texts.en:
Natela is 63 years old. She lives in the small village of Kobuleti District, with 4 children and a daughter-in-law. Natela requested loans from local financial institutions several times for a family start-up business, but without any success. Her loan request was rejectedevery time, because of low income and family’s poor living conditions. The family is actively involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have 5 hectare agricultural land for mandarin trees and 2 hectares, where maize is grown. Natela and her children work hard to insure in a good harvest, which is sold locally as well as in the nearby villages at a good price. Besides, Natela is provided with a retirement pension, which is the only source of regular monthly income for the family (125 Laris per month). It is hardly enough to provide food for the family. According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. Natela requested a loan from Credo to start-up family business. She has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program involves providing business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions, to rural poor people who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income.

With his credit Natela will begin trade in fruits and vegetables. She plans to purchase fruits and vegetables at wholesale prices and then resell at higher price, which will significantly increase her income. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to begin  trade with fruits and vegetables

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 33 years old. He lives in Shorapani village, Zestaponi district with his 32 year old wife, mother and two daughters (8 and 10 years old). George requested loans from local financial institutions several times for family business, but without any success. His loan request was rejected every time, because of low income and family’s poor living conditions.

His family owns a vineyard and a plot of agricultural land, where nut trees are grown. George harvests the products to sell at the local markets and earns a small income for the family. His wife trades clothes with the villagers. Family total income is barely enough to cover their monthly expenses.

George requested a loan from Credo to start-up family business. George has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program involves providing business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions, to rural poor people who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income.

With his credit George will purchase sheep and piglets. From the sheep George will sell lamb, after raising piglets he will sell them as a meat and this business will bring him a good profit. George will reinvest part of the profit in his agriculture, in order to develop it. Another part he will use for family well being. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loans will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: To purchase sheep and piglets

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Suma Sartasiñani Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SUMA SARTAWI” iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Ines es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de chuño y mote, tienda de barrio, venta de salchipapa, venta de lana, venta de ropa, venta de chompas, venta de tucumanas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Ines es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido y venta de chompas; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió por iniciativa propia, ya que contaba con esa habilidad del tejido y lo volvió negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana) que adquirirá de las empresas distribuidoras y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener sus estudios pues ella es casada y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud.
texts.en:
The communal bank group "SUMA SARTAWI" is beginning its third loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of Centro Focal de Panamericana. The group is made up of nine members and is governed by a board of directors. Ines is the President. The businesses run by the group's members are diverse, including stores selling chuño (artisanal freeze-dried potato traditionally made in Peru) and mote (boiled corn), a neighborhood store, and sales of salchipapas (fried potatoes with hot dog), wool, clothing, sweaters, and tucumanas (a meat-filled pastry). This new loan will help small business owners in the group, of which Ines is a member.

Ines got involved with Pro Mujer a year ago through the invitation from a friend who was already a member. She currently owns her own business selling  crocheted goods and sweaters. Ines is married and has five children. She opened this business own her own. She already knew how to crochet, so she turned it into a business. 

This loan will help Ines by increasing her capital so that she can buy wool from some distributors that she can later use to make goods to sell. This type of work allows her to keep up with her studies. Ines likes working with Pro Mujer because of the health services it offers.

loans.use: to buy wool.

loans.name: Lausina

texts.en:
Lausina is 38 years old.  She is married and has five children. 

She would like to start growing taro to earn a living.  Lausina has requested a loan to buy a back-mounted sprayer, chemicals, bush knives, a file for sharpening, fertilizer and a crowbar.  She became a member of SPBD in 2013.  

Lausina will use the profit she earns to pay for her children’s school fees and to improve her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a back-mounted sprayer, chemicals, bush knives, a file for sharpening, fertilizer and a crowbar.

loans.name: Felistus

texts.en:
Felistus, a 50-year-old woman from Shirere Kakamega county, located in western Kenya, is married to Evans, who is also a businessman in the same location. She supports seven people in her family and has three children who are 26, 25 and 21 years old.

Felistus sells new clothes and curtains, a business she has been in for the last 24 years, earning a comfortable monthly income of KES. 6,000. She is taking her third loan with KADET LTD to purchase more curtains and new clothes to sell, and will reinvest the anticipated profits in the business.

Felistus's dream is to become a supplier and have a stable income.

loans.use: To purchase new clothes and curtains for resale.

loans.name: Holger Manuel

texts.es: El Señor Holger vive en la ciudad de La Libertad,  que esta ubicada en el perfil costanero del Ecuador, uno de sus primeros negocios fueron: una panadería y posteriormente un local de venta de desayunos, actualmente tiene una tienda (es un local donde se venden productos de consumo masivo al por menor), el mismo esta abierto al publico en general todos los días y es atendido personalmente con la ayuda de su hermano, la idea de realizar los prestamos en Banco D-MIRO es tener un local bien surtido de mercadería y ofrecer productos   de buena calidad para tener a sus clientes contentos y satisfechos, comprando productos de primera necesidad.
texts.en:
Holger lives in the city of La Libertad, which is on the Ecuadorian coast.  Some of his first businesses were a bakery and then a place where he sold breakfasts.  He currently has a store (in a place where products for mass consumption are sold wholesale).  The store is open to the general public every day.  He personally tends to the store, with the help of his brother.

The reason for the loan with Banco D-MIRO is to have a place that is well-stocked with merchandise and to offer good quality products.  He will do this in order for his customers to be happy and satisfied buying basic needs products.

loans.use: to buy basic needs products.

loans.name: Arenas Del Mar Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ARENAS DEL MAR” iniciará el décimo quinto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Cascada, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora María es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tienda de mantas, venta de ropa de bebe, carnicería, venta de mantas de alpaca, venta de comida, venta de helados, puesto de refrescos y gelatinas, tienda de barrio.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora María es integrante, ella indica que hace cuatro años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarles a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de barrio; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió por iniciativa propia, al observar la carencia de este negocio en su zona.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de arroz, azúcar y harina) que adquirirá de las empresas distribuidoras y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener  a su familia ya que ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el trabajo en Banca Comunal.

En la imagen no esta una señora porque fue a realizarce el control médico.
texts.en:
The communal bank “ARENAS DEL MAR” will begin its fifteenth season with Pro Mujer (For Women) as part of the Centro Focal de Cascada. The group is comprised of nine members and is governed by a Board of Directors and María, their Secretary. The members of the communal bank run various businesses including: a store that sells blankets, selling clothes for infants, a butcher shop, selling blankets made of alpaca wool, food sales, ice cream sales, a snack kiosk, and a corner store. 

The loan will benefit these small business owners, including María. She explains that she joined Pro Mujer (For Women) four years ago at the invitation of a representative of the institution who paid her a visit at home. Her current business is a corner store. She began this business on her own initiative when she noticed that her neighbourhood was lacking a store. 

The loan will be used to increase resources; to purchase flour, sugar and rice from distributors. These items will later be sold at her place of business. This type of work allows her to generate resources to maintain her family as best she can. She is married and has two children. When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer (For Woman), her answer is that she likes that they work with communal banks. 

One of ladies is missing from the photo because she was getting a medical checkup.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar and flour.

loans.name: Teresa De Jesús

texts.es:
Teresa tiene  45 años de edad, esta casada. Desde hace 20 trabaja en la agricultura junto con su esposo y es su única fuente de ingresos. Debido a su pobreza no asistieron a la escuela. A pesar de no tener hijos por ser infértil uno de ellos, han trabajo juntos muy fuertes el cultivo de maíz en las faldas de un cerro, los insumos los trasladan en la espalda durante varios kilómetros. Para salir a comprar los insumos, ella debe caminar a pie un kilómetro hasta llegar al lugar en donde pasa el autobús que la conduce a la ciudad, el viaje tarda unos treinta minutos.  

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar 6 sacos de abono, entre otros insumos agrícolas para cultivar 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz y 7,000 metros cuadrado de fríjol. Al comprar todos los insumos de una sola vez, los aplicara en el tiempo oportuno y en las cantidades correctas; además que evitara salir del pueblo tan seguido a adquirirlos. Ella sueña con poseer unas dos vacas lecheras para mantener siempre la alimentación y vender leche a los vecinos.
texts.en:
Teresa is 45 and married. She has worked in agriculture for 20 years with her husband, and it is her only source of income. Because of poverty, she and her husband did not go to school. Despite not having children because one of them is infertile, they have worked very hard together cultivating corn at the foot of a hill. They carry their supplies on their backs for several kilometres. In order to go out and buy new supplies, Teresa has to walk one kilometre on foot to the bus stop. She will then take the bus to the city, a journey which takes about thirty minutes.
This loan from Fundacion Campo is for the purchase of six bags of fertilizer and other supplies for cultivating 7,000 square metres of corn and 7,000 square metres of beans. Once she has purchased all the supplies all at once, she will apply them at the right time and in the right quantity. She won't have to go out multiple times to acquire them. She dreams of having two dairy cows in order to always have a source of nutrition and to sell milk to the neighbours.

loans.use: to buy six bags of fertilizer and other agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Abelina Del Carmen

texts.es: Abelina es una mujer, acompañada, emprendedora y preocupada por el aprendizaje de los niños que son el futuro de nuestro país, actualmente se desempeña como maestra de educación primaria en  un centro educativo de la localidad donde habita, con 14 años de ejercer dicha profesión,  con  tres personas a su cargo a las cuales les brinda todo el apoyo para su desarrollo, esta profesora visito ceprodel para solicitar un financiamiento que le urge para invertirlo en el pago de legalización de un terreno, ya que de esa manera mejorara su desarrollo personal y el de su núcleo familiar.
texts.en: Abelina is in a relationship. She is enterprising and very concerned with the education of children, as they are the future of our country. She currently works as an elementary school teacher in a local educational centre. She has taught for 14 years. She has three people under her care and whom she supports in every aspect of their development. This teacher has come to Ceprodel to request a loan to invest in paying for the legalization of a plot of land, since this will improve her personal circumstances and those of her nuclear family.

loans.use: to pay to legalize a plot of land.

loans.name: Martha  Lucia

texts.es: La señora Martha Lucia es una mujer visionaria y esforzada que siempre está enfocada al mejoramiento del nivel de vida, trabaja  como Directora en un centro escolar de primaria donde habita, organizando y dirigiendo a todo el personal  del centro y al mismo tiempo garantizando una buena enseñanza y disciplina de sus alumnos, esta señora actualmente presenta una necesidad de mejorar su vivienda, por eso visito a ceprodel para solicitar financiamiento para utilizarlo en la compra de materiales de construcción como: Compra  hierro , golosos , cemento, arena, clavos y mano de obra y de esa manera crear  mejores condiciones para  su familia.
texts.en: Martha Lucia is a visionary woman who is always focused on improving her standard of living. She works as the principal of a local elementary-level education centre. She organizes and directs all the staff of the centre and ensures good teaching and discipline for her students. She now needs to improve her home, so she has come to Ceprodel to request a loan for the purchase of construction materials such as iron, screws, cement, sand, and nails, and to pay the labourers. This will create better conditions for her family.

loans.use: to buy iron, screws, cement, sand, and nails, and to pay the labourers.

loans.name: Maria De Jesus

texts.es: La señora María  es una mujer preocupada por la enseñanza de los demás, de `profesión maestra de educación primaria,  es casada con 6 personas a su cargo al que le brinda todo el apoyo para su desarrollo, actualmente está solicitando un financiamiento para la Compra de materiales  como cemento, zinc, hierro, tablas, alambre de amarre, perlines, golosas, clavos, ladrillo rojo, piedrín, arena, soldadura y mano de obra  de esa manera mejorarle las condiciones  de vida a su nucleo familiar ya que es muy numeroso, agradeciéndole a ceprodel y a los inversionistas por  lo oportuno del crédito y que beneficien a los sectores más necesitados que carecen de estos recursos.
texts.en: María is a woman who is very concerned with the education of others. She is an elementary school teacher, married, and has six people under her care and whom she supports in all aspects of their development. She is requesting a loan for the purchase of materials such as cement, zinc, iron, planks, wire, screws, red bricks, stone, sand, and to pay for soldering and labour. This will improve her family's living conditions; it is a very large family. She thanks Ceprodel and the lenders for this opportunity and for helping in the areas where it is most needed and there is a lack of such resources.

loans.use: to buy materials like cement, zinc, iron, planks, wire, screws, nails, red bricks, stone, and to pay for soldering and labour.

loans.name: 20 De Diciembre Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “20 DE DICIEMBRE” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Virginia es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: costura de edredones, venta de huesos, agencia de empleo, venta de CD’s, costura de pantalones, costura de balones de cuero, venta de ropa.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Virginia es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una cuñada que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de productos de belleza; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió por recomendación de una amiga y está trabajando en el mismo hace un año.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra productos de belleza) que adquirirá de las empresas distribuidoras y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia, ya que ella vive en concubinato.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el crédito.
texts.en:
The “20 DE DICIEMBRE” Communal Bank is starting its first cycle in  Pro Mujer as part of the Panamericana Regional Hub. The group has eight members and is governed by a board of directors of whom Virginia is the secretary. The members' businesses are varied and include: quilting, egg sales, an employment agency, CD sales, making pants, making balls, and clothing sales.
This loan will benefit these small businesses. Virginia is a group member and says that she has been part of Pro Mujer for one year. She joined at the invitation of a sister-in-law who is a member of the institution. She has a business selling beauty products. She says that she started this business at the recommendation of a friend and has been in the business for one year.
This loan is for an increase in working capital (the purchase of beauty products). She will acquire products from the distribution companies and then sell them in her sales space. This work allows her to generate an income to support her family. She is in a relationship.
When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responded that she likes the loans.

loans.use: to buy beauty products.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase clothes

loans.name: Alejandro Antonio

texts.es:
Alejandro tiene  37 años de edad, esta casado y tiene cuatro hijos. Desde muy pequeño sus padres le enseñaron a trabajar en la agricultura, ya que era la única forma de subsistir. Él apenas sabe leer, por o que se le hace difícil encontrar otro tipo de trabajo, por lo que la agricultura se ha convertido en su única fuente de ingresos, para cubrir los gastos del hogar y enviar a sus hijos a la escuela.  Además, de trabajar en lo propio con sus cultivos, también ayuda a otros agricultores a terminar sus cultivos, por lo que recibe un pago. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar 4 sacos de abono, entre otros insumos agrícolas para cultivar 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz y 7,000 metros cuadrado de fríjol. Al comprar todos los insumos de una sola vez, conseguirá a un mejor precio y los aplicara en el tiempo; además que evitara salir del pueblo tan seguido a adquirirlos. Su objetivo, es proporcionar el estudio a sus hijos para que sean unos profesionales y construir su propia casa.
texts.en:
Alejandro is 37 years old, he is married and has four children. Since he was a small child, his parents taught him to work in farming, since it was the only way to survive. He hardly knows how to read, so it is difficult for him to find any other type of work, so farming has become his only source of income to cover the costs of the home and to send his children to school. As well as working on his own land with his crops he also helps other farmers to finish their crops, for which he receives payment.

The loan that he is seeking from Fundación Campo is to buy 4 bags of fertilizer, along with other farming supplies, in order to cultivate 7,000 square meters of corn and 7,000 square meters of beans. By buying the supplies all at once he will obtain a better price and he will use them over a period of time. In addition, he will avoid having to leave town so often to get them. His objective is to provide an education for his children so that they become professionals and to build his own house.

loans.use: to buy 4 bags of fertilizer, along with other farming supplies, in order to cultivate 7,000 square meters of corn and 7,000 square meters of beans.

loans.name: Merab

texts.en:
Merab is 46 years old. He lives in Khelvachauri district with his wife and two children. Merab requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time, because of his low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

Merab has a café. He is selling Georgian cheese bread and some Georgian national food there to earn a small monthly income. This is the only source of income for living for the family. 

Merab requested a loan from Credo to start up the family business. Merab has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With his credit, Merab will purchase products to make more food in his café. His café is in a populous area and Merab hopes that, if he has more varieties of food to offer to the clients his profit will significantly increase. With the increased profit, Merab will be able to expand his business more and provide a better life for his children.

loans.use: To purchase products to make more food in his café

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is a married woman with children, all of whom attend school. She rents a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family and school fees for the children.

For the past two years, she has operated a charcoal selling business. She sells from her home to her neighbours and passersby. Her major challenge in the business is the high cost of transportation. With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase 6 bags of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase 6 bags of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Salepou

texts.en: Salepou is a 39-year-old woman who is married with 6 children. She plans to start a small business: lawn mowing in her community. Salepou needs a loan to buy a weed eater machine and oil, string and petrol for the weed eater. She will use her profits to buy more weed eater machines. Salepou joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a weed eater machine and oil, string and petrol for the weed eater

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria works hard to support her family. Maria is married and has a fish selling business in the Philippines.

Maria requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell.

Maria has been in this business for 4 years now.

In the future, Maria would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Nikoloz

texts.en:
Nikoloz is 45 years old. He lives in Akhaltsikhe district with his 41-year-old wife, 23-year-old son and retired parents. Nikoloz requested loans from local financial institutions several times for his family business start-up, but without success. His loan requests were rejected because of his low income and his family’s poor living conditions. 
Nikoloz’s father is working at the local petrol station and earns a small monthly income. Nikoloz’s parents' monthly pension provides additional income.
Nikoloz requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. Nikoloz has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With his credit Nikoloz will start trading fruits and vegetables. He used to work in this business before and is very experienced in this field. This will help him to start the new business and make it profitable. Nikoloz will purchase products at the wholesale price and sell them with the price markup from the ground floor in his house. He will invest part of the profit in order to expand the business and have more varieties of products to offer to clients; the other part of the profit he will use for his family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan will significantly improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: To start trading with fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Arkadi

texts.en:
Arkadi is 33 years old. He lives in a small village, Shaumiani, in the Marneuli district with his 23-year-old wife and 57-year-old mother. Arkadi requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time, because of his low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

Arkadi’s mother is working as a cook at the local bakery and earns a small monthly income. The family also has a pig, and they sell piglets at the local markets.

Arkadi requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. Arkadi has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With his credit, Arkadi will purchase a car and start selling vegetables. He will purchase the products from the reseller at the wholesale price and sell them with the price marked up among the villagers and at the local markets. Arkadi will work hard to earn a good profit. He wants to expand his business and make it more profitable, in order to insure better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: To purchase a car and start trading with vegetables

loans.name: Rosalia De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Rosalía es una mujer ejemplar, preocupada por el bien estar de su familia, esforzada para apoyar en el mejoramiento de su casa y darles las condiciones más humanas  a su núcleo familiar, maestra de primaria, es casada con tres hijos a quien  le está proporcionando todo el apoyo para que se desarrolle académica mente.

Actualmente esta señora tiene la urgencia de ser favorecida con un financiamiento, por eso llego a las oficinas de ceprodel, para ser beneficiada, para comprar el material de construcción que requiere para efectuar su obra de mejoramiento mismo, como  Cemento,  Zinc, Hierro  tablas ,Alambre de amarre, perlines , golosos, clavos, ladrillo rojo, piedrín, arena, soldadura y Mano de obra y de esta manera agradece por su buen gesto a ceprodel, por brindarle el apoyo oportuno y necesario a  los sectores más pobres.
texts.en:
Rosalía is an exemplary woman.  She's concerned about her family's welfare and encouraged to help improve her house and give her immediate family more humane living conditions.  An elementary school teacher, she's married and has three children whom she supports completely so they flourish academically.

Currently this woman is in urgent need of getting a loan, so she went to the CEPRODEL offices for help in buying the construction materials she needs to carry out her improvements: cement, sheets of corrugated metal, rebar, boards, wire, support beams, screws, nails, red brick, gravel, sand, solder, and labor.

She's grateful to CEPRODEL for its good gesture of offering opportune and necessary support to poorer sectors.

loans.use: to buy construction materials and pay for labor

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cattle for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Lien's Group

texts.en:
Lien is 55 years old. She has three children – a son and a daughter who have their own families and a daughter who works. Her husband is a farmer. His income is about 2,000,000 VND per month. Lien is a farmer, too. She has done this job for 30 years. Besides that, she makes wine to earn a living. She earns about 6,000,000 VND per month. Her family’s total income is about 8,000,000 VND per month. Her challenge in work is a lack of capital for her business. And she wants to develop her wine making. Her dream is having a sufficient life. This loan is one step in helping her reach this dream. She is a passionate businessman.
She has participated in SEDA’s credit program since 2006. In the last loan cycle, she borrowed 9,810,000 VND and repaid it on time. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 11,118,000 VND to buy rice to make wine and buy food for pigs.
Other members who are part of Lien's group include the following:
Thuyen is 47 years old. She has three children. She is a farmer. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to breed chickens.
Hong is 47 years old. She has two children. She is a farmer. She wants to borrow 7,630,000 VND to breed chickens and pigs. 
Binh is 42 years old. She has two children. She sells meat in the market. She wants to borrow 10,682,000 VND to develop her work. 
Hang is 50 years old. She has two children. She is a farmer. She wans to borrow 10,682,000 VND to breed chickens.

loans.use: to buy rice to make wine and buy food for pigs.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is 40 years old and married with three children.

Vivian works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 13000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items like chips, can goods, soap, and shampoo.

Vivian has borrowed and paid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from mobile prepaid load.

Vivian aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like chips, canned goods, soap, and shampoo.

loans.name: Patricio Jose

texts.es:
Patricio, es un señor preocupado por el bienestar de su familia,  casado, de profesión  Lic. En Derecho, el cual se dedica a la crianza de cerdos  como otra alternativa económica, para obtener mayores ingresos y darle mejor nivel de vida a su núcleo familiar, con 15 años de experiencia en esta labor.   

 Actualmente está solicitando un pequeño financiamiento para mejorar el desarrollo de los cerdos, y lo utilizara en la compra de Cerdos, semolina y maíz ya que con mucho esfuerzos ha venido realizando dichas mejoras apoyada con los financiamientos, por lo tanto le agradece a ceprodel por el apoyo oportuno que le ha  brindado, para poder realizar la inversión deseada ya que  a través del mismo mejorara  las condiciones y nivel  de vida.
texts.en:
Patricio is a man concerned with his family's well-being.  He is married and has a law degree.  He raises pigs as a way to earn extra income and give his nuclear family a better quality of life.  Patricio has fifteen years of experience in this line of work. 

Patricio is currently requesting a small loan to better raise his pigs.  He will use the loan to purchase more pigs, wheat and corn.  Through his hard work, and with the help of the loans, he has been making improvements to his pig-rearing business.  As such, Patricio is grateful to Ceprodel for the timely support they have granted him.  He can make his desired investments, which will improve his standard of living and quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase pigs, wheat and corn.

loans.name: Alma Ligia

texts.es:
La señora Alma Ligia posee un negocio de venta de Ropas ubicada en uno de los mercados más activos del departamento de león.

Ella inicia sus labores muy de mañana a las 7 am para ofrecerles a los diferentes clientes retirándose a su hogar alas 5:30 pm para descansar.

El crédito que está solicitando a Ceprodel será utilizado para compra de pantalones, blusas, faldas, toallas de baños, para así ofrecerle a su clientela una variedad de productos de mejor calidad para satisfacerles su demanda por lo que tendría más ingresos para mejorar su nivel de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Señora Alma Ligia owns a business selling clothing.  It is located in one of the busiest markets in León Department.

She starts her work very early in the morning, at 7:00am, so she can reach different customers.  She returns home 5:30pm to rest. 

Alma is requesting a loan from Ceprodel to purchase pants, blouses, skirts and bath towels.  She will then be able to offer her clientele a variety of high quality products.  By meeting the demand, she will earn a larger income and improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to purchase blouses, skirts and pants.

loans.name: Bedrije

texts.en:
Residents of a little town in the southeastern Albania where Bedrije resides, who happen to have known her for long time, have commented on Bedrije as being “the nicest and the most peaceful lady in the town."
 
She is a married vulnerable ethnic Egyptian and has a 19-year-old child. For the past almost 10 years, she’s been offering repairing/sewing services out of her home, in an attempt to make a little income for her family. Kindly note that she has been the only money-maker for their family of three for a very long time, since her husband could not find an odd job that he’s been looking for. 

The loan that Bedrije is requesting is to purchase a TV and a washing machine. This will be her first loan from the institution, yet “there is no doubt that I won’t pay the loan in full and on time,” she stated.

loans.use: to buy a TV and a washing machine.

loans.name: Bonface

texts.en:
Bonface is a 33-year-old man from Kisumu. He is married to Maureen who is a business lady. He supports three people in his family and has one child who is two years old.

He sells second hand clothes, a business he has been doing for the last three years and makes a monthly income of KES 28,000. He is taking his first loan with KADET LTD, which he will use to purchase more bales of second hand clothes for resale. He will use the anticipated profit to plow back into the business.

His dream is to become a stable businessperson who can comfortably take good care of his family.

loans.use: To purchase more second hand clothes for resale.

loans.name: Dolores De Concepción

texts.es:
La Joven Dolores de la Concepción, posee un negocio de venta de agua, gaseosas, jugos y frutas   ubicado en  la ciudad de León, desde hace seis años, ella realiza esta labor para llevar el sustento a su familia, es madre soltera de tres hijos menores de edad  que están bajo su responsabilidad.

 Sale de su casa de habitación a las 5:00 am  abre su negocio a las 6:00 am y finalizando sus labores a las 4:00 pm  este trabajo  lo realiza  de lunes a sábado en este mismo horario,  Su negocio lo inicio de forma ambulante.

El  crédito que está solicitando a CEPRODEL lo utilizara  para comprar variedad de gaseosas, jugos, frutas y caramelos para ofertarles a toda su clientela, y así obtener  mayores ingresos y le permita mejorar su calidad de vida tanto de ella como la de sus tres hijos.

Los sueños de Dolores es la preparación de sus tres pequeños hijos y lograr a tener su propia vivienda  para darle una mejor comodidad.
texts.en:
The young woman Dolores de la Concepción has had a business for the last six years selling water, soft drinks, juice and fruit in the city of León.  She does this work to support her family.  She is a single mother with three dependent children, for whom she is responsible. 

Dolores leaves her home at 5:00am and is open for business at 6:00am.  She finishes up at 4:00pm.  She works this schedule daily from Monday to Saturday.  She runs her business as a street vendor. 

The loan Dolores is requesting from Ceprodel will be used to purchase a variety of soft drinks, juice, fruit and sweets to offer for sale to her clientele.  This will earn her a greater income and allow her to improve her quality of life and especially that of her three children. 

Dolores hopes to education her three small children and to be able to have her own home, to give her greater comfort.

loans.use: to purchase fruit, soft drinks, water and crackers.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.es:
La señora Rosalina posee un negocio de venta refrescos naturales, ubicadas en unos de los más populosos mercados  de la ciudad león.

Ella inicia sus labores muy de mañana a las 7:30 am para ofrecerles a sus clientes las variedades de riquísimos refrescos naturales para saciar la sed de su clientela retirándose a hogar a las 12:00 pm para descansar.

El crédito que está solicitando a Ceprodel será utilizado para compra de Zinc, arena, cemento ya que necesita mejorar una habitación y así mejorar su nivel de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Señora Rosalina has a business selling natural soft-drinks.  It is located in one of the most populous markets in the city of León.

She starts work early in the morning, at 7:30am.  She offers her customers a variety of delicious natural soft-drinks to quench their thirst.  She returns home at 12:00pm to rest.

Señora Rosalina is requesting a loan from Ceprodel, which will be used to purchase zinc, sand and cement.  She needs to make improvements to a room in her home to improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to purchase zinc, cement and sand.

loans.name: Amiran

texts.en:
Thirty-four-year-old Amiran lives in Ozurgeti district with his wife, father and retired mother.  Amiran requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time, because of his low income and the family’s poor living conditions.
 
The main source of income for the family is the monthly pension of Amiran’s mother. They also own a small plot of agricultural land where maize and nut trees are grown. The harvested products are mainly used for the family and sometimes sold at the local market. Amiran requested a loan from Credo to start a family business. Amiran has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With his credit, Amiran will open a spare parts shop. He will be selling spare parts and tools for different jobs. Amiran will rent a commercial space at a populous area and purchase the products at the wholesale price to resell them at the higher price and earn a good profit.  Amiran is a very hard working man. He wants to expand the business and have a better income for the family so he can provide all the needed household goods and cover all the monthly expenses. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: To open a spare parts shop

loans.name: Malia

texts.en: Malia is a 58-year-old woman who is married with six children. She runs a business selling different merchandize in her community. She has many years of experience with this business. Malia has requested a loan to buy sacks of flour, sugar, boxes of herring, corned beef, dripping oil, yeast, soft drinks, cigarettes, Vailima beer, boxes of milk, mosquito coils and noodles. She plans to use her profits to support her family. She has been a member of SPBD since 2010.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, herring, corned beef, dripping oil, yeast, soft  drinks, cigarettes, Vailima beer, milk, mosquito coils and noodles

loans.name: Cándida De Los Ángeles

texts.es:
La señora Cándida de los Ángeles es profesora de un organismo sin fines de lucro que atiende a los niños que sus madres son comerciantes de los mercados de la ciudad de león.

La señora Cándida de los ángeles esta solicitando el crédito a Ceprodel ya que en estos momentos presenta unos malestares de salud y necesita comprar unos medicamentos y cubrir los gastos de la consulta Médica.
texts.en:
Señora Cándida de los Ángeles is a teacher in non-profit organization that works with children whose mothers have sales stalls in León's markets. 

Señora Cándida de los Ángeles is requesting a loan from Ceprodel because she is having some health problems.  She needs to purchase some medication and pay for the cost of her doctors' visit.

loans.use: to purchase medications and pay for a doctor's visit.

loans.name: Milovan

texts.en:
Milovan is a married 34-year-old male.  He is the father of two children and he and his family live in a minority community. His wife is a housewife and he works at a water company. Currently, they live in a house that is in need of renovation. Due to the high cost of electricity, they want to façade their house in order to save costs on heating in the winter.
 
Milovan is therefore requesting a loan in order to pay to façade his house. This loan will help improve their living conditions and he hopes by doing this they will be able to save some of the money from his salary to ensure financial security. Milovan is very happy for this opportunity and he thanks all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: To pay to façade his house to save heating costs

loans.name: Koxhe

texts.en:
Koxhe is a 54-year-old married father of nine children, the eldest is 30 and the youngest is 13, with some still attending school. Koxhe has been in the animal husbandry business for 20 some years and through this activity, he has been able to raise his children, according to him.  “I have my wife and my unmarried oldest children who help me, basically we are all together in this practice, otherwise, it would be exhausting going alone,” he said smiling.

Koxhe is at the point now where he wants to expand this business by adding some more dairy cows and calves. To achieve this, he needs 200,000 Albanian Lek. “This is not my first time getting a loan from the institution, it’s the fifth, so I have proved myself to be a responsible person;” he said sounding like he was confirming it with himself.

loans.use: To add more dairy cows and calves to his existing herd

loans.name: Trang's Group

texts.en:
Trang is 31 years old. She has two children. Her son and daughter are little. Her husband is a painter. His income is about 7,000,000 VND (Vietnamese dong) per month. Trang sells fruits to earn a living. She earns about 5,000,000 VND per month. She has done this job for three years. Besides that, she also is a farmer. Her family’s total income is about 12,000,000 VND per month. 

Her challenge in work is lacking capital for her business. Her dream is to build a home. This loan is one of the steps that helps her reach this dream. She is hardworking woman and passionate businesswoman.

This is the first time she participates in SEDA’s credit program. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to obtain fruits to sell.

Other members who are part of Trang’s group include the following: 

Ngoc is 25 years old. She has two children. She is a worker. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to breed chickens. 

Thien is 40 years old. She has two children. She is a farmer. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to breed chickens.

Huyen is 29 years old. She has two children. She is a worker. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to breed chickens.

Tiep is 62 years old. She has two children. She is a farmer. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to breed chickens.

loans.use: to obtain fruits to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy oxen that he raises and then resells

loans.name: Ndigue

texts.fr:
Ndigue est un éleveur qui évolue dans le métier depuis plus de 10 ans. Il loge dans un village situé à environ 40 km de la ville principale. Il a tout juste besoin de 300000F CFA pour acheter 2 à 3 bœufs, qu’il va emboucher pour revendre. Il travaille de 7h du matin à 19h du soir en amenant ses bêtes paitre dans les pâturages. 
Il est marié et grâce à l’activité, il gère la dépense quotidienne de son foyer et les autres charges liées aux charges de la maison.
Comme ambition, il désire agrandir davantage son cheptel.
texts.en:
Ndigue is a cattle breeder who has been in the business for over 10 years. He lives in a village about 40 km from the main city.

He just needs 300,000 FCFA to buy 2-3 oxen he will fatten before selling. He works from 7 am to 7 pm in the evening by bringing his animals to graze in the pasture.

He is married and thanks to his business activity, he manages daily household expenses and other financial burdens related to his home.

As ambition, he wants to further expand his livestock.

loans.use: buy cattle to raise for resale

loans.name: Santa

texts.en:
Santa is married and has been blessed with three children. She owns a house that has no electricity and piped water. She cites food and school fees for her children to be her major challenge.

She has operated a pub business in which she sells on a retail basis to her neighbors and town dwellers. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation from the purchase center to her place of operation. 

With the 20,000 Kenyan shillings she wants to purchase more local brew for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase more local brew for sale.

loans.name: Victoria Veronica

texts.en:
Victoria dreams of becoming a professional, but without a degree knows it may never be possible. Victoria was accepted into the Universidad Domingo Savio and now with the chance to achieve her dream is concerned about affording tuition fees. She plans on graduating in December 2013, but without a loan from Vittana she thinks that she may need to take time off to work and save money until she can return to school.

With the loan, Victoria plans on using the loan to cover the cost of her graduation fees. Often there are fees for earning your title in business before graduating. In addition to her responsibilities at school, Victoria currently works 40 hours a week. With a degree in business she expects to earn $18 a day. Unfortunately, Victoria's parents never had the opportunity to complete their high school education. Without the opportunity for a higher degree, her parents never had the chance to move up. Growing up, finances were always tight. With two older siblings Victoria is unsure how she will be able to afford her tuition fees on her own.

This loan is administered by Vittana's partner Banco Fie.

loans.use: To pay for graduation fees

loans.name: Marcos Bladimir

texts.en:
Marcos dreams of becoming a professional. To achieve his goal, Marcos has enrolled in the Universidad Autónoma Juan Misael Saracho. He plans on graduating in January, 2014 but without a loan from Vittana he thinks that he may need to take time off to work and save until he can return to school.

With the loan, Marcos plans on using the funds to pay his tuition while he saves his salary from his part time job. Marcos currently works 25 hours a week. One of his biggest challenges has been making time to work and go to school. Currently Marcos earns $2 a day. With a degree in business he expects to earn $17 a day. Unfortunately, Marcos's parents never had the opportunity to complete their high school education. Without the opportunity for a higher degree, his parents never had the chance to move up. Growing up, finances have always been tight. With three older siblings attending college already, Marcos is unsure how he will be able to finance his education without the assistance of a student loan.

loans.use: To pay for tuition

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Levan

texts.en:
Levan is 42 years old. He lives in a small village in Vartsikhe, Baghdati district, with his wife and two sons. Levan requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The main source of income for the family is from agricultural activities. In particular, they have two milk cows, which are milked every day to produce dairy products. They also have a vineyard, and with the harvested grapes, they make vodka. All the family members are involved in their agriculture and they work hard to earn a small monthly income. Dairy products and vodka are sold at the local market in Baghdati district. The family's additional income is Levan’s salary. He is an artisan and works on private orders on construction and house renovations. 

Levan requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. Levan has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high-risk borrowers” because of their low income. With his credit, Levan will build a greenhouse. He will plant there greens and cucumber. After harvesting the products, they will be sold together with other products at the local market, and the family income will significantly increase. Levan hopes to reinvest the profit in his agriculture, in order to develop it and have a better profit. With the increased profit, Levan will be able to insure a better life for his family.

loans.use: To build a greenhouse.

loans.name: Karen Patricia

texts.en:
Karen has always dreamt of becoming a professional. Karen was accepted into the Universidad Autonoma Tomas Frias and now, with the chance to achieve her dream, is concerned about affording school fees. She expects to graduate in December 2014, but without a loan is unsure how she will be able to continue affording her education. She shares that her alternative would be to take time off from school to work and save money until she could return. Karen shares that it is important to her to graduate on time so she can enter into the job market as soon as possible.

With the loan, Karen plans on purchasing her much needed textbooks and school supplies. With the proper books, Karen feels she will be able to study more effectively and earn better grades. With a career in business, she expects to earn $20 a day, a substantial increase from before. With two older siblings Karen is unsure how she will be able to afford her tuition fees on her own without the assistance of a Vittana Loan.

This loan is administered by Vittana's partner Banco Fie.

loans.name: Elga

texts.en:
Thirty-four-year-old Elga lives in Chokhatauri district with her 37-year-old husband Avtandil. Elga requested a loan from the local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected all the time, because of her low income and her family’s poor living conditions.
 
Elga is a dentist. She has a dental chair in her house and earns a small monthly income, which is the only source of living for the family. Elga requested a loan from Credo to start a family business. Elga has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With her credit, Elga will purchase additional dental equipment. With more equipment, she will be able to offer better services to her clients. Elga is already well known among the villagers and she has a good numbers of clients. With the better service, Elga will increase the number of clients and her family income. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: To purchase additional dental equipment

loans.name: Nanette

texts.en:
Nanette is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell of dried fish business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional stock of dried fish to sell for her buy and sell of dried fish business.

Nanette has been in this business for three years. Nanette earns more income from fishing.

Nanette has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of  saving enough to build a house for her family in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional dried fish to sell

loans.name: Khatuna

texts.en:
Khatuna is 39 years old. She lives in Tsvermaghla village, Ozurgeti district with her husband and retired parents-in-law. Khatuna requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected all the time because of her low income and her family’s poor living conditions. Her family runs an agricultural business. In particular, they have two milk cows and two calves. The cows are milked every day to produce dairy products. The family also owns beehives with bee colonies and a plot of agricultural land, where nut and mandarin trees are grown. All the products are sold at the local market. Khatuna’s husband is working at the local petrol stations as a driver. Her father in-law is also a driver but on a truck for private orders.
 
Khatuna requested a loan from Credo to start a family business. Khatuna has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With her credit, Khatuna will rent a commercial space and purchase grocery stock to open a seasonal grocery store. She used to have this business before and is very experienced in this field. Khatuna will purchase seasonal fruits and vegetables at the wholesale price and sell with a price markup from her shop. This will help her to earn an additional income for the family and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To rent a commercial space and purchase grocery stock to open a seasonal grocery store

loans.name: Noemi

texts.en:
Noemi is 36 years old and has four children. Noemi is married and two of her children are in school.

Noemi is in the agricultural pig-fattening business in the Philippines. Noemi requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional feed for her pigs.

Noemi has been fattening pigs for five years now and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Noemi would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed for her pigs

loans.name: Maurice

texts.fr:
Monsieur Maurice fait de l’embouche depuis plus de 10 ans. Il est marié et père de famille. Il a hérité de cette activité de ses ancêtres qui s’est reproduit de générations en générations. Il possède des bœufs mais veux les renforcer raison pour laquelle, il sollicite l’appui de l’IMCEC.
Il commence sa journée à 6h du matin et termine à 14h et les garde à la maison, l’après-midi. C’est à partir des bénéfices de son activité qu’il fait vivre sa famille.
Avant de connaitre la mutuelle, Maurice n’arrivait pas à épargner, maintenant, il a son plan d’épargne régulier et paye normalement la scolarité de ses enfants
Maurice désir améliorer et maximiser son profit en diversifiant son activité.
texts.en:
Mr. Maurice has been fattening livestock for over 10 years. He is married and a father.

From his ancestors he inherited this occupation which is handed down from generation to generation. He owns oxen but wants to fatten them, which is why he seeks the support of IMCEC.

He starts his day at 6 am, ends at 2 pm and then keeps the cattle at home in the afternoon. It is from the profits of his business that he supports his family.

Before knowing about the institution, Maurice was unable to save, but now he has a regular savings plan, and is able to pay his children's tuition fees.

Maurice wants to improve and maximize his profits by diversifying his business.

loans.use: buy cattle to be raised for several months and then resold

loans.name: Gloria Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Gloria del Carmen posee un negocio de venta de Ropas usada ubicada cerca de la terminal de buses del departamento de león.

Con este negocio la señora gloria del Carmen a brindado a sus hijos la educación necesaria para que hoy en día ellos también sigan sus pasos de ser comerciantes responsables y llegar a ser el soporte de sus familias.

Ella inicia sus labores muy de mañana a las 7 am para ofrecerles a los diferentes clientes retirándose a su hogar alas 5:30 pm para descansar.

El crédito que esta solicitando a Ceprodel será utilizado para compra de pacas de ropas usada, gorras, zapatos y bolsos para así ofrecerle a su clientela una variedad de productos de mejor calidad para satisfacerles su demanda por lo que tendría más ingresos para mejorar su nivel de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Gloria del Carmen has an used clothing business, located close to the bus depot in the area of leon.

With this business Gloria del Carmen has provided her children with the education they needed to one day follow her steps and become responsible merchants and support their families.

She starts work at 7 A.M. to offer her customers great service and closes at 5:30 P.M. to go rest.

The loan requested to Ceprodel will be used to buy packs of used clothing, hats, shoes and handbags to offer her customers a variety of products of good quality and meet their needs, this way she would have more income to improve hers and her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy used clothing, hats, shoes and handbags.

loans.name: Elimane

texts.fr: Monsieur Elimane est un ancien client du Guichet. Il s'active dans l'élevage depuis plus de 10ans, il est marié et pere de famille ; il est agé de 47ans. Il pratique l'embouche ovine et bovine et avec les revenus il gere les dépenses quotidiennes de sa famille et les besoins scolaires de ses enfants. Elimane sollicite ce crédit d'un montant de 500 000F pour pouvoir acheter des boeufs les élever et ensuite les revendre à ses clients potenciels surtout pendant les fêtes religieuses. A l'avenir il voudrait augmenter ses revenus pour améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille
texts.en:
Mr. Elimane is a long-term client of the institution. He has been active in raising livestock for over 10 years. He is a married father and is 47 years old.

He practices the fattening of sheep and cattle, and with the income manages his family's daily expenses and the educational needs of his children.

Elimane is requesting this 500,000 XOF loan to buy cattle to be raised and then resold to his potential customers, especially during religious festivals.

In the future he would like to increase his income to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: Buy cattle to be raised and then resold

loans.name: Marine

texts.en:
Forty-seven-year-old Marine lives in Rustavi district with her husband, George, and two daughters (18 and 21 years old). Marine requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected all the time, because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

Marine is a seller at the local shop and earns a small monthly income. Her husband, George, is diabetic and gets a monthly pension of 70 Lari from the local government institution. The family's total income is so small that it’s rarely enough for food for them.

Marine requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. Marine has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high-risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With her credit, Marine will purchase grocery stock to open a grocery shop. She has already rented a small shop at the local market. Marine is very experienced in this field as she has been a seller for many years, and her experience will help the business to be successful. Part of the profit she will be reinvesting in the same field and purchasing more varieties of groceries in order to provide better service for the customers. Another part will be used to cover the family's monthly expenses. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: To purchase grocery stock to open a grocery shop.

loans.name: Ablaye

texts.fr: Monsieur Ablaye est un homme qui évolue dans le secteur de l'élevage des moutons. IL a une expérience de plus 10ans dans son activité. Il est marié et père de famille, il pris en charges tous les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille. Il est à son 3ème prêt et il n'a jamais eu de problèmes avec l'imcec. Il commence sa journée à 8h pour la terminer à 19h. Il a besoin de ce montant pour pouvoir acheter des moutons, les élever et ensuite les revendre pendant les fetes de tabaski et korité ou les moutons sont très sollités dans le pays . A l'avenir Monsieur Ablaye voudrait avoir un grand magasin de vente d'aliment de betail pour diversifier son activité.
texts.en:
Mr. Ablaye is a man who has been active in the sheep raising sector. He has over 10 years' experience in the business.

He is married and a father, and takes care of all the family's daily expenses.

This is his third loan and he has never had problems with IMCEC. He starts his day at 8 am to finish at 7 pm.

He needs this loan amount to buy sheep, to be raised and then resold in time for the Tabaski and Korité festivities when sheep are very much in demand throughout the country.

In the future Mr. Ablaye would like to open a big store selling livestock feed to diversify his business.

loans.use: Buy sheep to raise and then resell them

loans.name: Kenia Yorleny

texts.es:
Kenia es una mujer joven de 24 años de edad madre de un hijo con un grado de educación de secundaria completa graduada como maestra de educación primaria. Ella en compañía de su pareja trabaja la agricultura en lo que es la siembra y cultivo de café cuando no está en sus labores como maestra de educación. Desde hace más de 5 años practica la agricultura con su pareja pero fueron sus padres los que le enseñaron desde muy joven dicha actividad la cual ha sido medio de ingreso para sus padres y hoy en día no deja de serlo para ella su hijo y su pareja. En sus cultivos son ellos los únicos involucrados en cada una de las diferentes actividades como la limpieza, la poda, la fertilización, riego y abono a cada una de las plantas.

Kenia solicita ayuda para la compra de insumos para dar asistencia y mantenimiento a sus cultivos de café ya que esto ara que su plantación sea más segura este más sana y pueda obtener buenos ingresos al final de la misma.
