Anne is a married woman and has been blessed with six kids who attend school. She lives at her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. 

She operates a poultry-selling business, which has been operational for over 12 years. She mentioned disease outbreak causing losses as a challenge in the business. She dreams of becoming a wholesaler of poultry in the future. 

With the KES 25,000 she wants to purchase chicks and poultry feeds. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and poultry feeds.

loans.name: Nadzua

texts.en:
Nadzua lives in Kaloleni near Mariakani, Kenya. She is married and has four children. For more than five years, buying and selling cattle has been her business. She started with an amount she was given by her father and now she is doing well. She learned of Milango through friends. 

She now seeks a loan of 57,450 Kenya shillings to buy three cattle all for resale. The major challenge she has in this business is theft. Extra income generated from this loan will be used to pay school fees for her children. She has an ambition to buy an acre of land and start rearing animals for milk.

loans.use: To buy three cattle.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane lives in Kaloleni near Mariakani, Kenya. She is married with four children. She has operated a grocery shop in her town for four years now. She started the business with the help of her husband. She learned about Milango through friends. 

She now seeks a loan of 31,450 Kenya shillings to buy a sack of sugar, three bundles of maize flour, four sacks of rice and Royce cubes. The major challenge is price fluctuation and inflation. She wants to grow her business in to a wholesale shop in five years. Extra income as a result of this loan will help her do other viable projects in the future.

loans.use: To buy a sack of sugar, three bundles of maize flour, four sacks of rice and Royce cubes.

loans.name: Smily

texts.en:
Smily is a married woman with one child. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

She operates a food-making business, making consumables like beans and chapati (flat bread) which she sells to passersby and neighbours. She mentioned high cost of purchasing food stuff to be her major challenge. 

With the KES 25,000 she wants to purchase food items, wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar, and beans. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income and establish a restaurant in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase food items including wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar and beans.

loans.name: Tufaa

texts.en:
Tufaa lives in Mariakani, Kenya. She is married and blessed with five children. She operates a retail shop in her town. She has been in this business for the last four years. She learned about Milango through friends. 

She now seeks a loan of 107,250 Kenya shillings to buy five sacks of sugar, 20 boxes of soap powder, and 10 sacks of rice and upgrade her business to a wholesale. The major challenges are the high cost of fuel and transportation. Price fluctuation and inflation are also a challenge in operating this kind of business. She will increase the saving she has with the extra income raised from the loan.

loans.use: to buy five sacks of sugar, 20 boxes of soap powder, 10 sacks of rice and upgrade her business to wholesale.

loans.name: Evelyn Yomary

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Primero De Abril se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señora Evelyn, tiene 33 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación tiene dos hijos de 16 y 14 años que estudian en colegio. Su esposo tiene un taller. 

Doña Evelyn es una muy buena esposa que realiza el crédito para que su esposo lo utilice en su trabajo, él tiene un taller de aluminio y vidrio, allí él junto a un ayudante fabrican puertas, ventanas y varios obras más con estos materiales, ellos trabajan de lunes a sábado casi todo el día. Su esposo lo tiene por más de 17 años y con el cual ha sacado adelante a su familia. Doña Evelyn por su parte en ocasiones se dedica a la vende ropa de todo tipo en su tiempo libre.

Este crédito es para comprar aluminio, vidrio y otros materiales que utiliza su esposo en su taller. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos.
 
Su sueño es darles lo mejor a sus hijos y que ellos sean buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
Primero de Abril Communal Bank meets every two weeks in Montecristi Canton, known for its rich pre-colonial culture and its nationally and internationally recognized handicrafts.  This is the place where the famous paja toquilla [or "Panama"] hats are made.

This is where Evelyn lives.  She's 33 years old and married, and from this relationship has two children, ages 16 and 14.  Her students attend school and her husband has a workshop.

Evelyn is a very good wife who's getting the loan for her husband to use in his job.  He has an aluminum and glass workshop where he and a helper make doors, windows, and other things with these materials.  They work almost all day from Monday through Saturday.  Her husband has had the shop for more than 17 years and he has gotten his family ahead with it.  For her part, Evelyn sometimes sells all types of clothing in her spare time.

This loan is to buy aluminum, glass, and other materials her husband uses in his shop.  She has been with the communal bank since the beginning and she likes it because of their help with the loans.

Her dream is to give her children the best and for them to be good professionals.

loans.use: to buy aluminum, glass, and other materials

loans.name: Boqueron 2 Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Boqueron 2 son mujeres del Barrio Boqueron de Ciudad del Este están en su ciclo número 5 del programa de comité de mujeres, todas ellas trabajan arduamente por crecer y salir adelante, ellas quieren dar a sus familias lo que necesitan para una vida mejor.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Maria, quien en su encuesta mostro estar en un nivel medio, y con esos ingresos esta tratando de ayudar a su familia. Ella se dedica a la venta de comestibles, como ser empanadas, sándwich, croquetas y demás, y cuenta que sus comidas son muy ricas, por eso que le está yendo muy bien. Es una persona muy hábil con las comidas, y quiere seguir creciendo para ayudar a su familia.
La Sra. Solicita de este crédito para la compra de mas ingredientes para preparar las comidas, como ser verduras, condimentos, carnes, jamón, queso y demás, lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The group called Boqueron 2 are women from the Boqueron neighborhood of the City of the East. They are beginning their fifth loan cycle with the Woman's committee program. All of these women work very hard to grow and move forward. They want to give their families everything they need to have a better life.

One of the group members is Maria. Her questionnaire showed that she is a middle-class business owner who with her profits is trying to help her family. María makes a living preparing and selling foods such as empanadas, sandwiches, croquettes, and others. Maria knows that her foods are delicious because business has gone very well for her. She is a very skilled cook who hopes to expand her business in order to help her family.

Maria is requesting this loan in order to buy more ingredients for her foods such as vegetables, condiments, beef, ham, cheese and others to help her carry out her business plan and increase her profits.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, condiments, beef, ham, cheese and other ingredients.

loans.name: Fortaleza De Adelita Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FORTALEZA DE ADELITA” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de German Busch, está compuesta por seis  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Adela es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de busos, costura de busos, tejido de busos, tejido de bitles, tejido de chompas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Adela es integrante, ella indica que hace ocho años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una sobrina que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de gelatinas; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió iniciativa propia, hace un año.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra gelatina) que adquirirá de las empresas distribuidoras, por mayor, y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará de forma ambulante en las ferias locales. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia, ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el compartir con sus compañeras.
texts.en:
The "FORTALEZA DE ADELITA" communal association will start its first cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Centro Focal de German Busch [German Busch Regional Office]. The group is composed of six members and is directed by an executive board of which Señora Adela is the president. The community association members carry out a variety of businesses, among them are: selling casual outfits, sewing casual outfits, weaving casual outfits, weaving turtlenecks, weaving sweaters.

The loan that they take out will benefit the group of small businesswomen that Señora Adela is a member of. She says she has been a member of Pro Mujer for eight years, joining through the invitation of a niece who is a member of the group. At present she has a business selling gelatins [Jell-O]. She reports that she undertook this business on her own initiative one year ago.

 The loan that she will take out now is to increase her capital (purchase of gelatin), which she will acquire wholesale from distributors and after preparation will sell as a mobile vendor at local fairs. This form of work allows her to generate resources to support her family, as she lives in a common-law relationship and has five children.

When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes sharing with her friends.

loans.use: to purchase gelatin

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph lives in Mombasa, Kenya. He is a husband and a father of two. One of his children attends school. For one year now, he has been running a cereals shop. He sells maize, beans, rice, etc. He knew Milango through an employee and now he seeks a loan of 41,850 Kenya shillings to buy 90 kgs of maize and rice, and two sacks of beans for stock. 

He hopes that in five years, he will have grown his business to a wholesale one. The extra income will help him improve the living standards of his family. The major challenge he faces is the high cost of rent and transport, which really cuts his income.

loans.use: To buy 90 kgs of maize and rice.

loans.name: Mukarama

texts.ru: Мукарама замужем. Ей 50 лет. Она мать четверых детей. Все ее дети уже взрослые и почти все обзаведены семьями. Мукарама со своей большой семьей проживает в районе Шахритуз. Ее муж работает в столице, а старший сын находится в России на заработках. Мукарама ответственная и общительная женщина. У нее только среднее образование. Мукарама является фермером. Она уже более 5 лет занимается земледелием и на небольшом участке земли выращивает зерновую культуру (рис). Ей в деятельности помогает невестка и муж. Она просит кредит для закупа минеральных удобрений и семян риса. Кредит поможет ей обработать землю, посеять урожай, а за счет дохода с урожая обеспечить семью.
texts.en: Mukarama is married, she is 50 years old. She is a mother of four children. All her children are adults and almost all have families of their own. Mukarama lives with her big family in the region of Shahrituz. Her husband works in the capital city and her oldest son is now in Russia for work. Mukarama is a responsible and social woman. She has secondary education. Mukarama is a farmer. She has been in agriculture for over five years growing mainly rice on a small plot of land. Her daughter-in-law and her husband help her in this business. She is asking for a loan to buy mineral fertilizer and rice seeds. The loan will help her cultivate the land, sow the harvest, and use the income from the harvest to support the family.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizer and rice seeds.

loans.name: Renacer Group

texts.es:
14 son las mujeres que se unieron con las ganas de salir adelante, y de esto surgió el grupo llamado Renacer, está en su ciclo número  17 del programa de comité de mujeres, todas ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza para conocer la situación de cada una. 3 de ellas están por debajo de la línea de pobreza con ingresos muy bajos.
Olga es parte del grupo, está en un nivel medio de ingresos, pero pese a ello esta trabajando para poder seguir creciendo y mejorando su vida y la de su familia. Olga se dedica a la venta de prendas de todas clases, y tiene muy buena clientela, tiene de todo ya cada rato trata de innovar sus productos. Su meta es poder tener el día de mañana un gran negocio de ropas.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de jeans, pantalones, camisas, remeras y demás, para poder seguir teniendo un negocio bien surtido y con todo lo que sus clientes necesitan.
texts.en:
Fourteen women with the desire to get ahead gathered together and began the communal bank group named Renacer (Rebirth). Renacer is in its 17th loan cycle with the Women's committee program. All of the group members are filling out poverty elimination questionnaires in order to determine each woman's situation. Three of these women live below the poverty line with very low income. 

Olga is part of this group. She is at a middle income level but she keeps working to continue growing and improving her life and the life of her family. Olga makes a living selling all types of clothing. She has a good customer base and offers a variety of clothes, but every so often she tries to innovate her selection. Olga's goal is to have a big clothing store.

She is requesting this loan in order to buy jeans, pants, tops, t-shirts, and other items in order to continue having a well-stocked store with things her customers need.

loans.use: to buy jeans, pants, tops, t-shirts, and other items.

loans.name: Charo

texts.en: Charo lives in Mariakani, Kenya. He has been running a barber shop for the last two years. He was employed before and from his savings he managed to start his own shop. He knew about Milango through friends. He now seeks a loan of 41,850 Kenya shillings to buy five shaving machines. He hopes to open several barber shops and employ people to work. He will increase his savings for other projects in the future.

loans.use: To buy five shaving machines.

loans.name: Brenda

texts.en: Brenda is a married mother with one school-going child. They live at their own house that has electricity and piped water. She operates a food kiosk business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of competition from other food kiosk operators. With the Kshs 25,000 loan she wants to purchase cooking oil, maize flour, wheat flour and rice for resale. She dreams of expanding to her business to earn more income in the future.

loans.use: to purchase cooking oil, maize flour, wheat flour and rice for resale.

loans.name: Sevil

texts.en:
Sevil is in an agriculture activity, fattening cows and farming crops as well. She is doing it well and she is happy about it. Sevil is raising two little children and at the same time is farming together with her husband. They sell meat, milk products and grass for animals. Things are going well but her lack is the absence of stall facilities, and that creates discomfort for the animals. In the near future, she plans to build a new stall.

Sevil has applied for a loan of 1,000 AZN. She intends to use this money to purchase 14 lambs and farm supplies for her farm. She anticipates getting profits from which she will expand her business and give the best education possible to her children.

loans.use: To purchase 14 lambs and farm supplies for her farm.

loans.name: Wesal

texts.en: Wesal was born in 1970. She is married and has 3 children. Her husband is currently working as a Security Guard and earns a small salary which is barely enough to cover their children's needs. Wesal is well known and has a good reputation. She works at a sewing factory and does some sewing work at home. Now she seeks a loan to expand her career and make dresses and gowns after buying some fabric.

loans.use: to buy some fabric to make dresses and gowns.

loans.name: Mariamu

texts.en:
Mariamu operates a charcoal selling business. She sells from home to her neighbors and passersby. Her major challenge in the business is the high cost of transportation.

With the loan she is requesting she wants to purchase 20 bags of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business, and she appreciates the previous loan which helped her to increase her stock.

loans.use: to purchase 20 bags of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Rashid

texts.en:
Rashid, 19, lives in Mariakani, Kenya where he is a husband and a father of one. For the past two years, he has owned a grocery shop, where his major challenge is the unstable nature of food prices.

Rashid, who learned of Milango through friends, is now seeking a loan of 21,050 Kenya shillings to buy three bales of kale and three crates of tomatoes for his store. Extra income obtained will be reinvested in the business.

loans.use: to buy three bales of kale and three crates of tomatoes

loans.name: Shatha

texts.en: Satha was born in 1992. She lives in Al-Mafraq, Jordan. She is single and has one brother who is currently working in the military. Shatha is studying Accounting at Al Albayt University and is seeking a loan to continue her study by paying her semester fees.

loans.use: to continue her study by paying her semester fees.

loans.name: Roman

texts.en:
Roman is 40 years old. He lives in Bolajuri village in the Adigeni district with his wife. Roman requested loans from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time, because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of  income for the family is from agricultural activities. They have milk cows and a plot of land. The cows are milked every day to produce dairy products, and on the land potatoes are grown. Harvested products along with the dairy products are sold at the local markets and among the villagers. 

Roman requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The Start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With his credit Roman will purchase calves. He will grow calves for a couple of months and then sell them at a higher price. This new business will give him an opportunity to earn a good profit. Roman is a very hardworking man and he wants to use part of the profit for his agricultural activities in order to expand more. This new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: To purchase calves.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, condiments, flour, eggs, and more.

loans.name: 8 De Diciembre Group

texts.es:
Un grupo muy trabajador es el llamado 8 de Diciembre, es de la ciudad de Asunción, y gracias a la labor de todas, ya se encuentran en su ciclo 8. Son mujeres jefas de familia, muy sacrificadas, y una de ellas es la Sra. Melchora.
Ella en su última encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, una herramienta fundamental para saber la situación de cada una, mostro un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno es decir con ingresos muy bajos. Ella es consciente que solo a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y las aplicaciones de los comportamientos vitales de una mujer exitosa, irá mejorando su situación de pobreza. Entre la costura y la confección de prendas, y su arduo trabajo desea crecer y seguir dando a su familia para el día a día.
La Sra. Solicita de este crédito para la compra de telas, gomas, hilos, botones y demás insumos para poder seguir con sus confecciones y ganarse así el sustento para su familia.
texts.en:
8 de Diciembre is a very hard-working group. It is in the city of Asunción, and thanks to the hard work of all, it is in its eighth cycle. 8 de Diciembre is made up of women who are the heads of their families and sacrifice a lot. One of these women is Mrs. Melchora.

In her last survey for poverty elimination, a fundamental tool to know the situation of each woman, Mrs. Melchora showed a level of poverty within the first level, meaning she has very low income. She knows that she will only be able to improve her poverty situation through effort and continuous work, applying the vital behaviors of a successful woman. Through her hard work sewing and making clothing, she hopes to grow and continue providing for her family’s daily needs. 

Mrs. Melchora is requesting this loan to buy fabric, elastic, thread, buttons and other supplies to be able to continue making clothing and to earn a living for her family.

loans.use: to buy fabric, elastic, thread, buttons, and other supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sugar and maize meal.

loans.name: Mouath

texts.en: Mouath was born in 1993. He has 4 brothers and 1 sister. Mouath is studying Computer Programming and Engineering at The Science and Technology University. He is also working as a delivery man at McDonalds restaurant. Now he is seeking a loan to continue his study by paying his semester fees.

loans.use: to continue his study by paying his semester fees.

loans.name: Waad

texts.en:
Waad was born in 1993. She has four older siblings and is studying child care at Al-Hussein Ben Talal University. 

She is looking for a better job to improve the financial situation of her family and to continue her studies by paying her semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for her semester fees.

loans.name: Safia

texts.en:
At the age of 47, Safia is a married woman and a mother of six. Twenty years ago, she initiated her own business of milk sales to provide financial support to her husband in running their household efficiently. 

She has six buffaloes and three cows in milk and sells their milk to many people of her locality. With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has successfully built her business. 

Currently, she requested a loan of Rs. 40,000 to purchase another buffalo. It would help her to inflate her sales, which ultimately helps in generating more cash. She dreams to provide quality education to her children through all her hard work.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es:
Este grupo de Mujeres Emprendedoras que lleva por nombre Nueva Esperanza se encuentra en el ciclo 12 del programa de Comité de Mujeres con 13 integrantes actualmente, es caracterizado por su responsabilidad, excelente cumplimiento en el pago y  participación en las. Ellas son madres de familia que luchan por sus hijos para darles lo que necesitan para el día a día.
Una de las historias dignas de destacar es el de la señora   Angelina de 57 años de edad que desde hace 30 años aproximadamente se dedica exclusivamente a tejer todo tipo artesania y cuenta que este ha sido su sustento y el de toda su familia. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora y por sobre todo honesta, que desde siempre ha trabajo.
Hoy solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de hilos, agujas, telas y demás para poder seguir con sus artesanías, y así mostrar al mundo de esa forma toda su creatividad.
texts.en:
Nueva Esperanza is a group of enterprising women in their twelfth cycle of the Women’s Committee program. The group currently has 13 members. They are characterized by their responsibility, excellent payment fulfillment, and participation. The women are mothers who fight for their children to be able to give them what they need each day. 

One of the stories worth telling is that of Mrs. Angelina. She is 57 years old and has worked exclusively in weaving all kinds of crafts for 30 years. She says that this has been her sustenance and that of her whole family. She is a very hardworking and honest person above all, and she has always worked.

Mrs. Angelina is applying for this loan to be able to invest it in buying yarn, needles, fabric, and other supplies to continue with her crafts and be able to show the world her creativity.

loans.use: to buy yarn, needles, fabric and other supplies.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 42 years old and lives in the Gurjaani Ddstrict with his wife, two children and father, who has a retirement pension. He has requested loans from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan requests were rejected because of low income and family’s poor living conditions. 

George serves local people as a taxi driver. This is the only source of income for their family, but he hardly earns enough money to pay for food to feed his family. According to Credo estimates, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

George has requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. He has now been approved for this loan within the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo that provides start-up and re-startup credits with easy terms to rural poor people who do not have access to other forms of credit. With his loan, George will buy piglets, raise them and resell some of them at a higher price. He will hold on to others to create new pigs and expand his herd. This will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to buy piglets.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en: Razia is a 35-year-old married woman who works hard and has, for the past three years, earned a living by selling clothes. She buys clothes made of different fabrics in various colors and designs from a market at wholesale prices and then sells them to the people in her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business to help support her family. She has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation and is now requesting a loan for Rs. 30,000 to buy a wide variety of clothes in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her inventory. Razia expects a boost in her earnings because of this loan and plans to spend the part of her profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of clothes.

loans.name: Irshad

texts.en: Irshad is a 52-year-old married woman who has earned a living by selling milk for many years. She has five buffaloes and one cow. She also has a good client list and makes enough money to contribute to her family's income.  She has five children, one of whom attends school. She is very motivated to provide them with a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing.  She has improved her business to meet more of her expenses. This is her fifth year with Kashf Foundation; she is happy to run her business with our support and is requesting a loan for Rs. 40,000 to buy one more cow to increase her output of milk. She desires to expand her market to a larger area and spend part of her profits on bettering the lives of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Uzma

texts.en:
Uzma is a 33-year-old vigorous lady; she has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to a lack of availability of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. 

For this reason she requested a loan of Rs 30,000 from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of threads in different colors along with packs of laces, zippers, and buttons to create a means of increasing revenues so she may able to generate a healthier source of income. She is in her fourth loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads in different colors along with packs of laces, zippers, and buttons.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cooking oil, rice, maize flour, etc.

loans.name: Mamadiso

texts.ru: Мамадисо является земледельцем, он живет и трудится в районе Шахритуз. Ему 44 года. Он женат, имеет двоих дочерей и двоих сыновей. Жена Мамадисо занимается домашним хозяйством. Сыновья учатся в школе, а оба дочерей занимаются шитьем национальных платьев на дому. Махмадисо имеет среднее техническое образование. Он занимается растениеводством. Махмадисо посвятил себя этому виду деятельности 15 лет. При дворе дома у него имеется орошаемый участок земли, на котором в основном выращивает рис. Ему в ведении сельского хозяйства помогают сыновья и жена. Сейчас Мамадисо обратился за кредитом для закупа семян риса, минерального удобрения, топлива и оплаты тракториста. Он верит в Вашу поддержку.
texts.en: Mamadiso is a farmer. He lives and works in the Shahrituz region. He is 44 years old. He is married and has two daughters and two sons. Mamadiso’s wife is a homemaker. His sons attend secondary school, and both daughters sew traditional dresses at home. Mamadiso has finished technical college. He grows produce. Mamadiso has dedicated 15 years of his life to this work. By his home there is an irrigated land plot used mainly for growing rice. His wife and sons help him in this business. At present Mamadiso is applying for a loan to buy rice seeds, mineral fertilizers, and fuel and pay for the tractor driver’s labor. He counts on your support.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds, mineral fertilizers, and fuel and pay for the tractor driver’s labor.

loans.name: Huma

texts.en: Huma is a 40-year-old married woman and a mother of four. She has been running a business selling clothes for many years. She purchases a variety of ladies' clothes from the main city and then sells them to the people in her vicinity. By now, she has become famous for selling good-quality clothes in her community. Huma requested a loan of PKR 35,000 from Kashf Foundation to buy stock of different clothes for the summer season, taking in account the choices and tastes of her customers. In this way, she will be able to earn more income through her greater sales. Huma hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business. She dreams of giving a good-quality education to her children through all her hard efforts in her business.

loans.use: to buy stock of clothes to sell for the summer season

loans.name: Guram

texts.en:
Sixty-year-old Guram lives in Kobuleti district, Ochkhamuri village with his 52-year-old wife, Nino. Guram requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

Guram owns a grocery shop. He has a small number of products and earns a small daily income. His wife, Nino, is a teacher at the local school. Total family total income is rarely enough for food expenses.

Guram requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high-risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With his credit, Guram will purchase stock for his grocery shop. He wants to have more varieties of products in order to better satisfy his clients' needs and earn a higher income for his family. He will reinvest part of the profit to expand his business. Guram will use another part of his profit to cover food expenses and purchase all the needed household goods. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: To purchase stock of groceries for his shop

loans.name: Rowaida

texts.en: Rowaida is a conservative woman: she has asked her husband to appear in the photo instead of her. She was born in 1970. She is married and has 4 children. Rowaida and her husband own a mini market. She now seeks a loan to improve and expand the mini market by adding more types of food products in order to earn a better income.

loans.use: to expand her mini market by adding more types of food products.

loans.name: Roger

texts.es:
Roger, es casado y tiene un hijo que está en etapa escolar, vive en casa propia, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Miraflores de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente trabaja como ingeniero civil en una empresa privada por más de ocho horas al día ya que debe solventar los gastos familiares en cuanto a alimentación, educación y pago de servicios básicos de su familia.
El crédito lo requiere para continuar  la construcción de su vivienda ya que desea mejorar su calidad de vida y brindar más comodidad a su familia. Está terminando la obra fina de un par de habitaciones y necesita estuco, pinturas, enchufes, etc.
El sueño de Roger es mejorar sus ingresos para poder pagar los estudios de su hijo ya que actualmente es la única fuente de ingresos que tiene para mantener a su familia.
Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en:
Roger is married and has a son who is in school.  Roger owns his own house in the Miraflores area of La Paz city.

Roger currently works as a civil engineer for a private business.  He works over eight hours a day as he has to cover household costs, such as food, school costs and family bills.

Roger needs this loan in order to continue building his home as he wants to improve his quality of life and provide a little bit more comfort to his family.  He is putting the finishing touches to a couple of bedrooms and needs plaster, paint, sockets and more.

Roger's dream is to improve his income so that he can pay for his son's studies as his work is currently the only source of income he has to support his family.

This is the first time that Roger has applied for a loan from Impro and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy plaster, paints, sockets and more in order to to put the finishing touches to two bedrooms in his house.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is a 28-year-old mother from Mjini location in Kakamega County, which is found in the western part of Kenya. She is married to Erick, who is a farmer and also offers an extra income to the family. She supports three people in her family and has two children who are 4 and 3 years old respectively.

Teresa has a retail shop within her location, a business she has been doing for the last nine years. She makes a monthly income of KES. 20,000. She has applied for her first loan from KADET LTD. She will use the loan to add more stock of salt, sugar, cooking oil and other shop items. She will use the anticipated profit to plow back into the business.

Her dream is to grow the business so as to become a wholesaler and support her family.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, salt and cooking oil.

loans.name: Ammar

texts.en:
Ammar was born in 1993. He is single and lives with his parents. 

Ammar is studying civil engineering and is seeking a loan to pay his semester fees and continue his study.

loans.use: to pay his semester fees and continue his study.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen, age 34, is involved in the business of milk sales with the support of her husband. She has four buffaloes in milk. She looks after the buffaloes and performs the task of collecting milk from them, while her husband sells it to different places on a daily basis. 

Nasreen is a mother of four and is motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good quality food, health and education. In order to make huge profits, she requested a loan of Rs 35,000 to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers. 

She is in her fifth loan cycle with good repayment behavior. Nasreen is very experienced in her business and confident that her business will move toward a positive direction as a result of the loan investment.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is a 47-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband and her son at the corner of her house. She has five years of experience in this field.  She offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. 

Razia makes enough to provide for her family. She is a mother of six children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. 

To make her store fully stocked, she requested a loan for Rs 30,000, which she will use to buy rice, sugar and flour from the market at lower rates. In this way, she will be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She is in her sixth loan cycle and has shown excellent repayment behavior.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar and flour from the market at lower rates.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia, a 50-year-old married woman living with her husband and five children in Punjab, Pakistan, has been embroidering by hand for about 20 years, making beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand, and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home.

To help her continue her operations, she has requested a loan of Rs. 25,000 to buy reels of threads in various colors and packs of beads, sequins and stones for embellishment. In this way she will be able to cater to more customers consistently. She is hopeful about increasing her income by targeting more customers.

Razia dreams of a bright future for her children and desires to build her own house, as she is currently living in a rented home with her family.

loans.use: to buy reels of threads in various colors and packs of beads, sequins and stones for embellishment.

loans.name: Asgharee

texts.en:
Asgharee is a 57-year-old married woman. She has been doing a business of milk sales for many years. She has two buffaloes and three cows in milk; she sells their milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter and cheese that she makes from the milk.  

By this time, she has become famous in her territory for providing good quality milk. Her business is good enough to lead a decent life. She is very motivated to provide her children a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing.  She has improved her business to meet the day-to-day expenses of life.  

This is her fourth year with Kashf Foundation; she is happily running her business through support of it. Now she requested a loan of Rs. 30,000 to purchase one more cow. She hopes to get an increase in the production capacity of milk, which ultimately helps in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 61 years old. She is from Bukhungu location in Vihiga County, which is located in the western part of Kenya. She is married to Mulaku, who is a farmer and also supports the family by providing income. Alice supports seven people in her family and has three children who are, 24, 16, and 14 years old respectively.

Alice sells secondhand clothes. She has been doing this for the last ten years and makes a monthly income of KES. 9,000. She has applied for her fifth loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to purchase more bales of secondhand clothes. She will use the anticipated profit to plow back into her business.

Her dream is to open a boutique shop and to build a decent house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more bales of secondhand clothes.

loans.name: Rosa Lidya

texts.es:
Rosa, requiere optar por un nuevo préstamo por la necesidad de más capital de trabajo para  seguir invirtiendo en su negocio; este le permitirá comprar artículos perecederos y no perecederos, cereales, arroz, frijol, azucar, sal, asimismo  para reparar el molino.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a aumentar los ingresos  y los inventarios; las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares han mejorado.
texts.en: Rosa is opting for a new loan due to her need for more working capital to allow her to continue investing in her business. This will allow her to buy perishable and non-perishable items, cereal, rice, beans, sugar, salt, and to repair the corn mill.  Her previous loan helped her to increase her income and inventory, and her economic condition and family circumstances have improved.

loans.use: to buy perishable and non-perishable items, cereal, rice, beans, sugar, salt, and to repair the corn mill

loans.name: German

texts.es:
Germán , es casado , tiene dos hijos que están en etapa escolar, viven en casa propia, la casa está ubicada en la zona Achumani de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente trabaja como empleado en una empresa privada por más de ocho horas al dia ya que con lo que gana debe cubrir los gastos de alimentación, educación y pago de servicios básicos de su familia.
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de cerámica para el baño de su vivienda ya que desea mejorar su calidad de vida y dar más comodidad y seguridad a su familia.
El sueño de Germán es tener su propia empresa de construcción ya que se dedica a la ingeniería civil, para mejorar sus ingresos.
Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en:
Germán is married and has two school-age children. They live in their own house, which is located in the Achumani zone of the city of La Paz. He currently works as an employee in a private company, for more than eight hours a day, since his earnings allow him to cover the costs of food, education and basic services for his family.

He requires a loan for the purchase of ceramic tiles for the bathroom of his home since he hopes to improve his family's quality of life and give them more comfort and security. Germán's dream is to have his own construction business since he makes a living as a civil engineer, in order to improve his earnings. This is the first time he is requesting a loan with IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy ceramic tiles for the bathroom of his house

loans.name: Manuel Antonio

texts.es:
Manuel, requiere optar por un nuevo préstamo porque necesita capital de trabajo para seguir invirtiendo en su oficio de carpintería; este le permitirá comprar madera, junco para camas y sillas.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a crecer en el negocio y darse a conocer  con su clientela; las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares han mejorado.
texts.en: Manuel is opting for a new loan because he needs working capital in order to continue investing in his carpentry trade. This loan will allow him to buy wood and rush (plants with cylindrical stalks) for beds and chairs. His former loan helped him to grow the business and get to know his clients, and his economic condition and family circumstances have improved.

loans.use: to buy wood and rush (plants with cylindrical stalks) for beds and chairs

loans.name: Yesenia Elizabeth

texts.es:
Yesenia, está casada y disfruta de dos hijos, no posee familiares en el extranjero. Ella, se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos tales como: frijol y maíz, lo realiza desde hace cinco años y lo lleva a cabo junto con su esposo, todos los días de 6:00am a 3:00pm, por el momento no presenta ningún problema.
El préstamo que requiere le permitirá comprar los insumos agrícolas necesarios tales como: abono, herbicidas, insecticidas, pesticidas, plaguicidas; este le ayudara a tener los materiales agropecuarios que requiere para  realizar el cultivo y con las ganancias, aportar para su familia.
Su sueño es apoyar siempre a sus hijos en sus estudios y que no les falte la alimentación.
texts.en:
Yesenia is married and enjoys her two children. She has no family members abroad. She makes a living cultivating basic grains such as beans and corn. She has been doing this for five years and she does it together with her husband every day from 6:00 a.m. to 3:00 p.m. For the moment, it has not presented any problems.

The loan she requires will allow her to buy necessary agricultural supplies such as fertilizer, herbicide, insecticide, pesticide and anti-plague chemicals. This will help her to get the agricultural materials that she needs to cultivate her crops, and with the earnings, to contribute to her family.

Her dream is to always support her children in their studies and that they never go hungry.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicide, insecticide, pesticide and anti-plague chemicals

loans.name: Mburucuya Group

texts.es:
En ciudad del Este se formo este grupo que esta en su ciclo numero 17. Ellas han trabajado desde el ciclo uno y gracias al esfuerzo e interés que están mostrando es que les está yendo muy bien. Son mujeres muy trabajadoras y emprendedoras, que con su trabajo están superando su pobreza.
Castorina  es una de ellas, quien en su  encuesta de eliminación de pobreza mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel dos, con un nivel de ingresos medios. Ella cuenta que su trabajo es la venta de comidas, que lo hace frente a su casa. Tiene muy buena clientela ya que les vende y también recibe pedidos, es por medio de todo eso que consigue y ayuda a su familia a crecer. Sueña con tener un gran puesto de comidas y seguir deleitando a sus clientes con las delicias que hace.
Solicita de este crédito para invertirlo en la compra de carne, huevo, queso, harina, sal, jamón, verduras y condimentos, para usarlos en hacer las comidas que vende. Agradece por esta oportunidad inmensa que ella y sus compañeras están recibiendo.
texts.en:
This group was formed in the city of Este, they are in their 17th cycle.  They have worked together since the first cycle and thanks to the effort and interest shown they are doing very well.  They are hardworking and entrepreneurial women, that with their work are overcoming poverty.

Castorina is one of them, in her survey about overcoming poverty, she scored poverty level two, with a medium level of income.  She sells food outside of her house.  She has good clientele who she sells to and takes orders from as well, through this she is able to help her family get ahead.  She dreams with having a good stand and continue to satisfy her customers with the delicious food she makes.

She requests this loan to invest it in buying meat, eggs, cheese, flour, salt, ham, vegetables and condiments, to use them to prepare food for sale.  She is thankful for the opportunity that her and her group-mates are getting.

loans.use: to buy meat, eggs, cheese, flour, salt, ham, vegetables and condiments.

loans.name: Mubina

texts.en:
At the age of 35, Mubina is a hard-working, married lady; she has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community, and she uses the income to support her entire family. She knows very well the techniques of stitching and has retained many regular customers.

To meet the orders of her customers on time, she needs to purchase more stitching material. That is why she requested a loan of Rs 20,000 from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of thread in different colors, with packs of lace, zippers and buttons. This new stock of materials will create a means of increasing revenues, so she may able to generate a healthier income.

loans.use: to buy more spool of thread in different colors, with packs of lace, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a 43-year-old, dairy farmer in Kilifi. She is a married mother, who supports two in her family. She has been in business for the past ten years and has done well.

This marks her fourth borrowing from KADET LTD, to finance her business. She will use the requested loan to purchase dairy lick [a salt lick enriched with minerals for dairy cows] and hay for the cows. She intends to use the anticipated profit from milk sales to educate her children. She hopes to have a happy family in future.

loans.use: to purchase dairy lick and hay for the cows

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en:
Shehnaz, age 32, is engaged in the business of animal sales. She buys animals (baby goats & baby cows) at low prices, brings them up, and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income.  She is a dedicated mother of four; one is school going.

She needs to improve her business to meet the needs of her children. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied a loan of Rs. 30,000 to purchase another cow. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase another cow.

loans.name: Azmat

texts.en: Azmat is a 46-year-old married woman; she has been doing a business of cutlery sales for ten years. She offers various types of cutlery items such as forks, knives and spoons to the people of her community and in a local market as well. Her husband also assists her in running this business. She makes a sufficient amount to contribute to the family income. For the improvement of her business she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of Rs. 30,000. In this way, she would be able to purchase a greater variety of cutlery such as spoons, forks and knives in various sizes and designs. She is in her 2nd loan cycle with a good repayment history. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a greater variety of cutlery such as spoons, forks and knives in various sizes and designs.

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en: Jamila had a difficult time after her husband's business failure. She decided to work on her own to provide financial support to her husband in meeting their household expenses efficiently. Twelve years ago, she began stitching work in her house. She stitches for the people living around her house and uses the income to support her entire family. Over this time she has become famous in her street for sewing fine clothes. Due to lack of availability of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. So she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of Rs. 30,000. This loan amount will help her to purchase more spools of threads with packs of elastic, needles and zippers. She is hopeful for an increase in her earnings and wishes to spend part of the profits on the well-being of her six children.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of threads with packs of elastic, needles and zippers.

loans.name: Stanley

texts.en:
Stanley is 36 years old, married to Martha and blessed with two children aged 10 and eight. He sells charcoal, a business he started 10 years ago and earns a monthly income of KES 20,000. 

He has requested a second loan of KES 60,000 to purchase sacks of charcoal to sell. The profit he earns will be ploughed back into his business. He hopes to see his business grow as well as to educate his children.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Naumi

texts.en:
Naumi is a single mother with three school-going children. They live in their own house that has electricity and piped water. 

She operates a brick blocks business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of competition from other brick sellers in her business. 

With the KES 50,000 she wants to purchase more bricks to sell to earn a living and support her family. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more bricks to sell to earn a living.

loans.name: Sadah

texts.en:
Sadah is a widow with three school-going children. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for her children.

She has operated a business selling construction blocks as wholesale for the past five years, selling to people who live in her town and neighbors. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation especially during the rainy season. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase building blocks to sell to her customers. She decided to join Yehu to access loans at lower cost to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase building blocks to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Intisar

texts.en:
Intisar is a conservative person, she asked her husband to appear in the photo instead.

Intisar was born in 1985. She lives in Um al Amad, Jordan. She has three children and owns livestock which she sells. Now she seeks a youth loan to raise the number of livestock to increase her income.

loans.use: to raise the number of livestock.

loans.name: Fatmeh

texts.en:
Fatmeh is a 23-year-old Lebanese married woman. She lives with her husband and only child. She has worked as a private teacher since 2010. She likes her occupation because she feels that she is helping students to get the needed education. She has arranged a special room in her house where she receives her students and equipped it with required materials and supplies. Her husband works as a salesman in a local company, and they cooperate to collect enough money to be able to pay the heavy life expenses. 

Today, Fatmeh is applying for a youth loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to purchase books to improve her teaching skills and renovate the teaching room to be able to receive students appropriately. She is very positive about her future and wishes to receive more students with the coming school season.

loans.use: to purchase books to improve her teaching skills and renovate the teaching room.

loans.name: Chiristine

texts.en:
Chiristine is from Kisauni. She is married and they have two children, who are small, but who are the couple's reason to struggle for success.

Chiristine has a business selling fruits and vegetables in the town market. She occupies two stands. She has a fixed customer base, good income, and good business and personal references. She is a hardworking woman and an excellent client.

She is asking for this loan to purchase fruits and vegetables to stock her store with products so she will be able to continue giving her customers the quality they expect from her.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables so she can stock her store with products.

loans.name: Afnan

texts.en: Afnan, 34, is a married woman and has six children; they live in Taiz, Yemen. She has a grocery store. She started her own grocery store with a small amount of her husband's income. She’s a very hardworking woman and helps her children have a good life. To help continue operations of her business, she is requesting a loan of 100,000 YER to buy rice, sugar, beans, candy, snacks, condiments, soft-drinks, groceries, etc. to expand her product inventory. She hopes to enroll her children in school and keep her store stocked so that she can earn more income.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, beans, candy, snacks, condiments, soft-drinks, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Mavis

texts.en:
Borrower Mavis is 36 years old and a married woman. She lives with her family in the Teshie district, which is part of the capital city Accra. She supports her family by operating a provision store from her residence. 

Her business is in its high shopping season since her shop is close to a school and the school children buy a lot from her shop. Her main customers are school children.

She usually sells coca-cola, diapers, books, pencils, pen, toffees, biscuits, Milo and sugar. She really wants to increase her working capital for this high shopping season. Thus, she is requesting a GHS 900 loan to purchase more goods to sell.

loans.use: To buy books, pencils, pen, toffees, biscuits, Milo and sugar.

loans.name: Basma

texts.en: Basma was born in 1994. She has eight older siblings. She is currently studying Animal Production at The Science and Technology University. Now she seeks a loan to pay her semester fees and continue her studies.

loans.use: to pay her semester fees and continue her studies.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en: Mahmoud was born in 1980. He is married and has three children. He works in a rented store selling fish and birds and seeks a loan to buy food and wood to be able to build bird houses and fish tanks in order to expand his store and increase his income.

loans.use: to buy food and wood to be able to build bird houses and fish tanks.

loans.name: Rasmeya

texts.en: Rasmeya was born in 1964. She is divorced. She bakes some pies, pastry and bread at home and supplies them to bakeries in Al Mafraq, Jordan. Now she seeks a loan to open a special room in her house just for her baking business until she can open her own bakery and increase her income.

loans.use: to open a special room in her house just for her baking business

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: En el municipio de Malambo, área metropolitana de Barranquilla, habita y tiene su propio negocio  Rosa,  una mujer de 19 años que conforma su familia con su cónyuge y su pequeña hija menor de un año. Rosa a principios del año 2012, entusiasmada por su amiga, inició vendiendo mercancía variada, que ella le proporcionaba para que generara ingresos, pues Rosa no se encontraba vinculada a ninguna  empresa que entregara catálogos a sus compradores, para promocionar sus productos a sus clientes. Poco a poco la clientela de Rosa fue creciendo y esto la ayudó a que ella misma, tuviera una vinculación directa, que  le facilitara comercializar a un precio más competitivo. Así es como hoy en día, ofrece perfumería, bolsos, accesorios femeninos, mediante guías especializadas de artículos y de esta oferta escoge las que vienen en promoción, para vender a su clientela a un buen precio y también generar más ingresos, con una rápida rotación de sus inventarios. La clientela de Rosa la conforman sus vecinas y referidos por estas, que la apoyan en el crecimiento estructural de su negocio. En la actualidad Rosa está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará cremas, perfumes y accesorios femeninos, que han sido encargados por su clientela; su meta es aumentar el capital de trabajo y así mismo las ventas, para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Su mayor desafío fue encontrar fuentes de financiamiento y esto es justamente, lo que hace que su credikiva se convierta en un peldaño para alcanzar sus sueños de prosperidad y se convierta en una inversión exitosa.
texts.en:
Rosa lives In the Malambo municipality, in the metropolitan area of Barranquilla, where she has her own business. She is a 19-year-old woman whose family is made up of her spouse and their small daughter who is less than a year old. 

At the beginning of 2012, Rosa, excited by her friend's support, began selling a variety of commodities that she had shared with her in order to generate income since Rosa was not tied to any business that would give catalogs to its buyers in order to promote their products to their clients. 

Little by little, Rosa's clientele grew and this helped her to have her own direct tie which helped her sell at more competitive prices. That is why today she offers perfume, purses, and feminine accessories through specialized item guides. From among their offers she chooses those that go on sale, in order to sell to her clients at good prices and also generate more income with a rapid rotation of inventory. 

Her clientele is made up of her neighbors and those referred by them, that support her with the structural growth of her business. Rosa is currently applying for a Kiva loan, the first financing she will get through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which she will buy creams, perfume, and feminine accessories that have been ordered by her clientele. 

Her goal is to increase her working capital as well as her sales, in order to improve her family's way of life. Her greatest challenge was finding sources of financing and that is just what her Kiva loan will do. It will lead to a successful investment which will become a stepping stone to help her achieve her dreams of prosperity.

loans.use: to buy creams, perfume, and feminine accessories

loans.name: Dilcia Varinia

texts.es:
Dilcia es una mujer casada y madre de 2 hijos con 35 años de edad ella es agricultora y ama de casa con 6 años de educación cursados en la primaria. El hijo menor está en 6 grado y la mayor ya es una joven independiente y trabaja fuera de su casa y en ocasiones ayuda a sus padres con las actividades del campo. Ella únicamente se ha dedicado a la agricultura desde hace muchos años ya que fueron sus padres los que le enseñaron el cultivo de café siendo esta actividad su único medio de ingreso. En la tierra que trabajan se involucra su esposo, su hija mayor y ella en las diferentes actividades y sus cosechas están ubicadas a 30 minutos de distancia de su casa de habitación a la cual se trasladan en bestia y en ocasiones a pie.

Dilcia solicita ayuda para la compra de fertilizantes, abono y una bomba de fumigación para sus cultivos ya que ella quiere evitar que se contaminen de plagas y su producción se dañe. 

Su sueño es ser una de las mejores productoras y vendedoras de su producto introduciendo nuevos sistemas para su mantenimiento, mejores productos de calidad para la tierra y la planta ya que así ella podrá generar ingresos para su familia y apoyar a sus hijos con sus necesidades entre otros.
texts.en:
Dilcia is a married woman and a mother of 2 children. She is 35 years old. She is a farmer and housewife. She completed 6 years of primary education. Her younger child is in grade 6 and the oldest is an independent young woman who works outside the home and sometimes helps her parents with their tasks in the fields.
 
She has been working solely in agriculture for many years as her own parents taught her to grow coffee. Growing coffee is her only source of income. Her husband, as well as her older daughter, work the land with her. They have different tasks to carry out and the crops are 30 minutes from the house where they live. They travel between the house and the fields by animal and sometimes on foot.

Dilcia is requesting assistance to buy fertilisers, manure and a fumigation pump for her crops as she wants to avoid them getting diseases or getting damaged. 

Her dream is to be one of the best producers and sellers of this produce, by introducing new maintenance systems and higher quality products for the land and planting. In this way she will be able to generate income for her family and support her children providing for their needs, etc.

loans.use: to buy fertilisers, manure and fumigation pumps for her coffee crop

loans.name: Irshad

texts.en: At the age of 57, Irshad is an energetic lady who has been operating a business selling milk for about 20 years. Over this time, she has become famous in her area for providing good quality milk. She counts a good client list and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. To increase the production capacity of milk, she needs to purchase another buffalo. For this reason she applied for her third loan of 30,000 PKR through the Kashf Foundation. It would help her to increase her sales. She expects a boost in her earnings with her loan and plans to spend her profits on expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam, age 25, started her business sewing clothes one year ago. She stitches clothes for the people in her vicinity and uses the income to support her entire family. However, she is facing difficulty in completing her customers' orders on time. She contacted Kashf Foundation and requested a loan of 20,000 PKR. She is planning to use this loan to buy more spools of thread with packs of needles and elastic. It will help her to meet the orders of her customers without fail. She expects a boost in her earnings and desires to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread with packs of needles and elastic.

loans.name: Sidi

texts.en:
Sidi is from Kisauni. She has run a store for more than two years, which is going very well. She says that she has a loyal customer base thanks to her excellent service. She also has the best-stocked store in the neighborhood. This combination of factors means that she is enjoying lots of success.

She dreams of being able to continue to grow her business, so that she earns enough to help her husband with the household expenses. She is requesting this loan to buy drinks, sugar, rice, flour and other items, as these are the best-selling products. She is grateful for the help she is receiving. It will be very useful.

loans.use: to buy drinks, sugar, rice, flour and other items to stock her store

loans.name: Samar

texts.en:
Samar is 36 years old. She is divorced and has one child. She lives in her father’s house. She sells some snacks at home and seeks to open a mini-market to be able to cover her child's needs. 

Now Samar is applying for a loan to be able to buy more goods and food products to increase her income and open her own mini-market.

loans.use: to buy more goods and food products for her food market business.

loans.name: Jean Baptiste

texts.en:
Jean Baptiste is 33 years old. He is a father of three children. 

With the loan, he would like to buy more beans, bananas and cassava for sale. The profits from the business will be used for building a house.

loans.use: to buy more beans, cassava and bananas for sale.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.en:
Edgar is 34 years old and he lives in a small city in Kapan. For two years he worked at the Kapan Dramatic Theater as an electricity operator. After that, he went to the Russian Federation for work abroad. Now he lives in the village of Geghavank which is in the Kapan area and he is engaged in agriculture and farming, but the income of it is very miserable. For a young man who plans to get married and to have a family, it is not nearly enough. Edgar breeds cows, pigs and rabbits. The products from his animal breeding he sells in Kapan food markets and to re-sellers.
Edgar has decided to have a deal with Kiva and wants to realize his plans of increasing his animal breeding and starting beekeeping with the help of Kiva lenders. 
He needs 500,000 Armenian drams to buy a mill for milling fodder for animals and five beehives.

loans.use: To buy a mill for milling fodder for animals and to buy five beehives

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is a mother. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her children. 

She operates a vegetable-selling business. She sells to her neighbors and passersby. Her major challenge is stiff competition from other vegetable sellers. 

With the Ksh 20,000 she wants to purchase sacks of various vegetables for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of various vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Samra

texts.en:
Samra is a conservative woman, so she asked her husband to take her place in the photo.

Samra was born in 1984 and lives in Al-Zarqaa’, Jordan. She is married and has four children. Her husband works as a driver for the military, and she sells clothes and blankets from home. As a result, they earn a small income which is not enough to cover their children's needs. She is requesting a youth loan to increase the quantity of clothing she has and to open a store for their business so they can expand their project to earn a better income.

loans.use: to increase the quantity of clothing she has

loans.name: Qumrinisso

texts.ru:
Кумриниссо 60 летняя добрая и трудолюбивая  женщина.  Она родилась и выросла в кишлаке, но после замужества переехала в город. Кумриниссо с семье живут в городе.  Ее муж работает мастером по ремонту домов. Кумриниссо очень долгое время сидела дома и занималась воспитанием детей а теперь когда дети выросли и обзавелись своими семьями и стали самостоятельными,  она решила начать свой маленький бизнес.  По совету своих подруг она начала торговлю канцелярскими товарами.  Этот вид деятельности ей очень нравиться, так дает очень хорошую прибыль. Поставщики приносят ей товар по дешевле  и она продает на рынке своего города по дороже. Зарабатывая сама, Кумриниссо чувствует себя независимой. Она старается помогать своим детям. 
 На данный момент Кумрниниссо  хочет закупить канцелярские товары, так как спрос на товар растет с каждым днем. Она решила обратится в организацию Арванд за кредитом, так как на руках у нее нет достаточных денежных средств.
Кумриниссо заранее благодарит Арванд за помощь и поддержку.
texts.en: Qumrinisso is 60 years old and she is a kind and hard-working woman.  She was born and raised in a village, but after she married she moved to the city, where she lives with her family.  Her husband works as a handyman doing home repairs.  For a long time, Qumrinisso stayed at home and raised her children, but now her children are grown and have started families of their own and become independent, she has decided to start a small business.  Following the advice of her friends, she began selling stationery and office supplies.  She enjoys this work very much, as it gives her a good income.  Her suppliers bring her goods at low prices and she sells them at her local market at a markup.  Working for herself makes Qumrinisso feel independent.  She tries to help her children.  At the moment, she wants to buy a stock of office supplies, as demand for her goods increases every day.  She has decided to turn to Arvand for a loan, as she does not have enough money in hand for this.  Qumrinisso thanks Arvand in advance for their help and support.

loans.use: to purchase of office supplies

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en: Hanan was born in 1993. She is single and has two sisters. Her father owns a chicken farm and earns a small salary, which is barely enough to cover their needs. Hanan studies Tourism and Guidance at The Hashemite University. Now she seeks a loan to be able to pay for her semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for her semester fees.

loans.name: Getrude

texts.en:
Gertrude lives a short distance from the center of Kisauni. She has been with her partner and they have school-aged children. She has been buying and selling drinks, in general, for more than two years.

Gertrude is requesting a loan to build a stall at her home so her clients will be more comfortable, and also for her own comfort because currently, her freezers are in the kitchen.

Her goal is to continue to grow more, and she knows that this loan will help her grow much more.

loans.use: to build a stall for greater comfort in making her sales.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en: Christine is 34 years old. She has sold beans and sorghum for six years. She has requested the loan to buy more beans and sorghum for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more beans and sorghum for resale.

loans.name: Rukia

texts.en:
Rukia rents a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for the family and school fees for the children.

For the past two years, she has operated a gravel selling business. She sells from home to her neighbors and passersby. Her major challenge in the business is the high cost of transportation. With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase more gravel for resale to meet the demands of her customers. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase more gravel for resale to meet the demands of her customers.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Fatuma is a very hardworking woman with very good references. Fatuma is requesting this loan in order to buy clothing to enable her to offer a better variety of clothing to her customers. She is very grateful for this opportunity and notes that it will be a great help to her.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Domithile

texts.en: Domithile is married with five children aged between three and sixteen years. She has requested the loan to buy more beers for sale. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the same business. She would like to become a distributor in the future.

loans.use: To buy beers for sale.

loans.name: Ayub

texts.en:
Ayub is a 48-year-old man from Kamsaki in Migori County. He supports five people in his family and is married to Nancy, who is a business lady within the area. He has four children who are 15, 13, 10 and five years old.

He has a tailoring stall, which has been in operation for the last seven years. He is able to generate a monthly income of KES 10,000. He is taking his second loan with KADET LTD, which he will use to purchase clothing materials for making dresses. He will use the anticipated profit to increase the volume of his stocks.

His dream is to open a new tailoring shop and educate his children to a better level.

loans.use: to purchase cloth for clothing

loans.name: Console

texts.en: Console is 33 years old. She sells animals, such as goats and has been in the business for six years. With the loan, she would like to buy more animals, especially goats, for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more goats for resale.

loans.name: Zacharia

texts.en:
Zacharia is a 54-year-old man from Magunga in Homabay County, which is found in the western part of Kenya. He is married to Benter, who is a farmer. He has seven children: four are now adults and the remaining three are 16, 14 and 8 years old, respectively.

He sells timber within his location, which is a business he has been involved in for the last 10 years. He makes a monthly income of KES 15,000. He is taking his second loan with KADET LTD, which he will use to purchase more timber for sale. He will use the anticipated profit to plow it back into the business.

His dream is to have a stable business.

loans.use: To purchase more timber for sale

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is 38 years old. She has sold beans and sorghum for the past four years. Her husband works together with her in the business. She would like to get the loan to buy more sorghum and beans for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more beans and sorghum for sale.

loans.name: Artur

texts.en:
Artur is 44 years old, and he lives in the small but very beautiful city of Sevan in the Gegharkunik area. He lives with his retired parents, wife and two children. For some time he used to work as a driver but now he is in the military service. However, the main income for their family comes from farming. 

Together with his wife, Artur keeps five cows, four bulls, four calves and fifty chickens on their farm. As a result of their hard and tireless work, they are able to sell meat and dairy products to re-sellers and thereby provide a basic living condition for their family.

Artur needs 1,000,000 Armenian drams to buy one cow and a lot of fodder for his cattle to provide for them during the winter months. It is Artur's first loan with Kiva, and he is sure that after it will be a continuous relationship.

loans.use: To buy one cow and a lot of fodder for his cattle

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema has a sewing workshop. She takes on jobs from her customers, who are located in the market district. 

Rehema is requesting another loan to invest in her sewing workshop. She will buy fabric, threads, buttons and other supplies so that she can continue growing and improving her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fabric, threads, buttons and other supplies.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth has operated a retail shop business. She sells to her neighbors and passersby. Her major challenge is stiff competition from other sellers. 

With the 40,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase more basic products to stock her store in order to satisfy the needs of her clients. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standards. Once more, she appreciates the support granted.

loans.use: to purchase more basic products to stock her store in order to satisfy the needs of her clients.

loans.name: Beatha

texts.en: Beathe is 32 years old. She sells beers and soft drinks. She has been in the business for more than a couple of years. She has requested the loan to buy more drinks for sale. The profits from the business will be used to increase her savings.

loans.use: To buy more alcoholic and non-alcoholic drinks for sale.

loans.name: Donathile

texts.en: Donathile is a mother of three children, of which only two go to school. She sells various items in her boutique. With the loan, she would like to add more potatoes and sugar for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay for school for her children.

loans.use: To buy more potatoes and sugar for sale.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Jiliana owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food for the family.

For the past several years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling household consumables for resale. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and the high cost of transportation in her business. 

With the Kshs 50,000, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, beans and paraffin for cooking. She joined Yehu because of the favorable loaning policies.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, beans and paraffin for cooking.

loans.name: Wilfred

texts.en:
Wilfred lives in the Nkubu area of Kenya, which is located at the slopes of Mt. Kenya. He has three children and has been doing this work for 10 years.  His primary income sources are milk, eggs, tea, crops and transportation services.

He stated what is most enjoyable about farming, to which he replied that is  was being able to provide for his family. His biggest challenges are drought, pest and diseases. Animals on the farm have been given no names.

Wilfred was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied: "Repayment period, which is very convenient." This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: "Benefits that I will acquire if [I] use the loan effectively."

His highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked how this loan will benefit his family, Wilfred replied, "My children will be able to further their studies and meet their basic needs."
