As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Wilfred owns the following: poultry and motorcycle, but does not own a cow, pig, pump, bicycle or automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household a mosquito net, electricity, running water and TV, but does not have solar power, sewing machine or DVD.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To purchase pigs.

loans.name: Nurije

texts.en:
Nurije is a fifty-year-old widow. She has five grown children and lives with her children in the Ashkali community. Nurie owns a small, old house that is in need of renovation. It has not had any repairs or renovations in the last several years. 

The household's current main source of income comes from her son, who works for a water company for a very low salary. Her house has old doors and windows, which causes a problem in that the house then loses much heat. Every winter it costs a lot of money to buy the coal to keep the house warm. The family always feels cold and gets sick in the winter due to the lack of heat. 

Nurije needs a loan to buy new doors and windows for the house. This renovation will allow her family to live a normal and healthy life. She really appreciates help from Kiva lenders!

loans.use: to buy new doors and windows.

loans.name: Silas

texts.en:
Silas lives in Nanyuki, Kenya. He is married and has five children. For over 15 years, Silas has been in the farming business. He grows such crops as maize, beans and potatoes, then sells his produce in the local market.

Silas knew Milango through an employee. He now seeks a loan of 83,500 Kenya shillings to renovate his rental houses that give him monthly income. He also wants to buy more land and build more houses for rental. This loan will raise his income, which will in turn make the life he is living right better.

loans.use: To renovate his rental houses.

loans.name: Theonille

texts.en: Theonille is 29 years old. She sells bicycle spare parts and has been in the business for four years. With the loan, she would like to buy more spare parts for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more bicycle spare parts for sale.

loans.name: Agatha

texts.en:
Agatha is a 24-year-old lady from Kehancha, Migori. She is married to Kiriama, who is a businessman from within the same location and who supports the family. Agatha supports two people in her family and has one child, who is two years old.

She sells secondhand clothes within the local market, a business she has been running for the last four years. She makes a monthly income of KES. 8,000. She has applied for her first loan, which she will use to purchase more stock of secondhand clothes. She will use the anticipated profit to grow her business.

Her dream is to have a good life and a bright future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more secondhand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa, vive con su esposo y no tiene hijos a su cargo, asimismo no posee familiares en el extranjero que le generen ingresos para su familia. Ella, se dedica a la elaboración de pan, posee una experiencia técnica alrededor de 20 años, inicia realizándolo en un horno de barro produciendo pan para ofrecerles a los vecinos y posteriormente fue incrementando la demanda.
El crédito que requiere le permitirá comprar la materia prima necesaria tales como: harina, royal,  jalea, saborizante, manteca, azúcar, entre otros;  este le ayudara a aumentar sus ganancias y con ello una estabilidad familiar y económica.
Su sueño es obtener mayores ingresos  para que su negocio crezca y ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Rosa lives with her husband and has no children to take care of; neither does she have relatives abroad to generate income for her family.  She bakes bread for a living and she has around 20 years of technical experience.  She started out baking in a clay oven, making bread to sell to her neighbors, and her demand later increased.

She needs this loan to buy the raw materials she needs, such as flour, baking powder, gelatin, flavoring, lard, and sugar, among others.  This will help her increase her profits and, accordingly, her family and financial stability.  

Her dream is to make more profits so her business will grow and to offer her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy flour, baking powder, gelatin, flavoring, lard, and sugar, among other things

loans.name: Marie Gorette

texts.en: Marie Gorette, 36, is married with four children who all attend school. She has run a canteen for the past two years. She has requested the loan to add more sodas, andazi and fruits to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees.

loans.use: To purchase sodas, andazi and fruits to sell.

loans.name: Donatha

texts.en: Donatha is 45 years old. She sells sorghum, maize and beans and has been selling those items for the past ten years. Donatha has requested the loan to add more sorghum to her inventory. The profits from the business will be added to her savings.

loans.use: to buy sorghum, maize and beans for resale.

loans.name: Joselyne

texts.en: Joselyne,44, sells foodstuffs and has been in the business for the past four years. She has requested the loan to buy more cooking oil, soaps and beans to sell in her store. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To purchase more cooking oil, soaps and beans to sell.

loans.name: Adjorkor's Group

texts.en:
Adjorkor is 61 years old and a widow with three adult children. She completed elementary six school. She is engaged in a 'kenkey' (corn paste) and fish business and started with a small amount of money she had saved. To date, she has ten years of experience. Adjorkor is requesting a loan to purchase fish, corn, corn husks and firewood to prepare 'kenkey' and sell to customers. In the future, she wishes to open many stands to sell to a large number of people. 

The other members of the group are engaged in business and are requesting a total amount of GHS 900.

loans.use: To purchase fish, corn, corn husks and firewood to prepare 'kenkey' and sell to customers.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en: Jacqueline, 25, sells children's clothes and has been in the business for four years. With the loan, she would like to buy more clothes to add to her inventory. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her three children.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to resell.

loans.name: Jannette

texts.en: Jannette is 29 years old.  She sells different items in her business.  With the requested loan, she will add more items for sale, such as cooking oil, rice, and biscuits.  She plans to use the profits for building a house.

loans.use: to buy more cooking oil and biscuits for sale.

loans.name: Immaculee

texts.en: Immaculee is 52 years old.  She sells beans and sorghum and has been in the business for the past twenty years.  With the loan, she would like to buy more beans and sorghum for sale.  The profits from the business will be used to make more savings.

loans.use: to buy more beans and sorghum for sale.

loans.name: Adele

texts.en: Adele is 42 years old.  She sells food items and has been in the business for the past five years.  With the requested loan, she would like to buy more items such as maize, beans, and rice for sale.  The profits from the business will be used to pay for her children’s school fees.

loans.use: to buy more maize, beans, and rice for sale.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama is a widow and has 7 children.  Even though she did not receive any formal education, Ama is a successful businesswoman.  She prepares and sells kenkey for a living, which is a traditional Ghanaian staple dish that is made from corn dough and wrapped in banana leaves.  She normally sells her kenkey in Apewosika, near Cape Coast.  She has been actively involved in this business for about 8 years.  As the sole breadwinner in the family, Ama uses her income to provide for the entire family.  She will use the loan to purchase more maize, thus helping to improve her overall sales.  With the new profits, Ama plans to diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for kenkey.

loans.name: Jean Paul

texts.en: Jean Paul is a single, 20-year-old man.  He wants to buy a computer to be used for his architecture job.  He has been working informally as a constructor but would like to upgrade his business.  The business profits will be used to hire more people to help.

loans.use: to buy a computer for architecture software.

loans.name: Marie Louise

texts.en: Marie Louise is a 35-year-old mother of two children, both of whom are in school.  Her husband works together in the business of selling food items.  With the loan, she would like to buy more bananas, cooking oil, and potatoes for sale.  The profits from the business will be used to earn more savings.

loans.use: to buy more bananas, cooking oil, and potatoes for sale.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Although she has received no prior formal education, Abena is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling provisions and soap in Apewosika (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for six years. 

Abena is married and has five children. Her husband works as a carpenter. The proceeds from her business normally go toward helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and paying their children’s school fees. 

Abena wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of provisions and soap. In the long term, Abena plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demand.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Due to difficult circumstances, Elizabeth did not have access to formal education.  This has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur.  Elizabeth currently sells charcoal in Apewosika, near Cape Coast.  She has been doing so for about 4 years.  She is married to a driver and they have 3 children together.  Elizabeth uses all of her income to feed and provide for her family. Elizabeth will use the loan to purchase an increased amount of charcoal, which will aid her in improving her overall sales.  Elizabeth wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of charcoal.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Due to difficult circumstances, Ekua did not have access to any form of formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. Currently, Ekua sells salted fish in Apewosika (near Cape Coast). She has been doing so for about 10 years. As a widow with six children, Ekua uses all her income to feed and provide for her family. 

Ekua will use the loan to purchase an increased amount of salt and fish, which will aid her in improving her overall sales. Ekua wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of salt and fish.

loans.name: Lucy's Group

texts.en:
Lucy's group has two members and they are members of the mother group called Paragogous.  Lucy is 57 years old and a widow with two adult children who are on their own.  She sells kenkey (corn paste) and fish.  She works every day, starting very early.  Lucy is a very hardworking person who wants to improve as time goes by.  She is asking for this loan to buy corn, fish, and firewood so that she can cook and sell kenkey.  

She’s grateful for the 1,300 GHS loan opportunity that she and her girlfriend, Gladys, are receiving to improve their business.

loans.use: to buy corn, fish, and firewood.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Even though Efua grew up in poverty without an education, this has not stopped her from fulfilling her dream of achieving a better life for her and her family.  Currently, Efua is an entrepreneur.  She sells charcoal in Apewosika, which is near Cape Coast.  Her business enterprise has grown substantially since she began one year ago.  She uses the income from her business to help her husband raise their 2 children.  Efua has identified that there are growing demands among consumers for her product, but she is unable to meet their needs due to limited inventory capacity.  Thus, she aims to use her loan to purchase more charcoal to sell.  With the new profits from her expanded business, Efua wants to ensure that all her children will be given the opportunity to distance their family from poverty.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Although she has received no prior formal education, Efua is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling rice water in Apewosika (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for one year. Efua is married and has five children. Her husband works as a farmer. The proceeds from her business normally go toward helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and paying their children’s school fees. 

Efua wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of rice water. In the long term, Efua plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demand.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels to sell greater quantities of rice water.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Due to difficult circumstances, Margaret did not have access to any form of formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. Currently, Margaret sells cooking ingredients in Apewosika (near Cape Coast). She has been doing so for about four years. She is married to a driver, and together they have four children. Margaret uses all her income to feed and provide for her family. 

Margaret will use the loan to purchase an increased amount of cooking ingredients, which will aid her in improving her overall sales. Margaret wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of cooking ingredients.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Although she has received no prior formal education, Abena is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling palm kernel oil in Apewosika (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for 10 years. Abena is married and has four children. Her husband works as a farmer. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and paying their children’s school fees. 

Abena wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of palm kernel oil. In the long term, Abena plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demand.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels.

loans.name: Adowowa

texts.en: Even though Adowowa grew up in poverty without an education, this has not stopped her from fulfilling her dream of achieving a better life for her and her family. Currently, Adowowa is an entrepreneur. She prepares and sells ‘Kenkey’ (a traditional Ghanaian dish made from corn dough and wrapped in banana leaves) for a living. She primarily sells her ‘Kenkey’ in Apewosika (near Cape Coast). Her business enterprise has grown substantially since she began one year ago. She uses the income from her business to help her husband raise their six children. Adowowa has identified that there are growing demands among consumers’ for her ‘Kenkey’. Nevertheless, she is unable to meet their needs due to a limited inventory capacity. Thus, she aims to use her loan to purchase a greater quantity of maize, helping her to prepare more of her tasty ‘Kenkey’. With the new profits from her expanded business, Adowowa wants to buck the trend by ensuring that all her children will be given the opportunity to further distance their family from poverty.

loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity of maize

loans.name: Kabagire

texts.en: Kabagire is a 33-year-old married woman with three children living in Kagadi, Uganda. She has been in the teaching profession for eight years and with her little pay, she has educated her children and bought land, although she faces the challenge of low salary. Kabagire intends to use the loan to buy nails, iron sheets and doors to complete constructing her house.

loans.use: to buy nails, iron sheets and and doors to complete building her house.

loans.name: Dinah

texts.en: Dinah is a 31-year-old married woman with three children living in Kamwenge, Uganda. She runs a piggery project and from the profits, she has been able to educate her children. She also works as a school librarian and with her meager salary, she has been able to start on the construction of her residential house. Dinah is requesting a loan to buy building materials such as bricks and sand.

loans.use: to buy building materials such as bricks and sand.

loans.name: Helena

texts.en: Helena is divorced and has 7 children.  Even though she did not receive any formal education, Helena is a successful businesswoman.  She sells packaged biscuits in Apewosika (near Cape Coast).  She has been actively involved in this business for about 3 years.  As the sole breadwinner in the family, Helena uses her income to provide for the entire family.  Helena will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of packaged biscuits, thus helping to improve her overall sales.  With the new profits from her expanded business, Helena plans to diversify the type of products that she sells, adapting to her customers’ changing preferences.

loans.use: to purchase more packaged biscuits.

loans.name: Kasimbazi

texts.en: Kasimbazi used the previous loan to buy 30 jerrycans of local brew to sell. He is a 30-year-old man with four children. He has operated a business selling local brew in Kagadi for 10 years. High transport costs and inadequate capital are factors affecting the growth of this business. He wishes to educate his children up to the University and buy a car, and while his business plan is to diversify his business and expand into other markets, Kasimbazi intends to use the loan to buy local brew to sell.

loans.use: to buy local brew to sell.

loans.name: Kaija

texts.en: Kaija is a married, 46-year-old man living in Kagadi, Uganda.  He has 4 children, ages 23, 19, 18 and 10.  He has been selling produce and groceries since 2006 with the aim of earning money to support his family.  He also earns additional income from pigs and farming.  His dream is to buy a vehicle to aid the transportation of produce from farmers to his business premises.  His major challenge is inadequate capital.  Kaija intends to use the loan to buy beans, maize, groundnuts, and rice to sell.

loans.use: to buy beans, maize, groundnuts, and rice to sell.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en: Simon is a male Ugandan aged 32 and married with 7 children between 10 and 1 years old living in Kagadi, Uganda. He operates a wholesale and retail shop in Kagadi where he sells general merchandise. He does farming to supplement his income. His dream is to construct a good permanent house but his major challenge is stiff competition from similar businessmen. Simon is requesting a loan to buy general merchandise like soap, water, salt and sugar to sell.

loans.use: to buy soap, water, salt and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Lwanga

texts.en: Lwanga is a 29-year-old married man in Kagadi, Uganda.  He has 3 children, ages 11, 7 and 4.  Lwanga has been selling alcohol since 2008 to get money and expand his business.  He also earns money from a phone charging system and a saloon.  He serves the people of Hoima and around Kagadi.  He hopes to build a good home and to educate his children but his challenge is price fluctuation.  He wants a loan to buy more alcohol to resell.

loans.use: to buy more alcohol to sell.

loans.name: Fegauiai

texts.en: Fegauai is 46 years old and married with 7 children.  She wants to start a small business making and selling pancakes in her community.  To do this, she needs a loan to buy flour, dripping oil, sugar, baking powder, and plastic bags.  In the future, Fegauiai hopes to earn enough profit to improve her business and to help her family’s commitments.  She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy flour, dripping oil, sugar, baking powder, and plastic bags.

loans.name: Creciendo Para El Futuro 4, 5 & 6 Group

texts.en:
Juana is the coordinator of her group, "Creciendo Para el Futuro 4, 5 & 6" ("Growing for the Future").  Her group is located in Samana, a lush and rugged peninsula with a new and still undeveloped tourism industry.  She is a single mother with 4 children.  Juana wants to establish her business by building a local shop.  Having repaid her previous loans, and because her business has grown, Juana is excited to be taking her 9th loan with Esperanza.  She has had her retail clothing and shoe sales business for around five years.

Juana plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying many dozens of each product in order to sell them to her clients in her community.  She will use the additional profits to save, to supply some of the needs of her children, and for her home.  Juana dreams of becoming professional and having a successful business.  This Esperanza associate began with us to access loans for her business.  She thanks you all for your support!

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes, cosmetics, etc.

loans.name: Melikelio

texts.en: Melikelio is a 35-year-old single woman.  She bakes and sells pancakes and donuts in her community to earn a living.  This is the first time that she has decided to operate her hobby as a business.  Melikelio needs a loan to purchase ingredients and utensils.  She plans to use her profits to improve her business and to help support her family.  Melikelio is a new member of SPBD since April this year, 2013.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of flour, sugar, cooking oil, baking powder, a new stove, pots, and baking utensils.

loans.name: Cinthya

texts.es:
Cinthya continúa con su venta de pan casero y bocadillos, quiere fortalecer con este crédito la venta de comidas .Siempre realiza las tareas de su hogar ,  tres veces a la semana produce pan , bocadillos y en las noches las comidad rápidas. Con el crédito anterior compró equipo y reforzó materia prima. Con este nuevo crédito reforzará materia prima y productos para la producción de comida.
Tiene como planes a futuro poder instalarse en el centro urbano de Turrialba, con un negocio más grande de comidas , generar empleo.Con las utilidades poder construir su casa propia y apoyar el estudio de sus hijos, ella sueña con ver  a sus hijos profesionales, para que puedan vivir mejor.
Logra hacer una buena gestión del crédito anterior dentro de sus posibilidades y considerando las características del contexto en el cual se desarrolla su actividad, marca un crecimiento en sus activos con respecto al crédito anterior.
texts.en:
Cinthya is still selling her home-baked bread and pastries.  She wants to strengthen her food-selling business with this loan.  She always does the household chores and three times a week she makes bread, pastries, and at night she makes fast foods.  With her previous loan she bought equipment and stocked up on raw materials.  With this new loan she will stock up on raw materials and food preparation products.

She has future plans to set up shop in the urban center of Turrialba with a bigger food business and to create jobs.  With her earnings she will be able to build her own home and pay for her children's education.  She dreams of seeing her children become professionals so they will have a better life.    

She managed her previous loan well considering her limitations and the circumstances in which she works.  Her business has increased since her previous loan.

loans.use: to buy a mixer, ingredients, flour, butter, fillings, and products such as sauces, mayonnaise, meat, and chicken.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy utensils to start a restaurant

loans.name: Miriama

texts.en:
Miriama is 20 years old and married with no children. She wants to start a small business of making and selling chips in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy an oven, a large frying pan, plastic bags, a basin and dripping oil. 

In the future, Miriama  hopes to expand her business and to save more money to support her family. She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy an oven, a large frying pan, plastic bags, a basin and dripping oil.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
This is 28-year-old Ibrahim. He is married and has two children, aged 10 and 3 years. In 2003, Ibrahim established his pharmacy business. He began his business because he wanted to improve his life. His business is located in the outskirts, and his main customers are general community people. 

Working seven days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about 600,000 SLL (Sierra Leone leones) every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL. Ibrahim requires a loan in order to buy more medicines for resale. He hopes that this loan will support him through proper use. In the future, Ibrahim plans to expand by selling drugs on a wholesale basis and to educate his children up to university level. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more medicines for resale.

loans.name: Nuulopa

texts.en:
Nuulopa is a 42-year-old married woman with 11 children. She has a small plantation and grows taro, yam and banana to earn a living. She has been doing this for four years. 

Nuulopa has requested a loan to buy a wheelbarrow, a back bag sprayer, chemicals and bush knives. 

She has been a member of SPBD since 2011. With her profits, Nuulopa hopes to save more money for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy a wheelbarrow, a back bag sprayer, chemicals and bush knives.

loans.name: Saili

texts.en:
Saili is a 21-year-old single mother with one child. She operates a small shop, selling a variety of goods in her community. She has two years of experience with this business. 

Saili has requested a loan to restock her shop with general goods such as freezer stuff like chicken leg quarters, sausages, canned food, sugar, flour, toilet tissues, toothpaste, etc. She plans to use her profits to support her family financially and to be able to help her business needs. She has been a member of SPBD since 2011.

loans.use: To purchase boxes of chicken thighs and leg quarters, sausages, sacks of sugar, flour, boxes of canned food, toilet tissue, toothpaste, etc.

loans.name: Siisii

texts.en:
Siisii is a 32-year-old married woman with six children. She has a small plantation and grows taro plants to earn a living. She has been doing this for three years. Siisii has requested a loan to buy barbed wire, chemicals, fertilizer and a wheelbarrow for her business. 

She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. With her profits, Siisii hopes to purchase new land to extend her business and to save more money for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy barbed wire, chemicals, fertilizer and a wheelbarrow.

loans.name: Maria Concepcion

texts.es:
Doña María Concepción tiene una edad 40 ella es casada madre de 4 hijos y agricultora con una profesión de secundaria terminada graduándose de maestra de educación primaria. Ella da clases en la aldea donde habita a niños de kínder y de primer grado siendo su pasión los niños. Su familia ha sido agricultora durante generaciones y la de ella no es la excepción dedicándose en compañía de su esposo al cultivo de maíz, frijol y café el cual es comercializado en el mercado local y con algunos intermediarios que llegan a la zona. Las tierras que trabajan son propias y están ubicadas muy cerca de su casa trasladándose a pie diariamente siendo ella y su esposo los únicos involucrados.

Ella necesita ayuda para la compra de fertilizantes, abonos entre otros para dar asistencia técnica y mantenimiento a sus cultivos de café los cuales están en su punto para poder producir una buena cosecha y aprovecharla al máximo. 

Los planes son los de poder incrementar el área de cultivo y para sus hijos apoyarlos en sus estudios ya que con esta solicitud buscan mejorar sus ingresos, que las ganancias sean más ya que sus metas son asegurar la plantación y aprovecharla al máximo.
texts.en:
María is 40 years old, married and a mother to four children.  She is a farmer but did complete high school and is a qualified primary school teaches.  She gives classes to children in nursery and in the first year of primary school in her village.  Children are María's passion.  María's family have been farmers for generations and hers is no exception, as she works alongside her husband growing corn, beans and coffee to later sell at the local market or to wholesalers that come to the area.  María owns the land that she works.  Close to the house, she can arrive there by foot.  She and her husband are the only people who work this land.

María needs help to buy fertilisers, manure and more in order to give their coffee crops some help and to maintain them.  The plants look like they will produce a good harvest so María must take full advantage of this.

María plans to expand the area she uses to grow the crops on so that she can support her children with their studies.  María hopes that, with this loan, she can improve her income and increase her profits.  Her aim is to ensure a good yield this year and to take full advantage of it.

loans.use: to buy fertilisers and manure to help her coffee crops.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen is a 22-year-old single mother with one child. She operates a dressmaking business venture. She has five years of experience in this line of business. Helen needs a loan to buy more variety of fabric, fabric paint and the like, plus a new overlock sewing machine for her business. She hopes to use her profits to improve her business and to support her family financially. She joined SPBD in 2011.

loans.use: To purchase a new overlock sewing machine, rolls of fabric, thread, needles, fabric paint and brushes

loans.name: Alba Lely

texts.es:
Alba,  se le presenta la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo porque requiere de más capital de trabajo; este le permitirá comprar verduras y frutas tales como: manzanas, uvas, naranjas, tomates, chiles, cebollas, asimismo frijol, queso, maíz, entre otros.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a tener mejoras en el negocio  y más ingresos por las ventas que se realizan; las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares han mejorado.
texts.en:
Alba needs a new loan because she needs more working capital.  This will allow her to buy fruits and vegetables such as apples, grapes, oranges, tomatoes, chillis and onions, as well as beans, cheese, corn and more.

Alba's last loan helped her to improve her business and generate more income through sales.  Her financial situation and family circumstances have improved.

loans.use: to buy apples, grapes, oranges, tomatoes, chillis, onions, beans, cheese, corn and more.

loans.name: Dorian Jose

texts.es:
El señor dorian vive en la cuidad de managua trabaja  en el area de mantenimiento de una universidad de la capital 
 el señor dorian se caracteriza por ser una persona responsable con su familia  esta haciendo la solicitud de un credito a kiva  ya que nesecita el dinero para  el cambio de techo de su vivienda que esta el mal estado y con la temporada de invierno se le pasa el agua en su casa .
agradeciendo de antemano la oportunidad brindada para mejorar las condiciones de vida a su familia .
texts.en:
Dorian lives in the city of Managua and works in the maintenance department at one of the capital's universities.

Dorian is responsible with his family.  He is applying for a Kiva loan as he needs money to change the roof on his house.  The current one is inbad condition and in winter water falls into the house.

Dorian sends his thanks for this opportunity to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Aneliueta

texts.en:
Aneliueta is a 25-year-old married woman with no children. She has a small plantation and grows taro plants to earn a living. She has been doing this for three years. 

Aneliueta has requested a loan to buy chemicals, a wheelbarrow, bush knives, a file, an axe and fertilizer. She has been a member of SPBD since 2011. With her profits, Aneliueta hopes to save more money for her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, a wheelbarrow, bush knives, a file, an axe and fertilizer

loans.name: Kapr

texts.en:
This is 33-year-old Kapr. He is married and has one child aged seven years. In 2007, Kapr established his cow meat business, which he began because he was trained as a businessman. His business is located in the outskirts of town and his main customers are women and men. Working seven days a week and ten hours a day, he earns about SLL 500,000 every month. Kapr now requires a loan of SLL 4,500,000 in order to purchase a whole cow, which he will slaughter and sell, for his business. He hopes that this loan will help him to establish a ‘woreh’ (cattle ranch) and start selling wholesale.

Kapr was unable to establish a ‘woreh’ previously as his loan provided a livelihood for his family and paid school fees for his child. He still plans to establish a ‘woreh’ and continue to support his child’s education. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy a cow for his business

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en:
Amelia is a 28-year-old married woman with seven children. She has a small plantation and grows bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for three years. Amelia has requested a loan to buy a back bag sprayer, chemicals, bush knives, barbed wire, nails and a file for sharpening. 

She has been a member of SPBD since 2011. With her profits, Amelia hopes to save more money to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy a back bag sprayer, chemicals, bush knives, barbed wire, nails and a file for sharpening

loans.name: Debora

texts.en:
Debora is a tax preparer. She lives and works in Austin. And while for some people, tax preparation may not seem like exciting work, for Debora it has become a calling to help Spanish-speaking immigrants still learning about U.S. financial and taxation systems.

“I like helping the community,” Debora said. “A lot of people, when they come to me and I explain to them: this number represents your earnings, this and these are your deductions, this is your refund or what you owe, what they tell me is that no one has ever taken the time to explain anything to them. I always try to make sure people understand what they are signing.” 

Debora got the idea to become a tax preparer while she was still working at a bank as a customer service representative. Friends and acquaintances were inquiring about tax filing, so she referred them to her tax preparer, who asked Debora for assistance as an intermediary. 

“I was faxing information to her and relaying information to the tax preparer, going back and forth and I stopped and thought about it,” Debora said. “And I decided that I should take some classes and learn more about tax preparation. And I made a determination that this was something I wanted to do. And my business has been growing every year.”

Debora started work as a tax preparer four years ago, opening D&C Tax Service around the time her second child was born. Becoming her own boss has afforded her more freedom to manage her time and make business decisions than working for a corporation. 

“If you have a vision in your mind, you can decide for yourself after weighing the good and bad whether to take the risks,” Debora said. 

Debora learned about Accion Texas Inc. when she saw an Accion vehicle in the parking lot of her bank. She went online to learn more and decided to apply for a loan to bring her business to the next level. 

Debora is using her $5,450 loan for working capital, to pay for liability insurance, and professional development and training to gain certification in different areas of taxation, so she can offer new services. She has taken classes to become a notary. She is going to take classes through her professional organization to learn more about how health care reform will have an impact on taxation. She wants to learn more specifics about the Internal Revenue Service’s collections processes. 

Debora said she is looking into the costs and benefits of renting office space and hiring an assistant. For the moment, she said her tax preparation service offers her the opportunity to work from home and to help the community.

loans.use: to pay for liability insurance, professional development and training

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.en:
Ricardo is an entrepreneur from Matamoros, Mexico, where he owned a car wash business for 20 years before he crossed the border to neighboring Brownsville 12 years ago to unite with his wife and children, all American citizens. When Ricardo first moved to Brownsville, he worked at a car wash, and later for a construction company.

It was while Ricardo was working for a construction company that he got the idea to combine the knowledge that he gained when he owned the car wash in Mexico with what he learned working in construction to form a new company: A. Professional Power Wash. 

“I learned that there was a big need for maintaining parking lots,” Ricardo said. “So I decided to start this business three years ago.”

Ricardo and his six part-time employees power wash the blacktops of parking lots and other asphalt surfaces, apply the black sealant to protect the asphalt, and paint the stripes on the surface to create parking spaces or traffic stripes.

After three years, Ricardo said his business is thriving, but he hopes to grow his business and to employ more people. 

An acquaintance of his – another business owner in the construction business –  told him about Accion Texas Inc., saying that borrowing money to finance his growth plans would help him build his credit. 

“He said that in the United States, you borrow money to help build your credit and to help your business grow,” Ricardo said. “So I found Accion and I applied for a loan. And I am so glad that there are people like your company to help business owners like me.”

Ricardo said his experience with Accion was very enlightening and helped him to learn more about credit in the United States. He is using his $5,450 loan to buy supplies for his business and to pay for expenses related to marketing. Ricardo said his business has grown mostly through referrals. He is hoping with brochures describing his services, he will more quickly be able to grow his business.

“I am doing a presentation with a business that has stores all over Texas and they are looking for someone to take care of all the stores in the Valley,” Ricardo said. “I think they will accept my proposal because I am providing a good service at a good price. And I think if I get this contract, my business will double and I can double the number of employees that I have.”

loans.use: to buy supplies for his business and to pay for expenses related to marketing

loans.name: Rodolfo Jose

texts.es:
Le señor Rodolfo vive en la cuidad de managua trabaja  en una institución del estado casado su profesión es ingeniero en sistema.

don Rodolfo visito ceprodel para  solicitar un crédito para invertirlo en las mejoras de su casa para proporcionarles mayor comodidad a su familia. y la vez agradece por esta oportunidad que se le esta dando para mejorar así su casa.
texts.en:
Rodolfo lives in the city of Managua and works as a computer programmer.  He is married.

Rodolfo came to visit Ceprodel in order to apply for a loan to invest in making improvements to his home.  This will make it more comfortable for his family.  He is grateful that he is being given the opportunity to do this work in his home.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Ibrahim A.

texts.en: This is 27-year-old Ibrahim.  He is married, and has three children who are six years old, four years old and four months old. Two of them are school going children. He has three additional dependents who live with him because they are his younger ones and he is assisting them in their schooling. They help to do some domestic work at home.  In 2005, Ibrahim established his soft drinks, hard drinks, energy drinks, biscuits, mobile phones & accessories business. He began his business as he used to assist his father in business after school.  When he lost his father, he dropped out of school and joined his elder brother in business. He served his elder brother for some years and his brother later gave him some money to start his own business.  Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about Le 2,120,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan of Le 5,000,000. Ibrahim requires a loan in order to purchase some hard and soft driinks and mobile phones. In the future, Ibrahim plans to open another outlet, build a house, and provide a quality education for his children. This loan will help to improve the business.  Inadequate capital is his major challenge. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase some hard and soft drinks and mobile phones

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en: This is 31-year-old Mariama.  She is married, and has five children aged 13, 10, 8, 5 and 2 years old. Three of them are school-going children. She has two additional dependents who live with her to assist her in business.  In 2011, Mariama established her palm oil, rice, salt, caustic soda, vegetable oil, sugar etc business. She began her business because her education came to a halt during the 10-year rebel war.  Her foster parent introduced her to the business.  When she became fully mature, she gave her some money to start her own business. Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,998,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan of Le 3,000,000. Mariama requires a loan to purchase some containers of palm oil, bags of rice and sugar. In the future, Mariama plans to develop her piece of land, educate her children and rent another shop. This loan will help to increase sales. Some debtors will not pay on time. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase palm oil, rice and sugar.

loans.name: Ronald

texts.es: Ronald, de 22 años , es soltero y vive junto a su familia en la casa de sus padres. A pesar de su edad y sus aspiraciones por seguir estudiando, Ronald se dedica a la agricultura. Todas las mañanas se dirige junto a su padre a los cultivos de papa; los cuales cuida con mucho esmero, ya que tiene que sacar el máximo provecho a los terrenos de cultivo que alquila para poder producir el mencionado tubérculo. Con las ganancias obtenidas durante todo este tiempo, compró chanchos y toros con los cuales puede obtener un dinero extra, ya que realiza el labrado de la tierra con la ayuda de los toros que posee. Este es el tercer crédito con KIVA y se siente muy agardecido por el apoyo financiero recibido para seguir adelante.Ronald invertirá los S/.2500 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en: Ronald is 22 years old, single and lives with his family at his parents' house.  In spite of his age and the fact that he wants to continue studying, Ronald is working in agriculture.  Every morning he goes out with his father to their potato crops, which he carefully looks after as he needs to take full advantage of the land that he rents so that he can grow potatoes.  With the profits he has earned, Ronald bought pigs and bulls with which he can earn some more money.  Ronald works on his land with the help of his bulls.  This is Ronald's third loan with Kiva and he is very grateful for the financial support he receives in order to get ahead.  Ronald will invest the 2500 Nuevo Soles in buying organic manure to nourish his sown land.

loans.use: to buy organic manure.

loans.name: Erlin Suyapa

texts.es:
Erlin es una joven de 26 años de edad, en un estado civil de unión libre y madre de 3 hijos los cuales viven en familia todos juntos. Ella curso hasta el 6 grado de la primaria y es agricultora desde su infancia ya que sus padres son agricultores por generaciones y la de ella no es la excepción. Son ella y su pareja los únicos involucrados en el cultivo de maíz, frijol y café actividades que han sido ingreso para su familia (padres) y siguen siéndolo en la actualidad para la de ella. Sus clientes son las diferentes bodegas, pulperías e intermediarios que llegan a la zona en busca del producto.

Hoy en día ella solicita ayuda para la compra de insumos y abonos para la siembra de maíz ya que por medio de esto ella podrá tener una mejor cosecha y mejores ganancias para re-invertir y salir de su compromiso. 

Sus planes son cultivar una variedad que no los límite para su comercio como Chile, remolacha entre otros y puedan generar mayores ingresos para su familia, así como los de comprar ganado para distribuir los derivados de la leche como el queso, la mantequilla, cuajada, etc. ya que así ella podrá asegurar la educación de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Erlin is 26 years old.  She has a partner and is a mother to three children.  They all live together as a family.  Erlin completed up to the end of sixth year at primary school and has been working in farming since her childhood.  Her parents, and generations before them, have been farmers and Erlin is no exception.  Erlin and her partners are the only ones working on their crops, growing corn, beans and coffee. This work provided an income for her parents and continues to generate an income for Erlin.  Her clients include various grocery stores and wholesalers who come to the area looking for supplies.

Today Erlin is applying for help to buy supplies and manure for her corn crops.  With it she will be able to have a better harvest and more profit to reinvest and to pay off her loan.

Erlin's plan is to grow a variety of crops to sell, such as chillis, beetroot and more. She can then earn a higher income for her family and buy cattle in order to sell dairy products such as cheese, butter and curd.  Erlin will then be able to guarantee an education for her children.

loans.use: to buy supplies and manure for sowing corn.

loans.name: Alisher

texts.ru: Алишеру 33 года. Он с женой, дочерью, сыном и матерью проживает в районе Кубадиён. Он как глава семьи хочет улучшить условия проживания и намерен заняться животноводческим бизнесом. Это весьма прибыльное дело, так как всегда есть спрос на мясо и мясные продукты, а расходы на содержание скота невелики. Алишер имеет все условия, чтобы пасти скот и к тому же скотный рынок находится недалеко от его дома. Алишер имеет свой план откорма и продажи скота. Он намерен каждый месяц закупать по 5 голов крупного рогатого  скота, откармливать в течение 30-35 дней и затем продавать на скотном рынке. Для реализации цели Алишер обратился за кредитом и очень надеется, что Вы его поддержите в начале нового бизнеса.
texts.en: Alisher is 33 years old.  He lives in the Qubadiyon region with his wife, his daughter and his son.  As the head of the family, he wants to improve his family's living conditions and he intends to start a business raising livestock.  This is a very profitable business, as there is always demand for meat and animal products, and the maintenance costs for cattle are low.  Alisher has all he needs to raise cattle and the animal market is not far from his home.  He has a plan for raising and reselling the herd; he intends to purchase five head of cattle every month, feed them for 30-35 days and then sell them at the animal market.  To make this goal a reality, Alisher has asked for a loan and he hopes that you will support him in starting his business.

loans.use: to buy five cows to raise and resell

loans.name: Rahimatu

texts.en:
This is 27-year-old Rahimatu. She is married, and has three children aged nine, five and two. All of them are school children. She has two additional dependents, who live with her to be fostered. 

In 2010, Rahimatu established her assorted maggi, tomato paste, water plastic, baking powder etc. business. She began her business because she dropped out of school because of early pregnancy and when she got married her husband gave her some amount of money to start business. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about SLL 1,060,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan of an amount of SLL 3,000,000. Rahimatu requires a loan in order to buy cartons of assorted maggie. In the future, Rahimatu plans to acquire a shop, buy a piece of land, educate her children and become an international business woman. This loan will help to develop her business. Shortage of some items is her major challenge. She is a hardworking business woman; she thanks you for being generous to business women. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy cartons of assorted maggie.

loans.name: Osman J.

texts.en:
This is 32-year-old Osman. He is married, and has two children: a seven-year-old and a nine-month-old baby; one is a school-going child. In 2008, Osman established his jeans, shirts, polos, and shoes business. He began his business when he dropped out of school. His sister, who was supposed to assist him with school, only gave him a small amount to start petty trading.  

Working seven days a week and 15 hours a day, he earns about SLL 1,508,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan of an amount of SLL 3,000,000. Osman requires a loan in order to buy jeans, shirts and polos. 

In the future, Osman plans to develop his piece of land, educate his children and become an international business man. This loan will help him to achieve some of his future plans. Inadequate capital is his main challenge. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy jeans, shirts and polos.

loans.name: Sela

texts.en: Sela is 36 years old and married with six children. She wants to start a small business making and selling Pork Buns in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy an oven, a sack of flour, a box of chicken, onions  and soy sauce. In the future, Sela hopes to expand her business. She joined SPBD in 2001 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy an oven, a sack of flour, a box of chicken, onions  and soy sauce.

loans.name: Peka

texts.en:
Peka is a 32-year-old married woman with six children. She makes and sells ice cake, and grows vegetables in a vegetable garden and sells her vegetables in her community to earn a living. She has three years of experience with this business. 

Peka needs a loan to purchase timber, sacks of cement mix, nails to renovate her house, school uniforms for her kids, and more cordial or icebel mix, sugar, plastic cups and etc for her ice cake business. She plans to use her profits to support her family. Peka has been a member of SPBD since 2010.

loans.use: To purchase iron roofing, sacks of cement mixture, timber, nails, school uniform, plastic cups, icebel mix, sacks of sugar and large plastic jugs.

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina is a 42-year-old married woman with seven children. She operates a small shop in her community. She has five years of experience with this business. 

Lina has requested a loan to restock her shop. She wants to purchase accessories like sacks of sugar, flour, snacks, boxes of cigarettes, ice blocks, soft drinks, boxes of canned food. She plans to use her profits to support her family financially. She has been a member of SPBD since 2009.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of sugar, flour, snacks, boxes of cigarettes, soft drinks, chicken leg quarters and sausages to restock her shop.

loans.name: Kilisitina

texts.en:
Kilisitina is a 57-year-old married woman who has five children. She has a small garden where she grows vegetables that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for many years. Kilisitina needs a loan to buy weed killer, bush knives, sack of fertilizer and gardening tools to help maintain her business. 

Kilisitina has just joined SPBD for financial assistance. Kilisitina will use the profits from her sales to support her family.

loans.use: to buy weed killer, bush knives, sacks of fertilizer and gardening tools.

loans.name: Leuta

texts.en:
Leuta is 62 years old and married with eight children. She has a small garden where she grows vegetables that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for many years. 

Leuta needs a loan to purchase cement mix to renovate her home, school fees for her kids, and tools for her vegetable garden like weed killer, gardening tools, vegetable seeds and sack of fertilizer to help maintain her business. 

She has been a member of SPBD since 2010. Leuta will use the profits from her sales to improve her business and to support her family's needs.

loans.use: To purchase gardening tools, weed killer, more vegetable seeds, sacks of cement mix and pay school fees.

loans.name: Malia

texts.en:
Malia is a 36-year-old mother with four children. Her husband is the fisherman of the family and she helps sell fresh fish in her community to earn a living. She has many years of experience with this business. 

Malia needs a loan to buy fishing gear and other equipment listed above (fishing net, canoe, ropes, fishing strings, bullets) for her business. She plans to use her profits to support her family. Malia has been a member of SPBD since 2010.

loans.use: To purchase fishing nets, a canoe (fishing boat), ropes, bullets, rolls of fishing string.

loans.name: Fuatino

texts.en: Fuatino is a 20-year-old woman who is single with no children. She plans to start a small business, running taxi. Fuatino needs a loan to buy tires, seat covers and a battery. She will use her profits to to buy a new vehicle. Fuatino joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy tires, seat covers and a battery.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana is a solo mother aged 21 years with one child. She has a small garden where she grows vegetables, and also a plantation which is worked by the men in her family, and the crops are sold at her village or at other times are brought to the market in town. She has been doing this for a few years. 

Ana needs a loan to buy a weed killer, bush knives, sack of fertilizer to help maintain her business. She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. Ana will use the profits from her sales to support her family.

loans.use: to buy weed killer, bush knives and sacks of fertilizer to help maintain her business.

loans.name: Santa Rosa Group

texts.es: Un grupo conformado por  6 personas  emprendedoras   y con mucha creatividad para los negocios. Así son los integrantes del grupo comunal “SANTA ROSA”. El Sr. Omar  de 28 años de edad  y con 1 hijo, el Sr. Omar  se dedica  al servicio de moto taxistas con el fin de salir adelante, Ha llegado a fidelizar  a sus clientes  el cual le ha generado ganancias para poder cubrir los gastos de su hogar. Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá en comprar más repuestos  para su moto taxi.  En el futuro le gustaría tener una  moto taxi más con el fin de alquilarlo y tener un ingreso más para su familia. A la vez  el Sr. Omar  y todos los integrantes se encuentran agradecidos   con Kiva  por el préstamo otorgado  y por la confianza que se  les ha sido brindada. La Sr. Omar es el único caballero que se encuentra en la foto,  Se despide  Dejando la promesa  que cumplirá todas sus metas propuestas.
texts.en:
This group is comprised of 6 entrepreneurs that are savvy business people.  They are the members of the group called "Santa Rosa."  Omar is 28 years old and he has a son.  He services and fixes the area's motorcycle taxis and his goal is to get ahead.  He has loyal clientele and he has generated enough income to cover his household expenses.

He is seeking this loan so that he can buy more parts for his motorcycle taxi.  In the future he would like to have an additional taxi so that he can rent it out and earn an even higher income for his family.  Currently, Omar and all the other members are very thankful to Kiva for the loan and for the support they provide.  Omar is the only man in the photo.  He promises to comply with the repayment schedule.

loans.use: to buy parts for his motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: Gracias por apoyar a Margarita, quien con su credikiva compró mercancias variadas, como vestuarios, calzado y perfumería. Sus ventas se incrmentarón con esta inversión y así mismo sus utilidades. Ella envia el siguiente mensaje a sus financiadores: " Señores de Kiva, Muchas Gracias por el apoyo que brindaron a señoras que como yo desde su casa realizan una actividad comercial " Su negocio hoy en dia ha mejorado, proporcionandole mas ingresos y con ello mas calidad de vida, por eso está acudiendo a un nuevo finaciamineto, mediante este fondo para comprar vestuario, calzado, y mercancia variada, pues se acerca el dia del padre y con ello aumentan sus pedidos y sus ventas.
texts.en: Thank you for helping Margarita who, with her Kiva loan, bought varied merchandise such as clothing, shoes, and perfume. Her sales will increase due to this investment. She sends the following message to her financiers: "Kiva lenders, thank you very much for the sport that you offer from your home to women like me who are engaged in commercial activities." Today, her business has improved, giving her greater income and, as a result, a better quality of life. For this reason, she is requesting a new loan and will use these funds to buy clothing, shoes, and varied merchandise. Also, fathers' day is coming and this increases her orders and her sales.

loans.use: to buy clothing, footwear, and varied merchandise

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Maria de 52 años de edad se dedica a ofrecer servicios de mejoramiento de la imagen personal y  la venta de productos para embellecer a sus clientes utilizando  guías especializadas o catálogos. Maria tiene su negocio a sur de la ciudad, donde habita con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en las edades de 12 y 23 años. Su experiencia data desde hace 9 años, cuando su amiga la entusiasmó para que trabajando independiente generará ingresos, ofreciendo servicios personales como manicure, pedicure, belleza capilar y le ofreciera a estos clientes, productos de belleza, mediante su asesoría.  Hoy Maria trabaja en esa actividad diariamente, desde las 9 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche y compra de contado en los principales laboratorios de la ciudad. Como la clientela de Maria tiene un crecimiento  importante, necesita tener un stock de mercancías para lograr responder a sus pedidos e impactarlos con un servicio oportuno y fácil de acceder. Esta es justamente la razón, por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará productos capilares, cremas en un mayor volumen, que le permitan incrementar su capital de trabajo y así mismo generar cada vez mas ingresos, haciendo de su credikiva una inversión exitosa y muy rentable, pues su meta es lograr crecimiento y expansión, para adquirir su propia casa.
texts.en:
52-year-old Maria makes a living by both offering services in improving personal image and selling beauty products through specialised guides or catalogues. Maria’s business is in the southern part of the city, where she also lives with her spouse and her two children of 12 and 23 years of age. She has nine years of experience in this business, which started when her friend prompted her to become self-employed and generate income by offering personal services, such as manicures, pedicures, and hair treatments, as well as by selling beauty products. 

Now Maria does this work every day from nine in the morning until seven at night. She buys products from the city’s main laboratories using cash. As Maria’s clientele has grown, she needs new merchandise in order to respond to requests and give prompt and accessible service. This is the reason she is applying for a loan, which is her first financing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and with which she will buy hair products and wholesale creams. This will allow her to increase her working capital and generate even more income, making her Kiva loan a successful and very profitable investment. Her goal is to achieve growth and expansion so she can get her own house.

loans.use: to buy hair products and creams

loans.name: Jhony Javier

texts.es: Jhony, es un joven casado no tiene hijos aun, trabaja en un hotel desempeñando el cargo de atención al cliente, con sus ingresos se ayuda a pagar sus estudios, la carrera de licenciatura en Psicología, Jhony es un joven con muchos deseos de superación está por concluir sus clases y entrar al curso de titulación lo que tiene que pagar de una sola vez y su salario no le permite realizar dicho costo; es por eso que solicita el crédito para pagar el curso de titulación e irse desarrollando poco a poco con sus conocimientos profesionales, lo que le permitirá aspirar a un mejor empleo para ayudar a su familia.
texts.en: Jhony is a young man who is married and does not yet have children. He works in a hotel, looking after the customers. His wages help him to pay for his studies toward a psychology degree. Jhony is a young man with a great desire to overcome problems and to finish his classes and to enter into the official degree program, which has a fee that he only has to pay once but that he can't cover with his salary. This is why he is requesting a loan to pay for the degree program and help him to develop, little by little, in his professional knowledge which will help him to gain better employment and help his family.

loans.use: to pay for his degree course.

loans.name: Merquiz De Jesus

texts.es:
Melquiz, vive con su esposa  y disfruta de cuatro hijos, los cuales le ayudan a pastorear el ganado y asimismo estudian. El, se dedica a  las actividades agropecuarias tales como: ganadería, lo realiza desde niño, ya que su padre le enseño a cuidar las vacas sin horarios y ha sido su trabajo de toda la vida, en el cual tiene mucha experiencia.
El préstamo que requiere lo invertirá en pagos de siembra de pasto para el ganado y asimismo para arrendar un terreno; este le ayudara a que el ganado tenga el pasto necesario.
Su sueño es brindarle el estudio a sus hijos, crecer en su actividad y brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Merquiz lives with his wife and enjoys his four children who help him to herd the cattle and also study. He works in agriculture doing things such as raising cattle, which he has done since he was a child as his father taught him how to care for the cows and he has been doing this work all his life so he has much experience. 
He will use the loan that he is requesting to pay for sowing the pasture for the cattle and also to lease some land, which will help to ensure that the cattle have the pasture that they need.
His dreams are to offer his children the chance to study, to increase his business, and to offer his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to pay for sowing the pasture for the cattle and to lease land

loans.name: Willian Bladimir

texts.es:
Willian, es una persona muy trabajadora, vive actualmente con su compañera de vida y disfruta de dos hijos, no posee familiares en el extranjero que le ayuden. El, se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte a los pasajeros, ya que posee una moto taxi,  el oficio lo aprendió por su misma necesidad económica en el hogar, lo desempeña hace cinco años y lo realiza desde las 6:00am hasta las 7:00pm, ventaja que tiene es que no existe mucha competencia por el momento  y esto ayuda a la rentabilidad del negocio.
El crédito que requiere lo invertira en la compra de repuestos para el moto taxi; esto le ayudara a obtener maquinaria en buenas condiciones para ofrecerle  un mejor servicio a los clientes y ellos puedan aumentar; la desventaja en este negocio es la variación en los precios del combustible  y un accidente, asimismo una falla mecánica puede suspender el servicio.
El sueño de Willian es expandirse en el negocio para obtener mayores ganancias que permitan brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Willian is a very hard-working person. He currently lives with his partner and he has two children. He does not have foreign relatives to support him. He makes a living by offering transportation services as he has a taxi cab. He learnt this trade out of economic necessity and he has been doing it for five years. He works from 6:00am until 7:00pm. His advantage is that not much competition exists presently and this helps the profitability of his business.

He will invest the loan in purchasing spare parts for the taxi cab; this will help him to obtain machinery in good condition in order to offer better service to his clients and increase his clientele. The business’ disadvantage is the price variation in fuel and the possibility of an accident. A mechanical fault could also suspend his services.

Willian’s dream is to expand the business in order to obtain greater profits, which will allow him to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his taxi

loans.name: Monica

texts.es: Mónica es propietaria de una refresquería, unicada en el municipio de Soledad donde habita con sus dos hijos, motor de todos sus esfuerzos, para que gocen de bienestar. por eso, ella ha obtenido 2 financiamientos de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,para aumentar su capital de trabajo y obtener cada vez mas ingresos, con el fin de alcanzarlo.  Con el primer crédito surtió su negocio con mucha cerveza y  con ello sus ventas se incrementaron, generando mas ganancias y aumentado su calidad de vida y la de su familia. Mónica envia un mensaje muy especial por este apoyo: “Muchas gracias por brindarme la oportunidad de salir adelante con mi negocio.” En la actualidad ella está aplicando a su segundo financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y es su primer credikiva, mediante el cual comprará un enfriador, para conservar muchas mas bebidas frías, pues en este clima cálido, las cervezas y refrescos agradan mucho más y calman la sed producida por el  caluroso ambiente de esta tierra caribe hermosa y muy tropical.
texts.en: Mónica is the proprietor of a snack bar located in the town of Soledad where she lives with her 2 children who are the driver of all her efforts so that they will enjoy a good life. To this end, she has had 2 loans from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to increase her business capital and gradually increase her income, with the goal of achieving a good income. She used the first loan to supply her business with beer and her sales increased, generating better profits and increasing her family's quality of life. Mónica sends a very special message about this support: "Thank you very much for offering me the opportunity to succeed in my business." She is currently applying for her second loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and it is her first Kiva loan. She will use it to buy a refrigerator to keep her drinks colder as, in this hot climate, cold beers and sodas are much better to drink and quench the thirst produced by the hot environment of this beautiful and very tropical Caribbean land.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator

loans.name: Hawanatu

texts.en: This is 22 year-old Hawanatu.  She is married, and has 1 child, aged 4 years and a school going child. She has 1 additional dependent, who lives with her to be fostered.  In 2010, Hawanatu established her food stuffs (dolly maggie, shrimps, tomato paste, etc.) business. She began her business because she dropped out of school, she lacks interest in education.   Her mother gave her some amount of money to start a roasted meat business.  When she got married her husband also gave her some money to grow her business.  Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,000,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000.  Hawanatu requires a loan in order to buy cartons of dolly maggie cube and shrimp maggie. In the future, Hawanatu plans to educate her children, become an international business woman and acquire a shop.  This loan will help to generate more income. Lack of a shop is her major challenge.  She is a hardworking business woman.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy cartons of dolly maggie cube and shrimp maggie.

loans.name: Ifale

texts.en:
Ifale is a 28 year old mother with 3 children. 
She has a small garden where she grows vegetables that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for many years. Ifale needs a loan to buy a weed killer, bush knives, a sack of fertilizer, boots, and a mist blower to help maintain her business. 
She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. Ifale will use the profits from her produce sales to support her family.

loans.use: to buy a weed killer, bush knives, a sack of fertilizer , boots and a Mist Blower to help maintain her business.

loans.name: María Rosa

texts.es:
Doña Rosa, es una de las clientas de mayor edad, de nuestra cartera de clienta. Ella por herencia familiar siempre estuvo ligada a las actividades comerciales. Cuando ella se casa deja de trabajar , para dedicarse a  la crianza de sus cinco hijos, cuando éstos comienzan a estudiar , ella decide que debe retomar un negocio, para poder apoyar a los gastos de su hogar y además para ella es muy importante tener independencia económica y libertad.Ya sus hijos son profesionales e independientes económicamente. Tiene un médico , una contador y un publicista. Pero afirma que el estar ocupada, tener su negocio le da vida, le hace sentirse útil, con vida ya casi cumple 70 años de edad.
Atiende el servicio de alimentación de un centro escolar, desde hace más de 5 años. el trabajo con los niños le llena de energía y vitalidad.
Su negocio le permite tener una vejez tranquila al contar con ahorros e ingresos para satisfacer sus necesidades.
Su negocio genera un empleo más, con ella trabaja una hija casada que no continúo estudiando y el salrio que le paga doña Rosa, le permite apoyar gastos de sus dos hijas.Es una clienta con gran trayectoria y moral de pago.
texts.en:
Rosa is one of the oldest clients in our portfolio. For family reasons, she was always linked to business activities. When she got married, she stopped working to dedicate herself to raising her 5 children. When they started school, she decided that she had to resume business so that she could help support the household expenses and also because it is very important for her to have economic independence and freedom. Now her children are professionals and economically independent. She has a doctor, and accountant, and a publicist. But she says that she is busy, that having a business gives you life, makes you feel useful and alive and she is almost 70 years old. 
She provides food to a school and has been doing this for more than 5 years. Working with the children gives her energy and vitality. 
Her business enables her to have a peaceful old age with the savings and income to meet her needs.
Her business has one more employee and a married girl who isn't in school works with her and the salary that Rosa pays her enables her to support her 2 children. This is a customer with a great history and ethic of repayment.

loans.use: to buy a microwave and supplies for making meals.

loans.name: Gesabel

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Gesabel works hard to support her family.

She buys and sells spices in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending.  Gesabel is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to purchase additional spices to sell for her spice business.

Gesabel has been sustaining her business activities through her past 9 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional spices to sell

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
Isabel works hard to support her family. Isabel is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Isabel requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fishing materials for her business.

Isabel has been in this business for 5 years now.

In the future, Isabel would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing materials for her business

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is 45-years-old and married with seven children.

Julieta works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell like soap, canned goods, noodles and sugar

Julieta has borrowed and paid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 6 years and also earns an income from selling fresh fish, dried fish and crab.

Julieta aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like soap, canned goods, noodles and sugar

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 43 years old, married with three children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Lydia has a fishing business in the Philippines. Lydia has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase a fishing net and other materials for fishing.

Lydia has been in this business for 18 years. In the future, Lydia would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase a fishing net and other materials for fishing.

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.en:
Maria Cristina works hard to support her family. Maria Cristina is married and has a buying and selling dried coconut business in the Philippines.  Maria Cristina has been in this business for three years now.

Maria Cristina has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of dried coconut to sell.

In the future, Maria Cristina would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of dried coconut to sell.

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en:
Josefa is married and works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Josefa has been in this business for six years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Josefa aspires to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Pesio

texts.en:
Pesio is a 60-year-old mother with six children. She owns and operates a small store, selling items such as food supplies and general accessories. She has been doing this for two years. 

Pesio needs a loan to buy freezer meat products such as mutton flaps, chicken leg quarters, sausages, canned food, snacks, soft drinks etc. 

She hopes to use her profits to support her family and to pay for her children's education. She became a member of SPBD in 2013 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy goods to restock her shop.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 40 years old, married and has three children, who are all in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Josephine has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

Josephine has been in this business for three years. In the future, Josephine would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy merchandise (bananas, beans, salt, etc.) for her shop.

loans.name: Eleuteria

texts.en:
Eleuteria is a 51-year-old widow and has 2 children.  

Eleuteria is in an agricultural business, farming corn in the Philippines. Eleuteria requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and seedlings.

Eleuteria has been farming corn for three years now and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Eleuteria would like to save enough to buy more farm land.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seedlings

loans.name: Lusila

texts.en:
Lusila is a 26-year-old married woman with 5 children. She has a small plantation and grows vegetables to earn a living. She has been doing this for 2 years.

Lusila has requested a loan to help her increase her produce, needing to get weed-killer chemicals, bush knives, fertilisers, a mist blower and vegetable seeds. She has been a member of SPBD since 2013. With her profits, Lusila hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy weed-killing chemicals, bush knives, fertilisers, a mist blower and vegetable seeds

loans.name: Khady

texts.fr:
Mme khady, agée de 48 ans, mariée, est une femme au foyer très active. Elle habite dans un quartier qui se trouve à 500 m du guichet situé à 70 km de Dakar.Elle évolue dans le commerce
Elle est marchande ambulante et possède une expérience de plus de 30ans; en plus de cela elle adore ce métier.
Avec le prêt elle envisage de faire un petit voyage en Gambie afin de renforcer son activité de ventes de tissus, chaussures, sacs.
Elle est soutien de famille et avec les bénéfices acquis elle aide dans la dépense quotidienne du foyer.
texts.en:
Khady is 48 years old, married and a very active housewife. She lives in a district which is located 500 metres away from the UIMCEC branch, itself located 70 kilometres from Dakar.

Khady is a merchant. She is a street-seller with over 30 years experience and she loves her job. She plans to use this loan to travel to Gambia on business, so that she can strengthen her inventory of fabrics, shoes and bags. She is a breadwinner for her family and uses the profits that she makes to help with the daily household expenses.

loans.use: to buy fabric, bags and shoes for resale.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen is 58 years old and married with 8 children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Carmen has a tailoring business in the Philippines. Carmen requested a 10,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy supplies for her tailoring.

Carmen has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Carmen would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her tailoring

loans.name: Mavis

texts.en:
