Mavis is 19 years old and married with no children. She wants to start a small business making and selling pancakes and chicken curry in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy a sack of flour, a box of chicken, sugar and dripping oil.

In the future, Mavis hopes to improve her business. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a sack of flour, a box of chicken, sugar and dripping oil

loans.name: Ma. Lita

texts.en:
Maria Lita is 44 years old and married with six children. Three of her children are in school.  She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Ma. Lita has a clothing sales business in the Philippines. Ma. Lita requested a 13,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to purchase more items like pants, bags, slippers and other ready-to-wear clothing.

Ma. Lita has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Ma. Lita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items like pants, bags, slippers and other ready-to-wear clothing

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of 7 children, Marilyn works hard to support her family.

She has a banana selling business in the Philippines and she has been in this business for five years. Marilyn is borrowing 18,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more bananas to sell to her customers.

Marilyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more bananas to sell

loans.name: Filoi

texts.en:
Filoi is a 43-year-old married woman with 6 children. She has a small plantation and grows vegetables to earn a living. She has been doing this for many years.

Filoi has requested a loan to buy vegetable seeds, fertilizer, chemicals, weed killer, bush knives, a mist blower, etc. She has been a member of SPBD since 2013. With her profits, Filoi hopes to improve her financial support and also improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds, fertilizer, chemicals, weed killer, bush knives, a mist blower, etc.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn is 38 years old and married with six children. She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines.

Marlyn is borrowing 18,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional seeds and fertilizers for her farm. Marlyn has been farming vegetables for 5 years and also earns additional income from fishing.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds and fertilizers for her farm

loans.name: Khady

texts.fr:
Madame  Khady est une  vendeuse de moutons qui s’active depuis plus de 20 ans. Elle adore son métier  car ses moutons sont comme ses enfants. Elle est agée de 40ans et habite à 25km du Guichet
Madame Khady sollicite ce crédit pour acheter  des moutons  et augmenter son cheptel. 
Elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants dont l’ainé est âgé  de 17 ans et le cadet 7 ans. En effet, c’est pour ses enfants et sa famille qu’elle s’active toujours, pour satisfaire leur besoins quotidiens malgré l'aide de son mari. Elle est peulh et  Comme la plupart des gens de cette race, son projet majeur est d’avoir  toujours davantage de bêtes à élever pour revendre.
texts.en:
Khady is a sheep-seller who has been doing business for over 20 years. She loves her job as her sheep are like children to her. She is 40 years old and lives 25 kilometres away from the UIMCEC branch.

Khady is requesting this loan so that she can buy some more sheep and increase her number of livestock. She is married and the mother of 4 children, the eldest of whom is 17 years old and the youngest, 7. Indeed, it is because of her children and family that she is still working, so that she can satisfy their daily needs, together with the support of her husband. She has Fulani ethnicity and, like the majority of the people of her race, her major goal is always to have more livestock to breed and resell.

loans.use: to buy sheep for resale.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is 52 years old and a mother of three. They live a simple and happy life in a rural community and make their living through farming. They wish to improve their standard of living in order to give their children a better life.

She is engaged in a hog-raising business.  To pursue their dreams for their family, she decided to borrow additional capital of 10,000 PHP from Kiva lenders and ASKI, which she will use to buy feeds, vitamins and additional piglets to raise.  Through this loan, she believes that she will be able to improve her hog-raising business in the future.

loans.use: to buy hog feeds, vitamins and additional piglets

loans.name: Blanca

texts.en:
Blanca works hard to support her family. She is single and has a firewood sales business in the Philippines.

Blanca requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more stock of firewood to sell. She has been in this business for 4 years.

In the future, Blanca would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of firewood to sell

loans.name: Mayra

texts.en:
Mayra, 49, is married and has nine children, six of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Mayra buys and sells dried fish in the Philippines. She has been in this business for six years. 

Mayra requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of dried fish to sell. In the future, Mayra would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Decena

texts.en:
Decena is 27 years old, married and has three children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Decena has a firewood sales business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for four years.

Decena requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

In the future, Decena would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of firewood to sell.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie works hard to support her family. Rosalie is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 15 years now.

Rosalie requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional materials for her business.

In the future, Rosalie would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a can of oil, 2 boxes of soap and 2 bags of rice for resale.

loans.name: Ndèye

texts.fr:
Cela fait plus de 2 ans que la dame Ndèye,qui apparait sur la photo,portant sur le dos son dernier enfant, fait de l’élevage. Elle vient pour la première fois, solliciter l’appui de l’IMCEC afin de pouvoir acheter des moutons car son élevage consiste à emboucher des ovins pour les revendre. Elle est active de 10h du matin à 17h du soir.
Elle n’a comme charges que ses besoins personnels : effet de toilette, habillements et autres.
Elle a espoir qu’avec le crédit, elle pourra désormais épargner pour réaliser des projets qui lui tiennent à cœur.
texts.en: Ndèye, pictured carrying her youngest child on her back, has been breeding livestock for over 2 years. She is requesting financial support from the UIMCEC, for the first time, in order to be able to buy some sheep, as her business consists of fattening sheep before reselling them. She works from 10am to 5pm. Her only expenses are personal ones: toiletries, clothing and similar items. She hopes that, with the help of this loan, she will be able to start saving so that she can carry out projects close to her heart.

loans.use: to buy cattle for breeding and resale.

loans.name: Adolfo

texts.es: Adolfo, está casado, y vive con  su esposa que es su mayor prioridad. El con el crédito va comprar unas novillas para aumentar el número de animales a su poder. El cuenta con varios animales ya a su poder pero quiere aumentar el número de animales y así generar un aumento en la producción  de leche para la fabricación de queso para la venta. El espera con este proyecto aumentar sus ganancias para mejorar su estabilidad económica y tener un futuro más estable.   Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Adolfo is married and lives together with his wife, who is his priority in life. With this loan, he will buy cows to increase the amount of animals he owns. He has already several animals, but he would like to have more in order to increase the production of milk to produce cheese and sell it.

With this project, Adolfo hopes to receive more profits, and have a more stable economy and a stable future. This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR. He had not received loans before from state banks, but FUDECOSUR granted him a loan more easily and at a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy milk cows.

loans.name: Lusia

texts.en:
Lusila is a 66-year-old married woman with nine children.

She grows and sells vegetables to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years. 

Lusila has requested a loan to increase her vegetable varieties. She will buy vegetable seeds, planting bags, gardening tools and fertilizers to improve the quality of her produce. She has just joined SPBD to seek financial assistance. 

With her profits, Lusila hopes to increase and improve her vegetable garden and get extra funds to help meet her every day needs.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds, planting bags, gardening tools and fertilizers.

loans.name: Lisi

texts.en:
Lisi, 46, is a mother of five children. 

She has a small garden where she grows vegetables that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for three years. 

Lisi needs a loan to buy vegetable seeds, chemicals, gardening tools and fertilizers to help improve her vegetable garden. She has just joined SPBD to gain financial assistance. 

Lisi will use the profits from her sales to support her family and improve their quality of living.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds, chemicals, gardening tools and fertilizers.

loans.name: Saye

texts.fr: Madame SAYE , âgée de 40 ans est commerçante depuis 15 ans. Elle s’active dans la vente de Draps, des pagnes tissées Madame saye est mariée et mère de famille. Saye commence sa journée à 8h et la termine à 14h. Elle a besoin de ce pret d'un montant de 150 000F pour augmenter son fond de commerce. Elle donne sa participation dans la gestion de la dépense quotidienne en payant les factures. Elle travaille pour diversifier les produits et services. Dans l’avenir, elle aimerait créer une entreprise pour ses enfants.
texts.en: 40-year-old Saye has been a merchant for 15 years. She sells sheets and woven pagnes (highly colourful and decorative West African clothing). Saye is married and a mother. She starts her workday at 8 am and finishes at 2pm. She needs this 150 000 franc loan in order to increase her business. She helps to manage the daily expenses by paying the bills. She is working on diversifying her products and services. In future, she would like to create a business for her children.

loans.use: to buy sheets and woven pagnes for resale at the local market.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy dried fish, palm oil and peanut butter for resale.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa, 51 years old, is married and has eight children, two of whom are in school.

Elisa is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Elisa has been raising pigs for 14 years now and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Elisa requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

In the future, Elisa would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Gantulga

texts.en:
Gantulga, 42 years old, lives with her husband and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in their own house on a plot of land. She has been working as a dressmaker at a textile factory since 2010 and has accumulated a vast amount of experience. Her husband is currently unemployed but has the profession of truck driver. Her two children both go to high school. 

She is requesting a loan of 7,000,000 MNT to purchase building and insulation materials such as bricks, cement, planks, fiberglass and foam. Using those materials, her husband will repair and insulate their old house. As a result, the renovated house not only will provide comfortable and warm accommodation for the family, but also contribute to the efforts against air pollution by releasing fewer pollutants because of the family's reduced coal consumption. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase building and insulation materials

loans.name: Roselda

texts.en:
Roselda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. Roselda has been in this business for 20 years.  Roselda earns additional income from raising pigs.

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy material for the maintenance of her fishing business.

Roselda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy materials for the maintenance of her fishing boat.

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia works hard to support her family. Sylvia is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Sylvia requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase materials, such as wood, paints, and bamboo, for the repair of her fishing boat.

Sylvia has been in this business for 5 years now.

In the future, Sylvia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase materials for the repair of her fishing boat like wood, paints, bamboo, etc

loans.name: Wendell

texts.en:
Wendell is 40 years old, married, and has two children. He aims to become successful in life in order to give his family a better future.  

He is in the farming business but, aside from this, he is also involved in the hog-raising business to generate additional income. He wants to acquire more pigs to raise, but has limited capital. For this reason, he is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy feed, vitamins, vaccines, additional piglets and materials needed for the improvement of his pig pen.  

He is hoping that KIVA lenders, through ASKI, will grant his loan request.  Despite the hardships of living, he has the determination to make improvements in his business and he hopes that someday, he will achieve his goals.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, vaccines, additional piglets and materials needed to improve the pig pen

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is 45 years old, married, and has two children. 

Rosalina is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Rosalina requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Rosalina has been raising pigs for five years now and has borrowed from NWTF nine times to sustain her business.

In the future, Rosalina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Equilibre De Ouanaminthe Group

texts.fr:
Marielourdes est le coordinatrice  de son groupe Equilibre de Oaunaminthe. Elle est mariée elle a un  enfant. Elle habite dans la région nord est d`Haïti ou de électricité n’est rare et de l’eau portable n’est très limite. 

Elle dirige son commerce de vente de produits alimentaire  pendants les 9  dernières années. Elle espère que cet emprunt l’aidera a grandir son commerce. Des autres membres Equilibre de Oaunaminthe ont besoin d’un emprunt pour le commerce telques ventes produits de cosmétiques, boissons gazeuses etc. 

Elle déclare que son défi principal est de devenir une plus grande commerçante  dans le département du nord est. Elle dit son but principal c’est d’avoir un grand commerce qui lui facilitera  a construire une  grande maison avec l’aide  d’Esperanza Int.
texts.en:
Marielourdes is the coordinator of the "Equilibre de Oaunaminthe" group. She is married and has a child. She lives in the Northern region of Haiti, where electricity is rare and the supply of drinkable water is limited.

She has been running a business selling food products for the last 9 years. She hopes that this loan will help her to expand her business. The other members of the "Equilibre de Oaunaminthe" group need loans to sell items like beauty products and fizzy drinks.

Marielourdes says that her main challenge is to become a larger retailer in the north eastern province. Her main aim is to have a large business which will enable her to build a big house with the help of Esperanza Int.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar, flour, etc.

loans.name: Irma Esperanza

texts.es:
Irma, vive con su familia, su compañero de vida y su hijo. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa ambulante, lo aprendió de su madre y lo realiza desde hace 12 años, su horario es de 6:00am a 2:00pm.
El préstamo que requiere le permitirá comprar ropa interior, blusas, faldas, chores, entre otros; esta inversión le ayudara para adquirir variedad de prendas de vestir para ofrecerle a los clientes y así obtener mayores ingresos económicos.  
Su sueño es tener una boutique y brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Irma lives with her family, her life partner and her son. She works selling clothes as a street vendor. She learned this activity from her mother and has been doing it for twelve years, from 6:00 am until 2:00 pm.

Irma is requesting a loan to buy underwear, blouses, skirts, shorts and other garments. With this investment, she will be able to buy a wider assortment to offer her customers and increase her income.

Her dream is to have her own boutique and give her family a better life.

loans.use: to buy underwear, blouses, skirts and shorts, among other garments.

loans.name: Fetuiai

texts.en:
Fetuiai is 53 years old and married and has seven children. 

She runs a small business selling popcorn in her community and has been doing this for two years. 

Fetuiai has requested a loan to buy sugar, cordial, plastic bags, dripping oil, popcorn, a large basin, salt and kerosene. 

She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Fetuiai will improve her business and her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy sugar, cordial, plastic bags, dripping oil, popcorn, a large basin, salt and kerosene.

loans.name: Jhonie Jane

texts.en:
Jhonie Jane is 23 years old, married and has two children, one of whom is in school. 

Jhonie Jane is in the agricultural business, raising poultry in the Philippines. She has been in the poultry business for three years now and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Jhonie Jane requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her poultry.

In the future, Jhonie Jane would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her poultry.

loans.name: Renelyn

texts.en: Renelyn is earning an income through her hog-fattening business which she patiently manages so that her hogs are healthy as they grow. To help better ensure this, she is requesting a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy feeds, medicine and vitamins. She hopes that her requested loan will be granted. According to Renelyn, she really values her livelihood, for it helps her finance their daily expenditures.

loans.use: to buy feeds, medicine and vitamins

loans.name: Benkadi 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les  10 membres du groupe  Benkadi 1 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 33 ans, 4 enfants et vivant tous dans des  familles traditionnelles à Faraba, un des quartiers de la ville Bougouni, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur septième  prêt avec l’institution et les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est le riz et l’arachide, avec Safiatou 2 eme  debout de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo, elle compte acheter avec son prêt, des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du marché,  après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 75.000 francs CFA en fin de campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de subvenir à ses besoins et aussi aider la famille dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The 10 members of the Benkadi 1 group are married women with an average age of 33 and, on average, 4 children who all live in traditional families in Faraba, one of the districts of Bougouni town, 3rd administrative region of Mali. They are working together with Soro Yiriwaso in order to carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. This is their 7th loan from the institution and their previous loans have been properly repaid.

Safiatou, standing second from the right in the picture, grows rice and groundnuts. She plans to use her loan to buy agricultural inputs and seeds and to pay the labourers needed for the cultivation of 1 hectare of farmland. After the harvest, the produce is sold at the market to a clientèle made up of men and women. She expects to have made a profit of 75 000 francs by the end of the season. This profit will enable her to meet her needs and also to help her family with the daily living expenses.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and seeds and pay the labourers' wages.

loans.name: Tungalag

texts.en:
Mrs. Tungalag is 55 years old and lives with her husband, daughter, and granddaughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She and her husband have been running a security service, providing services to local companies since 2007. They have secured permanent clients and accumulated vast amounts of experience. Her daughter is an operational manager at a commercial bank and her granddaughter goes to kindergarten.

She is requesting a loan of 7,000,000 MNT to purchase vegetable seeds, fertilizers, and building materials (such as planks, metals and bricks). Using these building materials, her husband will build a greenhouse near their home. After that, she will plant tomato, carrot, and cabbage seeds. Growing vegetables instead of buying directly from markets will help the family save money and ensure food safety. More importantly, plants will undertake photosynthesis, which converts carbon dioxide into oxygen, and will contribute to clean air efforts. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and building materials

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en:
Phuong is 45 years old. She has a son and a daughter. They are young: ages 12 and 10. Her husband is a building worker. His income is 10,000,000 VND. Phuong is a farmer who raises pigs to earn a living. She earns from her job 5,000,000 VND a month. She has done this job for 20 years. Her family’s total earnings are about 15,000,000 VND per month. Her challenges in life and work are a lack of knowledge about breeding techniques and disease in her poultry. Her dreams are to see her children grow up well and be successful in life, and to own a big farm. 

This loan is one step to help her get to this dream. She can invest in her farm to gain earnings and save for her children’s education. Phuong is a hardworking woman. This job suits her skills. She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2009. In the last loan cycle, she borrowed 9,632,000 VND and repaid on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 10,080,000 VND to buy food for pigs. She always wants to save more money for her family and to raise her children well.

loans.use: to buy food for pigs

loans.name: Benkadi 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les  10 membres du groupe  Benkadi 2 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 32 ans, 4 enfants et vivant tous dans des  familles traditionnelles à Faraba, un des quartiers de la ville Bougouni, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur septième  prêt avec l’institution et les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est le riz et l’arachide, avec Awa 1ere  debout de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo, elle compte acheter avec son prêt, des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du marché,  après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 35.000 francs CFA en fin de campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de subvenir à ses besoins et aussi aider la famille dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The 10 members of the Benkadi 2 group are married women with an average age of 32 and, on average, 4 children who all live in traditional families in Faraba, one of the districts of Bougouni town, 3rd administrative region of Mali. They are working together with Soro Yiriwaso in order to carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. This is their 7th loan from the institution and their previous loans have been correctly repaid.

Awa, standing on the far right in the picture, grows rice and groundnuts. She plans to use her loan to buy agricultural inputs and seeds and to pay the labourers needed for the cultivation of 1 hectare of farmland. After the harvest, the produce is sold at the market to a clientèle made up of men and women. She expects to have made a profit of 35 000 francs by the end of the season. This profit will enable her to meet her needs and also to help her family with the daily living expenses.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and seeds and pay the labourers' wages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her inventory of hair extensions, hair weaves and beauty products.

loans.name: Rosebell

texts.en: As a married mother of three children, Rosebell works hard to support her family. She has a business making and selling peanut butter in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from her poultry. Rosebell is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business. Rosebell has been maintaining her business activities with her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita is 49 years old, married, and has nine children. She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Teresita is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy new seed and farm supplies for her business. Teresita has been farming vegetables for five years and earns additional income from buying and selling rice. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy new seed and farm supplies for her vegetable farm.

loans.name: 3.14.288.17.thiệu Khánh Group

texts.en: Mrs. Chúc works in agriculture, raising poultry and cattle. She is applying for a loan to buy calves to raise and then sell in the future. Chúc is 62 years old, married, and has two children. Chúc is the group leader of the 3.14.289.18.Thiệu Khánh solidarity group, which consists of five members. Her children are grown up, so Chúc does not support dependents. Her business is in Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. In 2012, Chúc joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Chúc has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Chúc has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is a lack of capital. With her business profits, Chúc hopes for her business to do well, to maintain a successful business, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise and then sell in the future.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a "buy and sell" rice business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 29,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell through her rice business. Maricel has been in this business for seven years. She earns more income from rice mill and farming rice.

Maricel has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Amy

texts.en:
Amy is 38 years old and is married with five children. Three of her children are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Amy has a food production business in the Philippines. Amy requested a 14,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food business.

Amy has been in this business for three years. In the future, Amy would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years.

Edna requested a 12,000 Philippine peso (PHP) loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell. In the future, Edna would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda, 69, is married and has eight children. 

Merlinda is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Merlinda requested a 25000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Merlinda has been farming rice for 15 years now, and has borrowed 22 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Merlinda would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Enkhee

texts.en: Enkhee, 58 lives with his wife, son and daughter-in-law in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in their own house on a plot of land. He has been rendering taxi services to local people for many years and has accumulated vast amount of experience. His wife has retired from work and gets a state pension. His son works as a designer at a building company. His daughter-in-law is a saleswoman at trading company. He is requesting a loan of 3000000 MNT to build a greenhouse on his land. The construction of this greenhouse will enable him to plant vegetables on his land, and his family will no longer need to buy vegetables from the market, thus saving money. Also, plants undertake a process called photosynthesis which converts carbon dioxide into oxygen, contributing to clean air efforts. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to build a greenhouse.

loans.name: Everlides

texts.es: Everlides de 41 años  habita al sur de la ciudad donde genera sus propios ingresos mediante la oferta de servicios de alquiler de lavadoras y de otras actividades comerciales o de servicios domésticos,  que le permiten complementar sus ingresos y responder a sus gastos y aumentar el nivel de vida de su hija de 14 años de edad con quien sueña ve convertida en una profesional exitosa. Su tarea inició desde el año 1999 y desde ese momento poco a poco ha construido su experiencia, trabajando desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde. Su meta es lograr la sostenibilidad de su negocio, para dedicarse solamente a él, pero su mayor desafío es tener el suficiente capital de trabajo, para aumentar su oferta de servicios teniendo un mayor número de maquinaria, con el fin de obtener mayores utilidades. En la actualidad Everlides está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará dos máquinas para lavar ropa e iniciar el cumplimiento de su sueño de prosperidad que no es otro que el multiplicar sus utilidades y hacer que sus inversiones sean exitosas.
texts.en: Everlides is 41 years old. She lives in the south of the city where she earns a living by offering washing machine rental services, domestic services and other commercial services that allow her to supplement her income, meet her expenses, and raise the standard of living for her 14 year old daughter who she dreams will grow up to be a successful professional. She began this work in 1999 and from this point on she has gained experience, little by little. She works from 7 in the morning to 6 in the evening. Her goal is to ensure her washing business is sustainable, so that she dedicate all of her time to it. However, her biggest challenge is maintaining sufficient working capital to increase the services she offers by having more machines with the goal of obtaining greater profits. Today, Everlides is applying for a Kiva loan, her first financing through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation. With this loan she will buy two washing machines for clothes and begin to complete her dream of prosperity--to simply increase her profits and ensure that her investments are successful.

loans.use: to buy two washing machines for clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to raise chickens

loans.name: Romela

texts.en: Romela is 50 years old, married, and has four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Romela has a fishing business in the Philippines. Romela applied for a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment. Romela has been in this business for two years. In the future, Romela would like to save enough to maintain the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en: As a married parent of three children, Liezel works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from a general store. Liezel is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy materials for her fishing business. Liezel has been maintaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her fishing business.

loans.name: Erlin

texts.en: Erlin is 54 years old, married, and has six children. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Erlin is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. Erlin has been farming rice for 39 years, and she earns additional income from buying and selling "nipa " (a woven palm mat used for house repair and construction). She works tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money for business expansion.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other supplies for her rice farm.

loans.name: Perla

texts.en: As a married parent of two children, Perla works hard to support her family. She has a business buying and selling rice in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from farming vegetables and rice. Perla is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to by additional bags of rice to sell in her buying and selling business. Perla has been maintaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional bags of rice to sell.

loans.name: 3.14.290.9.thiệu Khánh Group

texts.en: Mrs. Ngân works in agriculture, raising poultry and cattle. She is applying for a loan to buy chicks to raise and then sell in the future. Ngân is 48 years old. She is married and has two children. Ngân is the group leader of the 3.14.290.9.Thiệu Khánh solidarity group, which consists of seven members. One of her children is grown, so Ms. Ngân supports one dependent with her business, located in Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. In 2012, Ngân joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Ngân has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Ngân has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is a lack of capital. With her business profits, Ngân hopes for her business to do well, to maintain a successful business, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase chicks to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en: Susana is 57 years old, married, and has  three children. Susana works very hard to provide for them. Susana runs a general store in the Philippines and applied for a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell. Susana has been in this business for ten years and sells a variety of items, such as soap, rice and other groceries. In the future, Susana would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her store.

loans.name: Jeannilyn

texts.en:
Jeannilyn is 49 years old and married with seven children. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. She has been farming rice for 10 years and also earns additional income from selling vegetables.

Jeannilyn is borrowing 25,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy new seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy new seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: 3.14.291.14.thiệu Khánh Group

texts.en:
Chút is 60 years old and married with five children. Her children are grown and she has no dependents. For more than ten years, Chút has run a grocery where she sells dry food in Thieu Hoa district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province. She joined the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women in 2012 to improve her business and has successfully repaid two previous loans. Chút's greatest business challenge is her lack of capital.

Chút is the leader of the 3.14.291.14.Thiệu Khánh solidarity group, comprised of five members. She is requesting a loan to purchase general items to sell such as milk, sugar, candy, and processed seafood. Chút hopes to use the profit from her loan to maintain a successful business and buy land of her own. She hopes that her business will do well.

loans.use: to purchase milk, sugar, candy, and processed seafood

loans.name: 3.6.293.5.thiệu Nguyên Group

texts.en:
Hằng is 29 years old and married with two children. She lives with her family in the Thieu Hoa district, in a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. For the past three years, Hằng has worked raising poultry and cattle. This is her first loan with the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Her major business difficulty is her lack of capital.

Hằng is the leader of the 3.6.293.5.Thiệu Nguyên solidarity group, which consists of six members. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future. Hằng hopes to use the profit from her loan to provide for kids and expand her business. She hopes to be able to buy more supplies and equipment.

loans.use: to purchase poultry to raise and sell

loans.name: 3.4.295.13.thiệu Phúc Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hân works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase calves to raise and sell in the future.

Hân is 43 years old, married, and has three children. She is the group leader of the 3.4.295.13.Thiệu Phúc solidarity group, which consists of six members. One of her children is grown, so Hân supports two dependents with her business in Thieu Hoa district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2012, Hân joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. She has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Hân hopes for her business to do well, to make enough money to provide for her children, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase calves to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Arturo

texts.en: Arturo, 36, is from the village of San Bernardo in the province of Isabela. He is married with one kid. He is a very hardworking person. Every morning he personally visits his farm. For almost eight years in farming business, he has always made sure that he can sustain the needs of his family. To have additional income, he is asking for a loan amounting to 20,000 PHP to buy seed and fertilizer for his business. His dream is to expand his business for his future plans.

loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizer for his business.

loans.name: Bayate

texts.en: Bayate is 63 years old, married, and has three children. Bayate works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has applied for a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell, including chips, canned goods, soap, toothpaste and shampoo. Bayate has borrowed and repaid 28 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for eight years, and she earns an income from farming and retailing rice. Bayate aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family and to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her store, including chips, canned goods, soap, toothpaste and shampoo.

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en:
Marjorie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling crabs in the Philippines. She has been in this business for seven years. Marjorie earns additional income from selling vegetables.

Marjorie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She is borrowing 20,000 Philippine pesos through NWTF to purchase additional crabs to sell. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional crabs to sell

loans.name: Haraya

texts.en:
Haraya is 25 years old and married with two children. For the past four years, she has been selling charcoal in the Philippines and she also earns an income farming rice and running a general store. Haraya has borrowed and repaid seven previous loans through NWTF. She works hard to provide for her family.

Haraya is requesting a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell. In the future, she aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy charcoal to sell

loans.name: 3.13.294.10.thiệu Đô Group

texts.en:
Đông is 44  years old and married with two adult children. She lives and works in the Thieu Hoa district, in a rural area in Thanh Hoa province. For over 10 years, Đông has worked raising poultry and cattle. She joined the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women in 2011 and has successfully repaid two previous loans. Her major business challenge is the lack of capital. 

Đông is the leader of the 3.13.294.10.Thiệu Đô solidarity group, comprised of three members. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell. Đông hopes to use the profit from her loan to buy land of her own and expand her business. She hopes to be able to buy more supplies and equipment.

loans.use: to purchase poultry to raise and sell

loans.name: Cleémentine

texts.fr: Clémentine est  une jeune femme de 21 ans fiancée mère de famille. Après sa formation, elle a ouvert un petit salon de coiffure qui fonctionne bien depuis 6 mois déjà. Grâce à son savoir faire, elle a developper et fideliser une clientèle au fil du temps. Mais elle n'arrive plus à la satifaire totalment à cause de la petitesse de son capital qui l'oblige à acheter son matériel en détail. C'est pour celà qu'elle sollicite un crédit pour augmenter le stock des mèches, greffes et produit de beauté. le benefice tiré de ce crédit sera en partie réinvesti dans son activité pour l'agrandir , mais aussi de satisfaire certains de ses besoins ainsi que ceux de sa famille.
texts.en: Clémentine is a young 21-year-old woman who is engaged and a mother. After graduating, she opened a small hair salon which has been working well for 6 months already. Over time, she has been able to develop and loyalize her clientèle. However, she is no longer able to satisfy her customers completely due to the small size of her capital which forces her to buy her products in retail amounts. This is why she is requesting a loan with which to inventory of hair extensions, hair weaves and beauty products. The profits generated thanks to this loan will be partly reinvested in her business, and the rest will be used to satisfy some of her own needs as well as those of her family.

loans.use: to increase her inventory of hair extensions, hair weaves and beauty products.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of three children, Remedios works hard to support her family. She sells rice in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from operating a general store, farming rice, and selling charcoal. Remedios has been sustaining her business activities through her past 30 loans from NWTF.

Remedios is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase rice to sell

loans.name: 3.4.296.14.thiệu Phúc Group

texts.en:
Mrs.Tư is 50 years old, and married with three children, but no dependents.  Tư works in the agriculture business, raising poultry and cattle. Her business is in the Thieu Hoa district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Tư has been involved in this business for over ten years. One of the most critical business difficulties concerning her is the lack of capital.

 
Tư is the group leader of the 3.4.296.14.Thiệu Phúc solidarity group, which consists of four members. In 2012, Tư joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. She has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

She is requesting a loan to purchase calves to raise, and then sell.

In the future, Tư hopes her business will do well,  that she can maintain a successful business, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase calves to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy feed and vaccine for the proper growth of his hogs

loans.name: Joesa

texts.en:
This is Joesa, 36, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Jose, a driver, and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Joesa operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns income by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a Php15,000 loan to help her continue the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Joesa dreams of expanding her business, and hopes that her children will finish their schooling.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and she also draws strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro finance loans.

loans.use: to buy grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed for her business.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is 30 years old and married with four children.

Emily works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell like canned goods, soap, sugar, milk, chips, etc..

Emily has borrowed and paid 14 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for nine years and also earns an income from motorcycle transport.

Emily aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell like canned goods, soap, sugar, milk, chips, etc.

loans.name: Benkadi 3 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  Benkadi 3 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 32 ans, 5 enfants et vivant tous dans des  familles traditionnelles à Faraba, un des quartiers de la ville Bougouni, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur septième  prêt avec l’institution et les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est le riz et l’arachide, avec   Fatoumata  1ere debout de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo, elle compte acheter avec son prêt, des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du marché,  après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 50.000 francs CFA en fin de campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de subvenir à ses besoins et aussi aider la famille dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Benkadi 3 group are married women with an average age of 32 and, on average, 5 children who all live in traditional families in Faraba, one of the districts of Bougouni town, 3rd administrative region of Mali. They are working together with Soro Yiriwaso in order to carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. This is their 7th loan from the institution and their previous loans have been correctly repaid.

Fatoumata, standing on the far right in the picture, grows rice and groundnuts. She plans to use her loan to buy agricultural inputs and seeds and to pay the labourers needed for the cultivation of 1 hectare of farmland. After the harvest, the produce is sold at the market to a clientèle made up of men and women. She expects to have made a profit of 50 000 francs by the end of the season. This profit will enable her to meet her needs and also to help her family with the daily living expenses.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and seeds and pay the labourers' wages.

loans.name: Benkadi 4 Group

texts.fr:
Les  10 membres du groupe  Benkadi 4 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 34 ans, 5 enfants et vivant tous dans des  familles traditionnelles à Faraba, un des quartiers de la ville Bougouni, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur septième  prêt avec l’institution et les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est le riz et l’arachide, avec Fatoumata  debout au milieu  sur la photo, elle compte acheter avec son prêt, des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du marché,  après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 20.000 francs CFA en fin de campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de subvenir à ses besoins et aussi aider la famille dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The 10 members of the Benkadi 4 group are married women with an average age of 34 and, on average, 5 children who all live in traditional families in Faraba, one of the districts of Bougouni town, 3rd administrative region of Mali. They are collaborating with Soro Yiriwaso in order to carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. This is their 7th loan from the institution and their previous loans have been properly repaid.

Fatoumata, standing on the far right in the picture, grows rice and groundnuts. She plans to use her loan to buy agricultural inputs and seeds and to pay the labourers needed for the cultivation of 1 hectare of farmland. After the harvest, the produce is sold at the market to a clientèle made up of men and women. She expects to have made a profit of 20 000 francs by the end of the season. This profit will enable her to meet her needs and also to help her family with the daily living expenses.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and seeds and pay the labourers' wages.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es: Bárbara tiene  47 años de edad  casada con 03 hijos y actualmente participa en la Alcancía Comunal “Mujeres Emprendedoras” la cual está conformada por 05 mujeres trabajadoras y solidarias. Para salir adelante y poder colaborar en su hogar, Bárbara decide emprender su propio negocio, pues es así como toma unos cursos de corte confección para luego poner su propio negocio de costura, la cual lleva más de 4 años brindando dicho servicio. Como actividad segundaría realiza tejidos, obteniendo un ingreso extra para su familia. Su siguiente meta es de instalar un puesto de alquileres de disfraces, pues así asegura ella tendrá mayores ganancias. Su último crédito lo destinará para la implementar su negocio de costura la cual comprará tijeras, telas, hilos entre otros. El grupo “Mujeres Emprendedoras” agradecen el crédito brindado. Bárbara es la primera del lado izquierdo, viste chompa color negro y lleva una chalina ploma.
texts.en: Bárbara is 47 years old. She is married and she has three children. She participates in the "Women Entrepreneurs" Communal Bank which is made up of 5 women who work hard in solidarity with one another. In order to get ahead and to contribute to her home, Bárbara decided to start her own business. With this in mind she took courses on sewing and design to later start her own sewing business. Now, she has spent 4 years providing this service. She also knits, as a secondary activity to obtain extra income for her family. Her next goal is to create a store for renting costumes so that she can ensure she will obtain greater earnings. She used her previous loan to support her sewing business by buying scissors, fabrics and threads, among other items. The "Women Entrepreneurs" group is grateful for the loans provided to them. Bárbara is the first woman on the left hand side of the photo, she is dressed in a black sweater and she is wearing a scarf.

loans.use: to purchase additional threads, scissors and fabrics.

loans.name: I Nengah

texts.en:
I Nengah lives in Gilimanuk, West Bali, close to the port. He lives with his wife. I Nengah has a kiosk located within the port location and a transportation business. He has a bus. With his wife, he manages a kiosk selling various types of food to passengers of ships.

To improve his business, he borrowed capital to increase merchandise that will be sold back to traveling salesman. With this plan, he hopes he can earn more profit. I Nengah has a dream of enlarging his kiosk building and, if there's enough savings, he wants to buy a bus to increase his business in transportation.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise for his kiosk

loans.name: 3.4.297.03.thiệu Phúc Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Tuyến operates a food stall selling eggs. She is requesting a loan to purchase eggs to resell.

Tuyến is 35 years old and she is married with two children. Tuyến is the group leader of the 3.4.297.03.Thiệu Phúc solidarity group, which consists of four members. Tuyến supports her two dependents with her business in Thieu Hoa district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2012, Tuyến joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Tuyến has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Tuyến has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Tuyến hopes for her business to do well, to maintain  a successful business, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase eggs to resell

loans.name: Chuluunbaatar

texts.en:
Chuluunbaatar, 53 years old, lives with his wife and son in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in their own house on a plot of land. Chuluunbaatar has been working as an engineer at a water regulation agency for two years. His wife is a manager at an organization devoted to children's well-being. His son has been working as a trading consultant for an electronics sales company. 

The family's house has deteriorated over the years, and in wintertime winds and storms seep through its walls and windows, chilling the family members to their cores. Chuluunbaatar is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 MNT to purchase building and insulation materials such as bricks, cement, planks, fiberglass, and foam. Using those materials, he will repair and insulate his house. As a result, the family will reduce its coal consumption thus releasing less pollutants, which will have a positive impact on environment. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase building and insulation materials

loans.name: 3.4.298.03.thiệu Phúc Group

texts.en:
Hưng works in agriculture raising poultry and cattle. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby cattle to raise for future sale.

Hưng is 32 years old and married with 3 children. She is the group leader of the 3.4.298.03.Thiệu Phúc solidarity group, which consists of 4 members. Hưng supports 3 dependents with her business in Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Hưng's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is a lack of capital.

Hưng hopes for her business to do well, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seed

loans.name: Marialyn

texts.en:
Marialyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy items such as soap, noodles, eggs, and sugar for her business.

Marialyn has been in this business for 2 years. She earns additional income by offering prepaid mobile loads.

Marialyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy various items to sell

loans.name: 3.9.300.2.thiệu Dương Group

texts.en:
Hương operates a food stall/restaurant where she sells fruit. She is requesting a loan to purchase fruit to resell.

Hương is 38 years old and married with 3 children. She is the leader of the 3.9.300.2 Thiệu Dương solidarity group, which consists of 7 members. 
Hương supports 3 dependents with her business in Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2012, Hương joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Hương has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is a lack of capital. Hương hopes for her business to do well, to maintain a successful business, and to buy land of her own.

loans.use: to purchase fruit to resell

loans.name: Rosa Isabel

texts.es:
Rosa, se le presenta la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo porque requiere de más capital de trabajo para seguir invirtiendo en el negocio de venta de medicina; este le permitirá comprar medicina natural y química, como antibioticos, vitaminas, capsulas, entre otros.
El cliente anterior le ayudo a mejorar sus inventarios y obtener mayores ingresos; las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares se han optimizado.
texts.en: Rosa is in need of a new loan because she requires more working capital to continue investing in her business selling medicine. This loan will permit her to buy natural and pharmaceutical medicines including antibiotics, vitamins and capsules, among other items. A former client helped her to improve her inventory and to obtain larger profits. Her economic situation and her family circumstances have improved.

loans.use: to buy antibiotics, vitamins and capsules, among other items.

loans.name: Soyol-Erdene

texts.en:
Mrs. Soyol-Erdene, 36 years old, lives with her husband in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in their own house on a plot of land. She has been working as a consultant for a beauty cosmetics company and also translates from Chinese to Mongolian for a building company. Her husband has the position of mechanical engineer at the building company. Their daughter currently studies and lives in China.

Mrs. Soyol-Erdene is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 tugriks to purchase building and insulation materials, such as bricks, cement, planks, fiberglass and foam, to renovate their old nearly collapsed house. Using these materials, her husband will repair and insulate their house; thus, creating a comfortable and warm place. More importantly, the renovated house will have a positive impact on the environment – as the family decreases its coal consumption, the pollutants released into the air will reduce linearly. This borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase building and insulation materials

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.ru: Гулнора независимая молодая замужняя женщина. Ей 21 год. У нее пока нету детей. Она живет вместе с мужем и свекровью в районе Хамадони. Её муж работает в комитете по управлению земельными участками, а ее свекровь работает в больнице медсестрой. У Гулноры среднее образование. Она тоже зарабатывает на жизнь и имеет свою долю в обеспечении семьи. Гулнора занимается шитьем национальных женских платьев и принимает заказы у себя дома. Она работает в этой сфере уже 3 года. Гулнора хочет расширить деятельность. Для осуществления мечты ей нужна денежная сумма для приобретения новой швейной машинки, с этой целью она обратилась за кредитом.
texts.en:
Gulnora is an independent, young and married woman. She is 21 years old. She does not yet have any children. She lives together with her husband and mother-in-law in the Hamadoni region. Her husband works in the committee for management of land plots, and her mother-in-law works as a nurse at the hospital. 

Gulnora has secondary education. She also earns money for living and takes her share in supporting the family. Gulnora works with sewing women's national dresses and takes orders at her home. She has been working in this area for three years already. 

Gulnora would like to expand her business. To realize her dreams she needs a sum of money to purchase a new sewing machine. With this aim she applied for a loan.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Mehrob

texts.ru: Мехробу 23 года. Он не женат и живет с родителями. Мехроб успешно окончил среднюю школу. В школьные годы он был одним из лучших учеников. Мехроб данное время является студентом 1 курса Таджикского Государственного Университета. Мехроб учится хорошо и отлично. Он учится по специальности математика и информатика. Мехроб любит такие предметы как информатика, математика, родной язык и т.п. Он должен оплатить за учебный договор, но не имеет денег. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Mehrob is 23 years old. He is not married and lives with his parents. 

Mehrob successfully finished secondary education. He was one of the best students in his year. Mehrob is currently a first-year student at the Tajik State University. He studies hard and well. He studies mathematics and informatics. 

Mehrob loves these kind of courses, such as informatics, mathematics, mother language and similar. He needs to pay for tuition, but does not have any money. He awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To pay for his tuition

loans.name: Rustam

texts.ru: Рустаму 50 лет. Он женат  и имеет 6 детей. Рустам, любимый муж и заботливый отец, а также послушный сын для своих родителей и знаменитый артист среди местного населения. Рустам более 15 лет занимается предоставлением услуги певца на различных мероприятиях местных жителей. Он имеет хороший статус среди местных жителей. Рустам очень любит свою профессию и поэтому всегда старается развевать свой бизнес. Он запрашивает займ для покупки музыкальных инструментов для того, чтобы улучшить качества сервиса. Таким образом, он улучшить качество сервиса и принесет радость в свадьбах и различных мероприятиях местных жителей. Он ждет вашу доброту и обещает погасить займ во время.
texts.en:
Rustam is 50 years old. He is married and has six children. Rustam is a loving husband, attentive father, and further a good son for his parents. He is also a well-known artist among the local population. Rustam has provided services as a singer at the local inhabitants' various events. He has a high status among the local population. 

Rustam loves his profession very much and therefore always tries to develop his business. He requests a loan for the purchase of musical instruments in order to increase the quality of his service. In this way he can increase the quality of his service and bring joy to weddings and other events in the local community. He awaits your kindness and promises to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: To buy musical instruments for his business

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Mildred works hard to support her family. She has a restaurant business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Mildred is borrowing 21,000 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients for her restaurant.

Mildred has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her restaurant

loans.name: Donokhon

texts.ru: Донохон умная и целеустремленная женщина. Ей 41 года. Она замужем и имеет двоих детей. Детям 16 и 5 лет. Так как они не совершеннолетние, они не могут помогать Донохон содержанию семьи. Ее муж Содикджон не имеет большой источник дохода и поэтому Донохон является основной кормилицей в семье. Донохон более 16 лет занимается скотоводством. С бизнесом она справляется сама. Год за годом она усовершенствует свои знания. Дополнительно она работает тренером в стадионе. Она хочет улучшить условию проживания. Уже несколько лет она мечтает купить машину, но она не может сделать сбережения, так как она тратит свои деньги для содержания семьи. Она запрашивает займ в сумме 10000 сомони для покупки машины. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие. Это машина поможет ей по чаще приезжать в город, так как она живет в сельской местности.
texts.en:
Donokhon is a smart and purposeful woman. She is 41 years old. She is married and has two children. The children are 16 and 5 years old. As they are not adults, they cannot help Donokhon support the family. Her husband, Sodikdjon, does not have a large source of income and therefore Donokhon is the single provider of the family. 

Donokhon has worked with livestock breeding for more than 16 years. She manages the business by herself. Year by year, she improves her knowledge. In addition, she works as a coach at the stadium. She would like to improve their living conditions. She has dreamed of buying a car for some years already, but she has not been able to save up money as she has spent her money on supporting the family. 

Donokhon requests a loan of the amount of 10,000 somoni for the purchase of a vehicle. She awaits your kindness and hopes for your charity. This car will help her travel to the city more often, as she lives in a rural area.

loans.use: To buy a car for her household

loans.name: Farogat

texts.ru: Фарогат незамужняя молодая девушка. Ей 22 года. Она вместе с родителями проживает в городе Вахдат. Фарогат после окончания средней школы в возрасте 18 лет начала заниматься торговым бизнесом. Сегодня уже она самостоятельная и независимая девушка. Фарогат работает продавщицей в собственном магазине и уже 4 года как продвигает свой бизнес. Она продает продукты питания и хозяйственные товары. В бизнесе ей помогают родители. Фарогат любит свою работу и старается обслуживать клиентов вежливо и качественно.  Прибыль, получаемый с продажи является единственным источником их семейного дохода. Фарогат запрашивает кредит для закупа товаров, чтобы увеличить ассортимент продуктов.
texts.en:
Farogat is an unmarried young woman. She is 22 years old. She lives in the Vahdat region together with her parents. Farogat started her retail business after finishing secondary education at the age of 18 years. Currently she is already an independent young woman. 

Farogat works as a saleswoman in her own store, and has promoted her business for four years already. She sells food products and household goods. Her parents help her with the business. Farogat loves her work and tries to serve her customers politely and efficiently. The income received from the sale is the only source of income for the family. 

Farogat requests a loan to purchase products in order to increase her assortment.

loans.use: to purchase food products and household goods with an aim to increase turnover

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
This is Merlinda. Her previous loan was a big help to her business for she was able to buy needed products for her variety store. The loan also helped her to meet her household expenditures. She and her husband are helping each other to provide for their everyday needs.

Merlinda would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. She hopes that having more items to sell will result in better profits. Additional profits will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Merlinda dreams of expanding her business. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: 3.9.299.8.thiệu Dương Group

texts.en:
Chinh operates a food stall/restaurant where she sells fruit. She is requesting a loan to purchase fruit to resell.

Chinh is 54 years old and married with 7 children. Six of her children are grown so she supports 1 dependent with her business in Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Chinh has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is a lack of capital.

In 2013, Chinh joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid 1 loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She is the leader of the 3.9.299.8.Thiệu Dương solidarity group, which consists of 4 members.  

With her profit, Chinh hopes to buy land of her own, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase fruit to resell

loans.name: Rocelyn

texts.en:
Rocelyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a restaurant in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients.

Rocelyn has been in the restaurant business for 10 years. She earns additional income from selling dried coconut meat.

Rocelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients

loans.name: 3.9.301.3.thiệu Dương Group

texts.en:
Xuyên works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

Xuyên is 28 years old and she is married with 2 children. She supports 2 dependents with her business in Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Xuyên has been involved in this business for 3 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is a lack of capital.

In 2010, Xuyên joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid 3 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She is the group leader of the 3.9.301.3.Thiệu Dương solidarity group, which consists of 6 members. 

With her profit, Xuyên hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, to maintain a successful business, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise for future sale

loans.name: Byambajav

texts.en: Byambajav, 39 years old, lives with his wife and children in Kherlen, the easternmost city of Mongolia. His family resides in their own house on a plot of land. Byambajav has been working as a road patrol since 2006. His wife provides a taxi service as well as breeding chickens. Byambajav is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to cover the cost of digging a well and building a greenhouse. The well and greenhouse will enable the family to grow their own vegetables instead of buying them from the marketplace. More importantly, plants convert carbon dioxide into oxygen through a process called photosynthesis. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives to improve his family's life.

loans.use: to dig a well and build a greenhouse

loans.name: Roberto

texts.en:
This is Roberto. His previous loan helped him a lot in his farming business. The loan also helped with his household expenditures. He and his wife are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.

He would like to apply for a new 25,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan that he will be utilizing to buy fertilizers, seeds and other tools for the maintenance of the farm. His profits from his business will definitely help him to sustain their daily needs. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Roberto hopes that his farm will continue to expand. As a CCT community partner, he meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week, and this is where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizers, seeds and other tools for the maintenance of the farm.

loans.name: 08-Ts3-02-Phú Sơn2 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Quỳnh operates a food stall/restaurant, selling noodles. She is requesting a loan to purchase pork to make processed food (noodles with pork) for resale. Quỳnh is 31 years old and she is married with two children.

Quỳnh is the group leader of the 08-TS3-02-Phú Sơn2 solidarity group, which consists of six members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with two dependents.

In 2011, Quỳnh joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Quỳnh has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Quỳnh has been involved in this business for five years. The main hardship that Quỳnh faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Quỳnh hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to travel for a vacation within the country.

loans.use: to purchase pork to make processed food (noodles with pork) for resale.

loans.name: Janobiddin

texts.ru: Джанобиддину 27 лет. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Его жена домохозяйка и занимается воспитанием детей. Мать и сестра Джанобиддина тоже живут в его доме. Он является единственным кормильцем большой семьи. Джанобиддин более 9 месяца занимается изготовлением ворот. Он вначале был учеником и обучался техникой изготовления ворот, а теперь он самостоятельно занимается изготовлением и продажи ворот. Он с бизнесом занимается один и имеет свою мастерскую. Помещение его мастерского является арендованным. Он хочет развевать бизнес дальше и поэтому он запрашивает займ на сумму 2300 долларов США для покупки необходимых средств как краски, железа и т.п. для производства больше ворот. Он ждет вашу доброту и обещает погасить займ во время.
texts.en:
Janobiddin is 27 years old. He is married and raising three children. His wife is a housewife and works with raising the children. Janobiddin's mother and sister also live in their house. He is the sole provider of this large family. 

Janobiddin has worked with producing gates for more than 9 months. First he was a student, studying the technique of making gates, and currently he works with producing and selling gates independently. He works alone and has his own workshop. The rooms of his workshop are rented. 

He would like to develop his business further, and therefore he requests a loan in the amount of 2,300 US dollar for the purchase of necessary means such as paint, iron and similar to produce more gates. He awaits your kindness and promises to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: To buy iron, paint and similar, for producing gates

loans.name: Cecilio

texts.es: Cecilio tiene la edad de 40 años, está casado y vive con la esposa. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de abono y dar asistencia a una plantación de café y ayudarse con la mano de obra. El desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al cultivo para que este le permita tener una mayor producción y así tener mayores ingresos económicos.
