El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
40-year old Cecilio is married and lives with his wife. The loan he is seeking will be used to buy manure, help him maintain his coffee plantation, and hire a labourer. He wishes to do some extra work on his fields to give a better yield and increase income.

In the future Cecilio hopes to provide his family with a better standard of living and greater financial stability. He wants to continue growing both as a person and as a coffee producer.  

This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR; he hasn't had any loans with state banks in the past. FUDECOSUR has offered him better credit terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: Buy agricultural supplies

loans.name: Maria Lorenza

texts.es: Gracias por apoyar a María, quien con su credikiva pudo comprar harina, sal, mantequilla al por mayor para la elaboración de los bollos que vende a tiendas y negocios de comidas; también compró una estufa industrial que le permitió mejorar su productividad, y además compró ropa, perfumes, calzado que le solicitaron los clientes. Con esta inversión logró mejorar su nivel de producción, volumen de ventas y liquidez, es decir, mayores ingresos y mejor calidad de vida para su familia. En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo crédito para invertir en la compra al por mayor y al contado de harinas, sal, mantequilla, recipientes, para la elaboración de bollos, y en la compra de ropa, perfumes, calzados y cremas para atender los pedidos de sus clientes. María dice a sus financiadores: “Gracias a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y a KIVA he progresado en mi negocio; espero seguir contando con su apoyo”.
texts.en:
Thanks for supporting María.  With her previous Kiva loan she was able to buy flour, salt, and butter wholesale to make the rolls she sells to stores and food businesses.  She also bought an industrial stove that allowed her to improve her productivity, as well as clothing, perfume, and footwear that her customers had ordered.

With this investment she improved her productivity level, sales volume, and liquidity.  In other words, she had more income and a better quality of life for her family.

Currently she's applying for a new loan to invest in making a wholesale cash purchase of flour, salt, butter, and containers to make rolls.  She's also going to buy clothing, perfume, footwear, and lotions to respond to customer requests.

María says to her lenders: "Thanks to Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and Kiva I have made progress in my business.  I hope to continue having your support."

loans.use: to buy ingredients for rolls and other merchandise

loans.name: Walter

texts.es: Walter tiene la edad de 42 años, está casado y vive con la esposa y un hijo. El crédito lo quiere para la reparación del carro de trabajo. El desea reparar el carro para poder continuar trabajando y poder seguir llevando el sustento a su familia. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir trabajando con el carro en buenas condiciones. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Walter is 42 years old.  He is married and lives with his wife and son.  He wants the loan to repair his work vehicle.  He needs to repair his work vehicle to be able to continue working and to support his family.  Walk hopes to, in the future, offer his family a better quality of life and greater financial stability.  And to keep working with his vehicle in good working order.  This is the first loan that Walter has received from Fudecosur.  He has never before taken a loan from a state bank, but Fudecosur has offered him a loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to fix his work vehicle.

location.town: Bello Oriente, Agua Buena, Coto Brus

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores is 61 years old and has five children.

Dolores works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 14,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like milk, canned goods, eggs, soap, etc., to sell.

Dolores has borrowed and repaid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from mobile prepaid phone load credits.

Dolores aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like milk, canned goods, eggs, soap, etc., to sell.

loans.name: 02.06.01 Đông Hải Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Tâm operates a food stall/restaurant, selling soup. She is requesting a loan to purchase eels to make eel soup to sell. 

Tâm is 50 years old and she is married with one child. She is the group leader of the 02.06.01 Đông Hải Group solidarity group, which consists of six members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with one dependent.

In 2006, Tâm joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Tâm has successfully repaid four loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Tâm has been involved in this business for five years.

The main hardship that Tâm faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Tâm hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her child to do well in school, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase eels to make eel soup to sell.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
This is Rosario, 63, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is already a widow and is continuously working to provide for her daily needs.

Rosario operates a buying and selling business. What she basically does is buy general merchandise from wholesalers to resell with a little profit. Her products are bedsheets, blankets, pillowcases and the like. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many options she offers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy RTW (ready-to-wear) products and merchandise items like bedsheets, blankets and pillowcases to expand her product inventory.

Rosario dreams to expand her business and hopes that her grandchildren will have a good future. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for RTW (ready-to-wear) products and merchandise items like bedsheets, blankets and pillowcases to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Andres

texts.es: El Sr. Andrés  tiene 59 años casado,  se dedica a la venta y fabricación de artesanías el realiza mascaras de diablo y moreno de manera artesanal, estas mascaras son muy solicitadas para distintas danzas que se bailan en fiestas y entradas de carnaval de Oruro y la fiesta de gran poder, el tiene su  puesto de venta que se encuentra en la zona de los Andes,  este préstamo es su primera  secuencia dentro de la institución, El Sr. Andrés  va a usar este préstamo para la compra materiales para la fabricación de sus artesanías,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, El Sr. Andres  va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando materiales y así mejorando sus ingresos, su deseo para su negocio es tener una tienda de artesanía grande y así brindar un  mejor servicio a su clientela,  El Sr. Andres  es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada ya que esta es la única activad ya que por el trabajo manual le toma mucho tiempo y dinero, pero que en ocasiones de fiestas y entradas tiene buen ingreso económico, pero esto es por temporadas.
texts.en:
59-year old Sr. Andrés is married and earns his living making and selling crafts. He makes devil and traditional masks which are much sought after for the dances performed at fiestas such as the Carnaval de Oruro and La Fiesta de Gran Poder. Andrés has a stall in the Los Andes neighbourhood. This is his first loan with the institution.

He plans to use the money to buy craft supplies so he can continue improving his business. Profits will be reinvested in further supplies so that he can improve his income.

Andrés' wish is to have a large craft store and offer an improved service to his customers. He is a very hardworking man who is pleased to have this opportunity for a loan. Making masks by hand is his sole source of income as it is very time-consuming. But at times of fiestas when people wear masks, he has a good income; however, it is seasonal.

loans.use: Buy craft supplies at wholesale prices to make masks

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.es:
Doña Alejandra es una mujer de 53 años de edad, madre de 2 hijos los cuales dependen de ella y su esposo y juntos en familia se involucran en las diferentes actividades que se realizan en la agricultura como ser el desgrane del maíz, la limpieza, lavado, etc. Ella solo curso hasta el 3 grado de la primaria ya que sus padres eran de escasos recursos económicos y no pudieron ayudarla para que ella terminara sus estudios. Ella tiene mucha experiencia ya que practica la agricultura hace más de 33 años y fueron sus padres los que le enseñaron a trabajar la tierra. También tiene un cultivo de café el cual es comercializado en pequeña escala a intermediarios, bodegas y demás que llegan a la zona donde ella habita.

Ella solicita ayuda para dar mantenimiento a sus cultivos de café mediante la compra de insumos entre otros para fertilizar y abonar desde la raíz hasta el grano en su totalidad.

En un futuro ella espera adquirir un pedazo más de tierra poder heredar a sus hijos para que puedan enfrentar los problemas económicos y demás de manera favorable ya que la agricultura es su único medio de ingreso para cubrir las diferentes necesidades que a diario surgen.
texts.en:
Alejandra, 53, is the mother of two dependent children.  She only studied up to the third grade of elementary school because her parents had limited resources and weren't able to help her finish her studies.

She and her husband together with the family are involved in various agricultural activities such as shelling corn, clearing, cleaning, etc.  She has a lot of experience because she has worked in agriculture for more than 33 years.  Her parents taught her to work the land.

She also has a coffee crop that she sells on a small scale to intermediaries, grocery stores, and others who go to the area where she lives.  She's requesting help to take care of her coffee plants by buying inputs to fertilize from the root to the whole bean.

In the future she hopes to acquire another plot of land to be able to leave to her children so they can favorably handle financial and other problems.  Agriculture is her only means to an income to cover the various necessities that come up daily.

loans.use: to buy inputs for her coffee crop

loans.name: Suyapa

texts.es:
Suyapa es una mujer de 41 años de edad, casada, luchadora, emprendedora y madre de 4 hijos de los cuales 2 viven en la casa de ella y están en la primaria. Ella en compañía de su esposo y un hijo mayor se dedican a la agricultura al cultivo y siembra de café y a realizar las diferentes actividades que se presenta  para su mantenimiento. Fueron sus padres los que le enseñaron a trabajar la tierra hace muchos años y con su pareja lo practica hace 10 años y agradecen a DIOS por las tierras que cultivan ya que son propias las cuales están ubicadas a 3 kilómetros de distancia de su casa de habitación.

Ella hoy en día solicita ayuda para la compra de abono y fertilizantes ya que esta en tiempo la cosecha para dar mantenimiento y que sea productivo al final.

Sus planes son los de poder dar el mantenimiento a sus cultivos de café para que el grano sea bien cuidado y de calidad. Sus sueños como madre es ver a sus hijos graduados del colegio, la universidad y verlos realizados con sus hogares, con sus familias.
texts.en:
Suyapa is a 41 year old, hardworking and entrepreneurial woman. She is married and has four children, two of whom currently live at home with her and attend grade school. Together with her husband and an older son, she works in agriculture: cultivating, maintaining, and harvesting coffee. She learned to work the land from her parents many years ago, and now she and her husband have been working at this for 10 years. They are grateful to God that they have their own land, which is located three kilometers from their home. 

Now she is requesting assistance in order to purchase mulch and fertilizer because at this time her crop needs regular maintenance and care in order to achieve its optimum yield come harvest time.

Her plans are to be able to properly maintain and care for her coffee crop so that the beans are well maintained and of good quality. Her goal as a mother is see her children all graduated from high school, college, and creating their own homes and families.

loans.use: purchase supplies for maintaining her coffee crop.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
As a married parent of nine children, Emily works hard to support her family.

She has a rice grains retail business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from tailoring and farming rice. Emily is borrowing 11,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell for her business.

Emily has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell.

loans.name: Gurragchaa

texts.en:
Mr. Gurragchaa, 32 years old, lives with his wife, two daughters and son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in a Mongolian traditional ger (portable felt dwelling) on a plot of land. He has been rendering taxi service to local people for four years, and sometimes, he trades sacks of coal for a living. His wife is a cook at a restaurant. All his children go to high school. 

He is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 MNT (Mongolian tugriks) to purchase furniture such as a door, table and television. The purchasing of furniture will decorate his Mongolian traditional ger and increase the comfort. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for better future.

loans.use: to purchase a door, table and television.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business of buying and selling vegetables in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 29,500 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to purchase additional vegetables to sell for her business.

Nenita has been in this business for 20 years. Nenita earns more income from a general store and farming vegetables.

Nenita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Chand

texts.en:
Chand is a 47-year-old hardworking and honest man. He lives in Lahore, Pakistan, with his family. He manufacture shoes and men's belt buckles. He has been working in this field since 1998, and this is the only source of income for the family. He wants to purchase iron sheets for manufacturing shoes and men's belt buckles. For that, he has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. 

With the profits expected from this loan, he intends to expand his business so that he can eventually construct a small house for his family. He hopes that the loan will be helpful for his business. He is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase iron sheets for manufacturing shoes and men's belt buckles.

loans.name: Danilo

texts.es: Danilo, un hombre emprendedor , tiene 35 años de edad, es casado y vive con su esposa  y tres hijos actualmente, el solicito un préstamo con el anhelo de  comprar insumos como abonos, y fumigantes, el desea dar asistencia a los cultivos de café, con la finalidad de mantenerlas en buenas condiciones durante su desarrollo, para obtener un producto de buena calidad , la única delimitación que este caballero tiene es la falta de dinero  para continuar creciendo, ya que de esta actividad económica dependen para poder salir adelante, por lo que él hace una solicitud  de  crédito , y es el primer  préstamo que ha  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no registra otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja……
texts.en:
Danilo, 35, is an enterprising man.  He's married and lives with his wife and three children.

Currently he requested a loan to buy inputs such as soil amendments and fumigants.  He wants to take care of his coffee plants to keep them in good condition while they grow so he gets a high-quality crop.  His only limitation is that he lacks the money to continue growing.  He depends on this job to be able to get ahead, so he's applying for a loan.

This is his first loan from FUDECOSUR.  He doesn't have other loans in state banks, but FUDECOSUR offered him a loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy inputs

loans.name: Adiyased

texts.en:
Mr. Adiyased, 50 years old, lives with his wife and two sons in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been selling meat at an outdoor market for many years and also renders transportation service to local people using his minivan. His wife is a janitor at a private business entity. 

He is requesting a loan of 7,000,000 MNT (Mongolian tugriks) to purchase building and insulation materials such as bricks, sand, shingles, fiberglass, foam and vacuum insulated windows. Using those materials, his hired house renovators will repair and insulate his house. As a result, the family will live in a comfortable and warm place where they don't need to burn lot of coal in order to heat the house. Reduction in coal consumption has a positive impact on the environment due to less pollutants being released into air. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase building and insulation materials.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Marissa works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling rice grains in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending and farming rice. Marissa is borrowing PHP 29500 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell for her rice grains business.

Marissa has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell

loans.name: Nuevo Fruto Group

texts.es: Este grupo está formado por tres socias emprendedoras una de ellas es Alma tiene 25 años de edad, casada y con dos hijos de 2 y 4 años de edad, su negocio es tener una pulpería en su domicilio, un familiar su tía le ayuda en la  administración del negocio, este crédito lo invertirá en productos como granos básicos arroz, aceite, frijoles, azúcar, medicamentos populares, carne de res, carne de pollo, papel higiénicos, sal, sopas maggi, jabón de baño, jabón de lavar ropa, queso, leche, crema, chiverías, especies, leñas, etc. Hellen tiene 32 años su negocio es la venta de ropa, cosméticos, zapatos y Arli tiene 37 años de edad su negocio es la venta de comida y refrescos naturales.
texts.en:
This group is made up of three entrepreneurial members. One of these members is Alma, who is 25 years old and is married with two two year old children and one four year old child. The business she manages is a grocery store in her home. Her aunt helps her run this business. This loan will be used to purchase inventory such as staple grains like rice, oil, beans, sugar, over-the-counter medications, beef, chicken, toilet paper, salt, soups, soaps, detergents, cheese, milk, cream, yogurt, condiments, firewood, and other items.

Another member, Hellen, is 32 years old. She works selling clothing, cosmetics, and shoes. Arli is 37 years old and works selling food and beverages. 

Este grupo está formado por tres socias emprendedoras una de ellas es Alma tiene 25 años de edad, casada y con dos hijos de 2 y 4 años de edad, su negocio es tener una pulpería en su domicilio, un familiar su tía le ayuda en la  administración del negocio, este crédito lo invertirá en productos como granos básicos arroz, aceite, frijoles, azúcar, medicamentos populares, carne de res, carne de pollo, papel higiénicos, sal, sopas maggi, jabón de baño, jabón de lavar ropa, queso, leche, crema, chiverías, especies, leñas, etc. Hellen tiene 32 años su negocio es la venta de ropa, cosméticos, zapatos y Arli tiene 37 años de edad su negocio es la venta de comida y refrescos naturales.

loans.use: purchase staple grains like rice, oil, beans, sugar, over-the-counter medications, beef, chicken, toilet paper, salt, soups, soaps, detergents, cheese, milk, cream, yogurt, condiments, firewood, and other items.

loans.name: Caridad

texts.en:
Caridad is 52 years old and has seven children. Caridad is married and three of her children are in school.

Caridad is in the agricultural business of piggery in the Philippines. Caridad requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She has been in piggery for 10 years now, and has borrowed 8 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Caridad would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase poultry.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is 30 years old and married with one child. With one child currently in school, Cristina works very hard to provide for the family.

Cristina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 30,000 PHP  (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell in her general store.

Cristina has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as biscuits, soft drinks, candies, sugar, shampoo, etc. 

In the future, Cristina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 33 years old, married and has five children, who are all in school. 

Teresita is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Teresita requested a 13,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and seedlings.

Teresita has been farming vegetables for eight years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Teresita would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seedlings.

loans.name: Faten

texts.en: Faten was born in 1981. She is married and has two sons and one daughter. Her husband is an employee of the government. She brings blankets to her home and sells them. This work has generated better profits for her. Now she is requesting a loan to be able to raise the number of blankets and bed covers she has to expand her business and improve their financial income.

loans.use: to raise the number of blankets and bed covers she has to expand her business.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is 39 years old and married with three children who are all in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Elsie has a food vending business in the Philippines. Elsie requested a 19,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan amount through NWTF to purchase ingredients for her food production business.

Elsie has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Elsie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Maria Erlinda

texts.es:
María Erlinda es una mujer de 33 años de edad, casada y madre de 3 hijos los cuales estudian y junto a la familia también vive una sobrina la cual ayuda al igual que los hijos en las diferentes actividades en el hogar y en el campo. Ella ha practicado la agricultura desde muy pequeña ya que en su familia es una tradición que viene de generación en generación siendo sus padres los que le enseñaron esta actividad a muy temprana edad. El terreno que ella y su familia trabaja lo adquirió mediante una herencia y la otra parte de las ganancias que quedaban fuera de la reinversión en sus cosechas. La tierra que ellos trabajan está a 45 minutos de su casa a la cual se trasladan en vehículo diariamente para su asistencia.

Ella ha solicitado ayuda para mejorar sus cosechas mediante la compra de fertilizantes y otros insumos que hacen de sus cultivos más seguros y confiables para su venta final.

Su meta es que cada cosecha que ella produce sea la mejor de la zona atrayendo clientes y pudiendo vender en su totalidad el grano recolectado. Sus sueños es sacar a sus hijos adelante logrando apoyarlos con sus estudios para que puedan enfrentarse a los diferentes retos en la vida con facilidad y seguridad.
texts.en:
María Erlinda is a 33-year old woman, married with three school-aged children. A niece also lives with the family and helps with household and farm chores just like the rest of her children. Ever since she was a young girl María has helped in the fields, continuing a family tradition passed down through the generations. Her parents taught her about farming while she was still a child.

The land that María and her family farm came to her through an inheritance and money that remained after reinvesting in their coffee crop. It is located about 45 minutes from their house by vehicle, a journey they make daily.

María is seeking a loan to buy fertilizer and other supplies to improve their crops and ensure they have a viable harvest to sell. Her goal is to have the best harvest in the area so as to attract customers and sell all that is produced. Her dreams are to help her children get ahead by providing them with a good education so they can overcome easily and safely the challenges in their lives.

loans.use: Buy fertilizer and other supplies for her coffee plants

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en:
Georgina is 49 years old and married with three children.

Georgina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Georgina has borrowed and repaid 23 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 21 years and also earns an income from E-loading (prepaid mobile loading).

Georgina aspires to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Hadeel

texts.en: Hadeel is 21 years old. She is single and the oldest of all her brothers and sisters. She is studying IT and seeking to finish her studies, so that she can  start working to earn income and improve the financial situation of her family. Now, she is requesting a loan to be able to pay for her semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for her semester fees.

loans.name: Madilyn

texts.en:
Madilyn is 35 years old and married with two children.

Madilyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Madilyn has borrowed and repaid 14 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income from selling clothing.

Madilyn aspires to save money to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es: Silvia  tiene  33  años de edad, esta divorciada  y vive con la mama y dos hijos actualmente. Ella con crédito pretende comprar  insumos como abonos, fumigantes, y a su vez ayudarse con la mano de obra. Ella piensa dar mantenimiento a las plantaciones, para que este no sufra ningún daño, y no se pierda la producción, y así con su proyecto cafetalero poder generar más ganancias para contribuir con su familia, ella no cuenta con el capital necesario para dicha compra, ya que es de bajos recursos y no tiene como adquirir el dinero necesario para esto, por lo que el solicito un crédito, y es el primer  préstamo que ha  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja……
texts.en: Silvia, 33, is divorced and lives with her mother and children. With the loan, she hopes to buy fertilizers, fumigation and also hire laborers. She would like to care for her coffee plantations so they don't suffer any damage that may cause her to lose production and that way generate more income for her family. She doesn't have the capital, the recourses or the means to get the money she needs to make these purchases, so she's soliciting a loan. This is her first loan with FUDECOSUR. She's never had a loan with a state bank, but she's able to get one with FUDECOSUR more easily and at a much lower interest rate...

loans.use: buy supplies.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia works hard to support her family. Delia is married and has a egg vending business in the Philippines. Delia requested a PHP 15,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. to buy more trays of eggs to sell.

Delia has been in this business for 15 years now.

Delia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more trays of eggs to sell

loans.name: Leizel

texts.en:
Leizel is 41 years old and married with four children, who are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Leizel has a fishing business in the Philippines. Leizel requested a 13000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy fishing materials for the repair of her fishing boat.

Leizel has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Leizel would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials for the repair of her fishing boat.

loans.name: Hamoud

texts.en: Hamoud is a 26-year-old who lives in Sana'a, Yemen. He used to own a bus then he saved a small amount of money and borrowed additional money from his relatives to buy a taxi. He has been offering taxi transportation services to and from his city for some time now, and his work has kept him increasingly busy. He applied for a youth loan of 200,000 YER from AMB to buy spare parts for his taxi. With this loan, he wishes to improve his family's pleasant life.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his taxi

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 51 years old and married with one kid. She works very hard to provide for them.

Nancy runs a general store in the Philippines. She requested a loan of 18,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell. Nancy has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as rice, canned goods, soft drinks, and other groceries. 

In the future, Nancy would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 18,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

Teresita has been in this business for eight years. She earns additional income by selling ice cream.

Teresita has sustained her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
This is Cecilia, 50, resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Ernesto, a farmer, and she is a mother to her children. She and her husband manage their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.
 
Cecilia operates an ornamental plant business. She grows garden plants that are native to the Philippines such as ylang-ylang, golden shower, dahlias, a variety of hanging plants, and others. Her regular customers are local tourists, neighbors, and the nearby community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 300 in sales every day.

To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 13,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy gardening materials and supplies such as seed and fertilizer needed in her business. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business.  

Cecilia hopes to expand her business. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for gardening materials and supplies such as seed and fertilizer needed in her business.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en: Mahmoud is 22 years old and lives in Baqaa’, Jordan. He requests a loan to be able to pay his semester fees and continue his course of study. Mahmoud will then be able to work after he finishes school and earn income.

loans.use: to pay his semester fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy hard woods in making charcoal as well as feed for her hogs

loans.name: Narlie

texts.en:
This is Narlie. She previously accessed an 8,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan that she used to buy spare parts and accessories and pay for the maintenance of her tricycle unit. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for a new 10,000 PHP loan for her to buy spare parts and pay for the maintenance of her tricycle unit. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Narlie dreams to give her children a good life and a future. She hopes to have another unit of tricycle. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts and maintenance of her tricycle unit.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana lives in the Litein area of Kenya. She has six children and has been doing this work for 15 years. Her primary income sources are milk and tea.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: "Farming." Her biggest challenge is cultivating. An animal on the farm has been given the names of Mo.

Juliana was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: "Grace period." This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: "Repayment period."

Her highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked how this loan would benefit her family, Juliana replied  that it will give them better living standards.

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Juliana owns a cow and poultry, but does not own a pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle or automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household a mosquito net and TV, but does not have electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine or a DVD.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Nawaz

texts.en:
Nawaz is a 56-year-old married man. He is an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. He lives in Lahore, Pakistan, with his family. He has a large family size consisting of four sons and five daughters. 

Since 1992, Nawaz has been in the business of selling milk, which is the only source of income for the family. Currently, he is interested in purchasing one buffalo to grow his business, but due to financial constraints, he finds it difficult. 

Nawaz has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. This will not only help him to grow his milk selling business but it will increase his net income and savings as well. He hopes to provide quality education for his children. He is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase a buffalo for his milk selling business.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 12,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food business.

Violeta successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is listing Violate's business profile in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
Fely works hard to support her family. Fely is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Fely requested a 11,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc., to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Fely has been in this business for 15 years now.

In the future, Fely would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Gilberth

texts.es: Gilberth, un hombre emprendedor , tiene 24 años de edad, es casado y vive con su esposa  y una hija actualmente, el solicito un préstamo con el anhelo de  comprar materiales para el apiario , con la finalidad de mantener en buenas condiciones las abejas, para obtener un producto de buena calidad ,y una mayor producción , la única delimitación que este caballero tiene es la falta de dinero  para continuar creciendo, ya que de esta actividad económica dependen para poder salir adelante, por lo que él hace una solicitud  de  crédito , y es el primer  préstamo que ha  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no registra otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja
texts.en: Gilberth, 24, is a married businessman who lives with his wife and daughter. He's soliciting a loan with the hope to buy materials for his apiary so he can keep his bees in good condition and thus obtain a high-quality product and increase production. The only limit he has is a lack of capital that he needs to continue growing his business, as he depends on this economic activity to get ahead. That is why he is requesting this loan, his first loan with FUDECOSUR. He has not applied for any loans with a state bank, but he can obtain one much easier with FUDECOSUR and with a lower interest rate.

loans.use: buy materials to maintain his honey bees.

loans.name: Beatriz Elena

texts.es:
Beatriz de 37 años de edad. Se dedica a la venta de productos por catálogo y mercancía desde su casa a vecinos y familiares, actividad con la que ha logrado sostener su hogar. En la actualidad busca mejorar su situación económica por lo cual se encuentra solicitando un crédito que destinará en la compra de ropa y accesorios con el fin de aumentar sus ingresos. Sueña con tener un gran almacén y posicionarlo en el mercado local. 
Asegura que gracias a su actividad ha mejorado su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Beatriz, 37 years old, sells products and merchandise by catalog out of her home to neighbors and family, a business that has allowed her to support her household. She is currently looking to improve her financial situation, which is why she finds herself requesting a loan that will be used to purchase clothes and accessories, with the goal of increasing her income. She dreams of having a large store that she will locate in the local market.

She assures us that thanks to her business, she has improved her quality of life.

loans.use: purchase clothes and accessories.

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es: Carlos de 45 años de edad, presta desde hace varios años el servicio de montallantas y arreglo de vehículos en un local del municipio de Rionegro, Colombia. Actividad que se ha constituido en la fuente de ingresos para su familia y educación para sus tres hijos. En la actualidad se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de un compresor y herramientas de mano. Con el fin de mejorar la calidad en el servicio y generar mayores ganancias que el permitirá garantizarle a su familia una vida digna.
texts.en: Carlos, 45 years old, has worked for some time servicing tires and fixing cars in a shop in the municipality of Rionegro, Colombia. This business has been the source of income for his family and paid for his three children's education. He currently finds himself requesting a loan that will be invested in the purchase of an air compressor and hand tools, with the goal of improving the quality of his service and generating better revenues that will allow him to guarantee his family a dignified life.

loans.use: purchase an air compressor and hand tools.

loans.name: Apolinaria

texts.en:
This is Apolinario. She previously accessed a 15,000 PHP loan that she used to buy spare parts and accessories, and pay for the maintenance of her jeepney unit. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, household, and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan for her to buy spare parts and pay for the maintenance of their jeepney unit. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Apolinaria dreams to have more jeepneys. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week, and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

-Jeepneys are the most popular means of public transportation in the Philippines. They were originally made from US military jeeps left over from World War II and are known from their flamboyant decoration and crowded seating. Filipino ingenuity, however, managed to see this vehicle as an opportunity to earn, and modified the Jeep into a 20-seater jeepney, open enough to provide adequate ventilation, sturdy for every day travel, and cheap enough to buy and maintain. They have become a ubiquitous symbol of Philippine culture. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the spare parts and maintenance of her jeepney unit.

loans.name: Lani

texts.en:
A 31-year-old married woman, Lani works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending. Lani is borrowing 27,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional materials to repair her fishing boat.

Lani has sustained her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream of building and expanding her business in order to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials to repair her fishing boat

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
This is Alma. She previously accessed a loan of 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) that she used buy more fish, pork, and vegetables. Her earnings were a big help for her childrens' educations and in her personal, household, and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan to purchase fish, pork, chicken, and vegetables. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Alma dreams that her business will continue to be successful and hopes to have good health. She meets with her co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of her life and business, and to draw strength and inspiration from the group and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fish, pork, chicken, and vegetables needed in her business.

loans.name: Randal

texts.es: Randal tiene la edad de 39 años, está casado y vive con la esposa. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de abono y dar asistencia a una plantación de cafe. El desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al cultivo para que este le permita tener una mayor producción y así tener mayores ingresos económicos. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Randal, 39, is married and lives with his wife. He is soliciting a loan to buy fertilizer and maintain a coffee plantation. He'd like to provide adequate maintenance to his crop so in order to improve production and thus increase his income. He hopes that in the future he can provide his family a better quality of life and a stable economic situation, as well as continue to grow as a person and as a producer. This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR. He has not applied for any loans with a state bank, but he is able to obtain one with FUDECOSUR more easily and with a lower interest rate.

loans.use: buy supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase basic materials and ingredients (guava, sugar, wrappings).

loans.name: Eden

texts.en:
Eden is a married woman with ten children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Eden is 39 years old and has three children who are in school.

Eden has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Eden requested a PHP 12000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

Eden has been in this business for 15 years; she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Fanny Yaneth

texts.es: Fanny de 36 años es una mujer entregada a su familia, motivo que la impulsa a compartir la mayor parte del tiempo con su hijo de 15 años de edad. Labora como auxiliar de enfermería en el hospital de su localidad, actividad que alterna con la venta de productos por catálogo con el fin de mejorar las condiciones económicas de su hogar. Manifiesta que su gran sueño es montar una tienda dedicada a la venta de productos de belleza y aseo personal, con el fin de tener más tiempo para su familia. Se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de surtido, con el fin de mejorar sus ingresos y reunir el dinero para acceder a una vivienda.
texts.en: Fanny, at 36 years old, is a woman dedicated to her family because she is motivated to spend the majority of her time with her 15-year-old son. She works as a nursing assistant in the hospital in her area, a job she alternates with catalogue sales with the goal of improving the economic conditions of her household. She states that her biggest dream is to start a store selling beauty and personal products so that she has more time for her family. She is requesting a loan that she will invest in the purchase of merchandise, with the goal of improving her earnings and collecting money to get a house.

loans.use: to buy beauty and personal products

loans.name: Marylin

texts.en:
This is Marylin, 48, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is a businesswoman and a mother. She and her husband, Ronildo, manage their household while operating the business. She works hard to keep providing income for their everyday expenses. 

Marylin operates an ornamental plant business. She grows garden plants that are native to the Philippines, like ylang-ylang, golden shower, and dahlias as well as a variety of hanging plants. Her regular customers are local tourists, neighbors, and the nearby community. She earns a minimum of PHP 300 in sales every day.

To help her continue to operate her business, she is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000. She will use the loan to buy fertilizer and garden supplies for her business.

Marylin hopes to expand her business. She meets up with other fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet every week. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer and garden supplies for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase basic materials (wool, thread, beads, and trinkets).

loans.name: Dúo Kairos Group

texts.es: Dúo Kairos, este grupo esta conformado por la señora Maria Etelvina, ella se dedica a la elaboracion y venta de tejidos tipicos se ha dedica a esta actividad desde hace varios años, esta solicitando este credito para la compra de materia prima para la elaboracion de tejidos tipicos.
texts.en: Dúo Kairos is a group made up by Mrs. Maria Etelvina. She is dedicated to weaving and selling traditional cloths, and she has been pursuing this activity for many years. She is requesting a loan to buy raw materials to weave traditional cloths.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to weave traditional cloths by hand

loans.name: Ayda

texts.en:
Ayda was born in 1976. She is married and has 6 daughters. Her husband works as a cleaner at the government building. 

She brings blankets to homes to sell.  She is requesting a loan to increase the quantity of blankets and add more bed covers to expand her business; this is to earn a better income, and to give her children a better life.

loans.use: to increase the quantity of blankets and add more bed covers to expand her business.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mercedes is a widowed woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Mercedes is 45 years old and has two children who are in school.

Mercedes has a tailoring business in the Philippines. Mercedes requested a 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan amount through NWTF to buy additional materials like fabric, threads, etc., for her business.

Mercedes has been in this business for 15 years. Mercedes would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like fabric, threads, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Carlos Eduardo

texts.es:
Carlos es un joven de 19 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica con su esposa y suegros, a quienes agradece a todo su apoyo, Carlos es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por salir adelante; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Carlos no ha podido estudiar la carrera profesional de Ingeniería Mecánica que desea, en sus ratos libres le gusta preparar postres para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Carlos trabaja como obrero de campo en un fundo agrícola de su ciudad, el realiza labores de arado, sembrado, cosecha y otros, Carlos trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 10 horas, el se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Carlos se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá cubrir los gastos del tramite documentario para la obtención del título de propiedad de un pequeño terreno, el cual será destinado para la construcción de su vivienda, así pues Carlos seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener una vivienda segura y adecuada.
texts.en:
Carlos is a young man of 19 years. He lives in the city of Ica with his wife and in-laws, to whom is is grateful for all of their support. Carlos is a very friendly, hardworking, and enthusiastic person who puts all his effort into succeeding. Unfortunately, because of lack of resources and because he needs to work, Carlos has not been able to study for a professional career in mechanical engineering they way he wants. In his free time, he likes to make desserts to share with his family.

Of his own initiative and with great tenacity and dedication, Carlos works as a field-hand on a farm in his city. He does work such as plowing, planting, harvesting, etc. Carlos works every day from the very early hours of the morning, and he is able to keep this up for approximately 10 hours. He is pleased to work, and he believes that he is doing well because of his good performance and because he treats those around him with friendliness.

Carlos is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, because thanks to the help given, he will be able to cover the paperwork-processing costs for obtaining the property title to a small piece of land, which is destined for building his home upon it. Therefore, Carlos will continue to work and exert himself to achieve his greatest dream of having a stable and suitable home.

loans.use: cover expenses for his property title.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a compressor and paint

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en: Elsie is 41 years old and married, with three children who are all in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Elsie has a general store in the Philippines. She has request a loan of PHP 23,000 through NWTF to buy candies, bread, sardines, and other groceries. Elsie has been in this business for nine years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to more candies, bread, sardines, and other groceries.

loans.name: Surenbaatar

texts.en: Surenbaatar, 52 years old, lives with his wife and son in Kherlen, the easternmost city of Mongolia. They live in their own house on a plot of land. Surenbaatar has worked for sixteen years as an engineer at a private business entity. Now he is a consultant in engineering for several companies. His wife is a manager, and his son is a sentry at a police department. Using his previous loan, he renovated his house, but some parts of the house are still vulnerable to rain, snow, storms, and frosts. He is requesting a loan of MNT 6,000,000 to buy vacuum-insulated windows, hardwood floors, and shingles for the roof. After installing vacuum windows, hardwood floors, and shingles, the heat loss through the windows, floors, and roof will decrease, and the family will begin to burn less coal. This will reduce the pollutant release into the atmosphere. The borrower is a very hardworking person who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to buy vacuum-insulated windows, hardwood floors, and shingles.

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina is 40 years old and married with three children.

Divina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 23,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, chips, soap, bread, etc.

Divina has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from a restaurant.

Divina aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, chips, soap, bread, etc.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary lives in the Litein area of Kenya. She has six children and has been doing farming for nine years.  Her primary income sources are milk and eggs.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: "Selling farm produce." Her biggest challenge is cultivating. An animal on the farm has been given the name of Papa.

Mary was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: "It offers a grace period." This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: "Interest is affordable."

Her highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked how this loan will benefit her family, Mary replied that it would provide a better education for her children.

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Mary owns the following: cow and poultry, but does not own a pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle or automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household a mosquito net and TV, but does not have electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine or a DVD.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Maha

texts.en: Maha was born in 1979. She has two children. She took training courses in hairdressing and is currently working as a certified hairdresser at her rented salon. She is now requesting a loan to expand her salon and add more hairdressing chairs to improve her income.

loans.use: to add more hairdressing chairs.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
This is Virginia. She previously accessed a 40,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan that she used to buy more fruits and products for her variety store. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for a new 10,000 PHP loan for her to purchase more fruits, vegetables and grocery items for her variety store. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Virginia dreams that her business will continue to be successful and hopes to have a happy family. She meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and this is where she also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional fruits, vegetables and grocery items needed in her variety store.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
This is Erlinda. She previously accessed a 15,000 PHP loan that she used to buy spare parts, accessories and for the maintenance of their tricycle unit. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan for her to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of their tricycle unit. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Erlinda hopes that her business will continue to grow. She meets every week with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the word of God that she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and maintenance on their tricycle unit.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling rice grains in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to buy additional stock of rice grains to sell for her business. Lorna has been in this business for 4 years. Lorna earns additional income from selling vegetables and farming rice.

Lorna has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of rice grains to sell.

loans.name: Winny

texts.en:
Winny lives in the Litein area of Kenya, which houses a campus of Mt. Kenya University. She has four children and has been doing this work for nine years. Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, and tea.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: "Selling products!" Her biggest challenge is "cultivating." Animals on the farm have been given the names of "Kaiu."

We asked Winny why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied, "Meetings with officers." We also asked her what she learned during Juhudi's required microfinance training session. She said, "Grace period."

Her highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked "How will this loan benefit your family?" Winny replied that she will educate her children better.

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Winny owns a cow and poultry, but does not own a pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, or automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure how this loan changes the borrower's standard of living. This borrower has: "mosquito net, TV," but does not have: "electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine, or DVD player."

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.
